, &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">chiterapratisankramayastadakarapattausvabuddhisanvedanam<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">drashtridrishyoparaktan\nchittan sarvartham<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">tadasankhyeyavasanachitram\napi pararthan sanhatyakaritvat<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">visheshadarshin\naatmabhavabhavanavinivrittih<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">tada vivekanimnan\nkaivalyapragbharan chittam<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">tachchhidreshu\npratyayantarani sanskarebhyah<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">hanam esham\nkleshavaduktam<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">prasankhyanepyakusidasy\nsarvathavivekakhyaterdharmameghah samadhih<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">tatah\nkleshakarmanivrittih<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">tada\nsarvavarannamalapetasyjnanasyaanantyajgyeyam alpam<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">tatah kritarthanan\nparinamakramapari samaptirgunanam<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">kshannapratiyogi\nparinamaparantanigrarhyah kramah</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">purusharthashoonyanan\ngunanan pratiprasavahkaivalyan, svaroopapratishtha va chitishaktireti<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">3.16 --- parinamatrayasanyamadatitanagatajnanam</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">By mastery of the three\ntransformations of nature (dharma), quality (laksana) and condition (avastha),\nthrough samyama on the nirodha, samadhi, and ekagrata states of consciousness,\nthe yogi acquires knowledge of the past and future. </span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Patanjali explains the\nproperties of yoga, commonly known as supernatural powers, which increase by\ntransformations of consciousness. In III.14, the words santa (appeasement),\nudita (generation) and avyapade-M (non-manifestation) were used for the past,\npresent and future. III.15 speaks of the order of sequence from the source\n(dharmi), involving time and effort for transformation. By following this\norder, the sadhaka observes the natural flow of the present moving into the\npast, to manifest later as the future, and thereby earns mastery over time. In\nthis sutra, Patanjali begins to identify the accomplishments which come to the\naspirer who has advanced in yogic discipline. The first is the awareness of\ntime. The yogi's consciousness has transcended the frontier of time - he sees\ntime as ever flowing. Hence he has knowledge of past and future. (Present time\nis deliberately not mentioned, because its presence is felt). He perceives the\norderly sequence of the present slipping into the past, and rolling towards the\nfuture; he knows time, its meaning and its impact. The supposed supernatural\npowers, discussed from III.16 to III.50, are confirmation that the sadhaka's\nyoga practices are accurate. He is advised to intensify them with sustained\nfaith and enthusiasm and to be indifferent towards his achievements, so as to\navoid deteriorating into affliction, fluctuation and self-gratification.By\nsamyama on the three-fold changes in form, time, and characteristics, there\ncomes knowledge of the past and future. Witnessing transitions tells the past\nand future: If you know the current state of the transformations related to\nform, time, and characteristics (3.13), then you also have an understanding of\nthe past from which they evolved, and the future towards which they are\nevolving. The question is the degree to which you have clarity about the\ncurrent moment of these three. The wise yogi does not seek out such powers, but\nrecognizes that they come along the way. He does NOT run after semen retention\n( like pervert Gandhi sleeping with underage girls &nbsp;) but allows it to come to him naturally.&nbsp; By practicing samyama on the three stages of\nevolution comes knowledge of past and future. By mastery of the three\ntransformations of nature (dharma), quality (laksana) and condition (avastha),\nthrough samyama on the nirodha, samadhi, and ekagrata states of consciousness,\nthe yogi acquires knowledge of the past and the future. A yogi develops 6<sup>th</sup>\nsense of supreme intuition.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The psychic ( unlike a\nschizophrenic ) has a clear boundary between the real physical world and the\ninvisible world.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">kashic record\u2014every thing that has ever\nhappened in the universe is held in a vast library of the cosmic memory.&nbsp; Anyone who can tune in can access this memory\nbank. , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">3.17--- shabdarthapratyayanam\nitaretaradhyasat sankarah tatpravibhagasanyamat sarvabhootarutajnanam</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Words, objects and\nideas are superimposed, creating confusion; by samyama, one gains knowledge of\nthe language of all beings. </span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Conventional usage of a\nword, its fundamental meaning, content and feeling may all coincide, or may be\nconfused due to intermixture or super-imposition. The same word may communicate\naltogether different meanings in another language. A perfect yogi acquires\naccurate knowledge of the meaning and feeling of any sound or word, in any\nlanguage produced by any being. One does not commonly differentiate between a\nword, its original purpose and meaning, and its contemporary usage; they are\nstudied by those of average intellect to coincide. An educated intellect,\nhowever, may penetrate deeply to understand just what is communicated by the\nsound, meaning and sense of a word. A gifted yogi intuitively perceives and\nprecisely distinguishes the meaning and feeling of each word or sound uttered\nby any living being, according to how they express themselves. By making\nsamyama on the sound of a word, one's perception of its meaning, and one's\nreaction to it -- three things which are ordinarily confused -- one obtains\nunderstanding of all sounds uttered by living beings. One very practical\nexample of the relationship between name, object, and conceptual existence is\nthat of mantra. With mantra, one starts with the word or phrase itself,\nallowing the others to gradually become revealed. One might have a definition\nof sorts, but the real meaning comes in direct experience. Then comes the clarity\nof the distinction, as the subtler spiritual significance of the mantra stands\nalone. &nbsp;Suppose I hear a word; there is\nfirst the external vibration, next the internal sensation carried to the mind\nby the organ of hearing, then the mind reacts, and I know the word. The word I\nknow is a mixture of the three, vibration, sensation, and reaction. Ordinarily\nthese three are inseperable; but by practice the Yogi can separate them. When a\nman has attained to this, if he makes a Samyama on any sound, he understands\nthe meaning which that sound was intended to express, whether it was made by man\nor by any other animal.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">3.18---</span> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">sanskarasakshatkaranat\npoorvajatijnanam</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Through direct\nperception of his subliminal impressions, the yogi gains knowledge of his\nprevious lives. </span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The yogi is able to\nrecall the impressions of past incarnations which have influenced his present\nlife. In the continuity of life, instinct, memory and desire play significant\nroles. Memory belongs to the subconscious mind, and the fruits of cravings\n(pains and pleasures experienced in the present life as a result of good and\nbad actions in past lives) to the unconscious.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">When a yogi is free\nfrom every instinct and desire, he sees directly, independent of memory, and of\nfeelings of joy or sorrow. Through intuition, in the orderly sequence of time,\nhe actually sees his past lineage and future status, and also the lives of others.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Samskaras lead to\nkarma: The samskaras originally led to our karma, and because of this the yogi\nwants to examine and eventually eliminate those samskaras.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Past life regression\ncan create further bondage: To a typical person seeking past life regression,\nthere is a seeking out of a replay in the inner field of mind, so as to\nincrease knowledge about ourselves. This is the coming through into the\nconscious state of the inner process from the subtle mind. It can have the\neffect of increasing ego and ignorance, as it leads one to think that these\npast memories are part of our self-definition. In effect, bondage of ignorance\nis increasing, not decreasing.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Samyama on the\nsamskaras brings freedom: However, to the yogi doing samyama </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">on these deeper samskaras themselves (deep\nimpressions), there comes increasing clarity about the way the samskaras have\nclouded the self-identity and obscured Self-realization. Thus, these past\nidentities are not reinforced, but are attenuated </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">and set aside. They are not seen as\nself-identities, but as incorrectly perceived false identities. This leads to\nlesser bondage and greater freedom.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Attainments and\nobstacles: As with the other subtle experiences this is seen to be both an\nattainment and an obstacle, and is set aside with non-attachment .&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">By making samyama on\nprevious thought-waves, one obtains knowledge of one's past lives.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Samyama on one's\ntendencies and habits will lead one to their origins. Consequently one gains\ndeep knowledge of one's past.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Through the direct\nperception of the latent impressions (samskaras) comes the knowledge of\nprevious incarnations.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Samskara is known as\n\"residual potency\" also. When all Vrittis or thoughts die away, the\nframe of the mind remains with the Samskaras. This is termed the Potential\nMind. In Vedantic parlance, it is called Antahkarana Matra.</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">A\nchild is born with his Samskaras. A child is born with his past experiences\ntransmuted into mental and moral tendencies and powers. By experiences,\npleasant and painful, man gathers materials and builds them into mental and\nmoral faculties. The earthly experiences are worked up into intellectual\nfaculty. The mind evolves through the impressions received from the universe\nthrough the senses. It will take many bodies till it gathers the complete\nexperience of the world. Every man is born with his inborn or inherent\nSamskaras and these Samskaras are embedded, lodged or imprinted in the Chitta. All\nSamskaras lie dormant in the Chitta as latent activities, not only of this life\nbut of all previous innumerable lives from Anadi Kala (beginningless time).&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">In human life, only\nthose Samskaras which are appropriate to that particular type of birth will\noperate and come to play. The other kinds of Samskaras will remain concealed\nand dormant.</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The nature of desires and thoughts depends upon the\nnature of your Samskaras.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">By doing a\npilgrimage to Sabarimala ( proper &nbsp;41 day VRAT ) , past soul samskaras causing phobias\nand persistent vices in current life are burnt.</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/01/sabarimala-makaravilakku-three-light.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/01/sabarimala-makaravilakku-three-light.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The aim of a\nSadhaka is to fry out or burn or obliterate all these Samskaras through Nirbija\nSamadhi. Sadhana consists in wiping out the Samskaras. Breathing, hearing,\nseeing, feeling, tasting, smelling-all cause Samskaras or latent Smriti in the\nmind. The world enters the mind through the eyes, ears, tongue (speech) and old\nSamskaras. If you remain in seclusion, you can shut out the first three doors.\nThrough Vichara (right enquiry of Supreme Self), you can destroy the fourth\nroute. Then, Jnana (Knowledge of Self) will dawn. A Jnani is without Samskaras.\nThey are fried out by Jnana. No doubt, the force of the Samskaras remains in\nthe Antahkarana. But they are harmless. They will not bind the Jnani.</span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">3.19--- pratyayasy\nparachittajnanam</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">He acquires the ability\nto understand the minds of others. </span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Through his purity of\nconsciousness, the yogi directly realises the nature of his own mind and\nconsciousness, and also that of others. Pratyaya means perceiving the content\nof the mind.. By mastery over his own mind and consciousness, the yogi develops\nan extrasensory perception and can read the minds of others. By samyama on the\nnotions or presented ideas comes knowledge of another's mind.We, as inner\nobserver, are actually watching the inner screen of our own mind field. Whether\nwe are talking about the thought process of another person, or the data brought\nin through the eyes, ears, or other senses, that information is imprinted on\nour own field of mind, somewhat like a movie is projected on a screen. Then,\nwe, as the inner observer, experience the presentation on that screen. By\nsamyama on the distinguishing signs of others' bodies, knowledge of their\nmental images is obtained. Samyama on the changes that arise in an individual's\nmind and their consequences develops in one the ability to acutely observe the\nstate of mind of others.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">3.20---&nbsp;&nbsp; na cha tat salambanan,tasyavishayibhootatvat</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">A yogi who is able to\nread the minds of others in general, can also, if necessary, exactly identify\nspecific contents which are beyond the reach of the mind. </span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He would not know the\ncontents of the mind by making a Samyama on the body. There would be required a\ntwofold Samyama, first on the signs in the body, and then on the mind itself.\nThe Yogi would then know everything that is in that mind.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">3.21---&nbsp;&nbsp; kayaroopasanyamat tadgrahyashaktistambhe chakshuhprakashasanprayogentardhanam</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">By control over the\nsubtle body, the yogi can suspend at will the rays of light radiating from\nhimself, so that he becomes invisible to onlookers. He may again make himself\nvisible by bringing back the power of perceptibility.</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The lack of contact\n(samprayoga) between the light and vision has to do with the light coming from\nthe yogi\u2019s form and vision beam which emanates from the person who searches psychically\nor physically for him. Sometimes a yogi can sit right next to a person and that\nperson cannot realize that the yogi is by his side. If one makes samyama on the\nform of one's body, obstructing its perceptibility and separating its power of\nmanifestation from the eyes of the beholder, then one's body becomes invisible.&nbsp; The yogi is not adding the quality of\ninvisibility; rather he is withdrawing the quality of see-ability.. He does not\nreally vanish, but he will not be seen by anyone. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">A chained Apollonius\njust disappeared into thin air , from the Roman Emperor Domitian\u2019s crowded court-- &nbsp; never to be\nseen anymore.</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/04/apollonius-or-jesus-christ-who-is-real.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/04/apollonius-or-jesus-christ-who-is-real.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">3.22---&nbsp;&nbsp; etena shabdadyantardhanamuktam</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">In the similar manner\nas described above, he is able to detain sound, smell, taste, form and touch. </span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The results of actions\nmay be immediate or delayed. Samyama on this can give one the ability to\npredict the course of future actions and even his own death.&nbsp; In the same way as described in relation to\nsight (3.21), one is able to suspend the ability of the body to be heard,\ntouched, tasted, or smelled.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">3.23---&nbsp;&nbsp; sopakraman nirupakraman cha karma\ntatsanyamad aparantajnanam,arishtebhyo va</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The effects of action\nare immediate or delayed. By sarhyama on his actions, a yogi will gain\nfore-knowledge of their final fruits. He will know the exact time of his death\nby portents / signs ( arishta )</span></i> .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The fruits of action\n(karmaphala) are related to time (kala phala). If a piece of wet cloth is fully\nspread out, it dries quickly; if folded or rolled up, it takes a long time to\ndry. Likewise, the fruits of action may be felt immediately or at a later time.\nSahcita karma, prarabdha karma and kriyamana karma, are three types of actions\nwhich bear fruit. The first is the merit or demerit compiled from former lives.\nThe second refers specifically to the good or bad actions which have shaped\none's present life. The third one generates by one's actions in this life. The\neffects of kriyamana karma are to come later - one can hence assume that\nPatanjali has included kriyamana karma and sancita karma in the category of\nnirupakrama, and prarabdha karma in sopakrama. Karmas are of two kinds: quickly\nmanifesting and slowly manifesting. By samyama on them, or on the portents of\ndeath, the knowledge of the time of death is obtained.By samyama on his\nactions, a yogi will gain foreknowledge of their final fruits. Different\nqualities such as friendliness, compassion, and contentment can be inquired\ninto through samyama. Thus, one can learn how to strengthen a chosen quality.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">3.24---&nbsp;&nbsp; maitryadishu balani</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">He gains moral and\nemotional strength by perfecting friendliness and other virtues towards one and\nall. </span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The yogi who perfects,\ncompassion and benevolence, and who regards things impartially without getting\ninvolved, keeps his consciousness free from desire, rage, avarice, lust, pride\nand envy. With his mind purified of such weaknesses, affability evolves, which\ndispenses happiness to all. His equipoise of mind creates a graceful\ndisposition of heart.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">By samyama on\nfriendliness and other such qualities, the power to transmit them is obtained.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the yogi detaches\nhimself from the cultural prejudices which were cultivated in this&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">and in some past lives,\nhe develops universal friendliness which is applied evenly without&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">biases which come up\nfrom the subconscious memory as predispositions. However, being&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">aware of those\nattitudes in his memory, he can know what sort of friendly or antagonistic&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">relationship he had\nwith others in past lives.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The last three limbs\ncombined together (Dharana, Dhyana &amp; Samadhi) make up Samyama. Samyama is\nthe state of resting in deep inner silence</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">(samadhi), along with the ability to pick up a thought (focus/dharana)\nand let it go inward (meditation/dhyana). Then the results of samyama come out\nfrom inner silence automatically, because inner silence/awareness is, in\nreality, a single field.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Samyama is an advanced\nyogic technique, one that is based on principles which utilize the operative\npowers of some of the more subtle and universal facets of consciousness; facets\nwhich many of us are not aware even exist, but which are available to all of\nus, with a certain amount of practice.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Samyama\npractice takes the stillness we cultivated in meditation and moves that\nstillness outward.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once\nthe core samyama practice is mastered, it becomes a natural habit of letting\ngo. In the stillness of pure awareness &nbsp;intuition blooms.</span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">3.25---&nbsp;&nbsp; baleshu hastibaladini</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">By sarhyama on\nstrength, the yogi will develop the physical strength, grace, and endurance of\nan elephant. <o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is a true\nincident. A small child&nbsp; was run over by\na truck. The truck stopped with the wheels on the child. The mother lifted the\ntruck and someone took the child away, injured badly but alive. Scientists\nexamined this incident that the woman gave to herself superhuman strength, and due\nto her astounding effort , her spine was crushed .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A Yogi can train his\nmind to give the body strength , stamina or whatever .. Only today sports psychologists\nunderstand the wisdom of Patanjali. &nbsp;Infinite\nenergy is at the disposal of everyone if he only knows how to get it. The Yogi\nhas discovered the science of getting it. Remember that we are talking about a\nvery deep form of attention, not merely reflecting on, and trying to pretend to\nhave that strength. A yogi develops certain mystic perfections during practice.\n&nbsp;Westerners often wondered why Indian\nyogis could ignore pain . They wondered how Yogis &nbsp;in the Himalayas could stand on one leg and\nsleep on a freezing windy night, nude. &nbsp;&nbsp;It\nis not to show the foreign media. He is doing it for himself.&nbsp; He has abilities honed by Yoga. By making\nSamyama on the strength of the elephant, etc., that strength comes to the Yogi.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I was a successful captain at sea with ZERO\nfailure record. &nbsp; The secret was to make the team believe \u201c If we cant do it, under\nthis captain\u2019s leadership , who else can ?\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">3.26---&nbsp;&nbsp; pravrittyalokanyasat\nsookshmavyavahitaviprakrishtajnanam</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Concealed things,\nhowever near or far, are revealed to a yogi.</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By consolidation of the\ninner light, i.e., the insight of the soul, a yogi develops super-sensitive\npowers of perception. Such insight brings the power of seeing things which are\nsubtle and fine, concealed or at a distance. By making samyama on the Inner\nLight, one obtains knowledge of what is subtle, hidden, or far distant.&nbsp; By directing the flash of inner light of\nhigher sensory activity, knowledge of subtle objects, those hidden from view,\nand those very distant can be attained.&nbsp; 7000\nyears ago our Yoga texts wrote down about ESP ( Extrasensory perception), the\nsixth sense where &nbsp;information &nbsp;is NOT received &nbsp;the recognized physical senses but sensed with\nthe intuitive mind. &nbsp;&nbsp;Unlike ordinary\nsenses, ESP has virtually unlimited range, and it's experienced mainly as\nthoughts rather than bodily sensations.&nbsp; ESP\nis independent of such factors as geography, time, intelligence, age, or\neducation.&nbsp; &nbsp;The conscious mind has\nsubliminal psychic access to the collective unconscious, a vast repository of\naccumulative wisdom and experience of the human race. The natural tendency for\nESP in individuals can be distorted by previous prejudices, thoughts, and\nconditioning. Yoga breaks this barrier.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">3.27---&nbsp; bhuvanajnanan soorye sanyamat</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">By sarhyama on the sun\nthe yogi will have knowledge of the seven worlds, and of the seven cosmic\ncentres in the body. </span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As the sun illuminates\nthe world with its rays, likewise, the light of the soul reaches the sahasrara,\nthe thousand-petalled cakra, also known as brahmakapala. The yogi knows the\nfunctions of both the outer and the inner worlds. As the microcosm symbolises\nthe macrocosm, man's body epitomises the entire structure of the great\nuniverse. The inner sun is to be found only in meditation. It is accessible through\nthe sushumna channel, the thin milky white stream of energy that courses\nthrough the center of the chakras. Through meditation on centers such as the\nheart (anahata chakra) or the space between the eyebrows (ajna chakra), the sun\nwill eventually be revealed. To clear the clouded mind so as to be able to find\nthis sun is one of the key reasons for all of the various practices of Yoga.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">3.28--- chandre\ntaravyoohajnanam</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">By samyama on the moon\ncomes knowledge of the stars' alignment.</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the last sutra, the\nsun, surya, refers to the core of one's being. The moon, candra, refers to the\nmind and consciousness. The solar plexus is situated in the region of the\ntrunk; the lunar plexus has its seat in the cerebrum. By samyama on that\nregion, the yogi obtains further knowledge. &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The brain is likened\nwith the moon, which cools the solar system; the lunar plexus maintains a\nstable, constant temperature in the body, even though the seasonal temperature\nfluctuates. It also controls and directs the parasympathetic system and governs\nthe functioning of the central nervous system.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">3.29--- dhruve\ntadgatijnanam</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">By samyama on the Pole\nStar, the yogi knows the course of destiny. </span></i><o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By samyama on the Pole\nStar (dhruva naksatra), a yogi knows the movements of stars and their effect on\nthe events of the world. Dhruva also represents the roof (ajna cakra) as well\nas the tip of the nose (nasagra). The yogi will know in advance about his own\ndestiny, as well as that of others. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/08/polaris-and-great-bear-capt-ajit.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/08/polaris-and-great-bear-capt-ajit.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">3.30---</span> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">nabhichakre\nkayavyoohajnanam</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">By samyama on the\nnavel, the yogi acquires perfect knowledge of the disposition of the human\nbody</span></i>. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By samyama on the navel\narea or nabhi cakra, also called manipuraka cakra, a yogi can obtain perfect\nknowledge of the constitution of the human body. He knows the activities of his\neach and every cell and thus becomes a master of his own body.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The navel is known as\nkandasthana (kanda = egg or bulb; sthana = region). The root of all the nerves is\nin the navel. From the navel, 72,000 &nbsp;nadis branch out. Nadis are\nastral tubes made up of astral matter that carry Pranic currents. They can be\nseen by the astral eyes only. They are not nerves. They are 72,000 in\nnumber. Ida, Pingala and Sushumna are the important ones. Sushumna is the most\nimportant of all.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are two\nnerve-currents one on either side of the spinal column. The left one is called\nIda and the right is known as Pingala. These are Nadis. Tentatively, some take\nthese as the right and the left sympathetic cords, but they are subtle tubes\nthat carry Prana. The Moon moves in the Ida and the Sun in the Pingala. Ida is\ncooling. Pingala is heating. Ida flows through the left nostril and the Pingala\nthrough the right nostril. The breath flows through the right nostril for one\nhour and then through the left nostril for one hour. Man is busily engaged in\nworldly activities, when the breath flows through Ida and Pingala. When\nSushumna operates, he becomes dead to the world, and enters into Samadhi.</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sushumna\nis the most important of all the Nadis. It is the sustainer of the universe and\nthe path of the universe and the path of salvation. Situated at the back of the\nanus, it is attached to the spinal column and extends to the Brahmarandhra of\nthe head and is invisible and subtle. The real work of a Yogi begins when\nSushumna begins to function. Sushumna runs along the centre of the spinal cord\nor spinal column. Above the genital organs and below the navel is the Kanda, of\nthe shape of a bird's egg. There arise from it all the Nadis <st1:metricconverter productid=\"72,000 in\" w:st=\"on\">72,000 in</st1:metricconverter> number. Of\nthese, seventy-two are common and generally known. Of those the chief ones are\nten and they carry the Pranas. Ida, Pingala, Sushumna, Gandhari, Hastijihva,\nPusa, Yusasvini, Alambusa, Kuhuh and Sankhini are said to be the ten important\nNadis.</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\nYogis should have a knowledge of the Nadis and the Chakras. When Prana moves in\nSushumna, sit for meditation. You will have deep Dhyana. If the coiled-up\nenergy, Kundalini, passes up along the Sushumna Nadi and is taken up from\nChakra to Chakra, the Yogi gets different sorts of experiences, powers and\nAnanda.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the Nadis have\nbecome purified, certain external signs appear on the body of the Yogi. They\nare lightness of the body, brilliancy in complexion, increase of the gastric\nfire, leanness of the body, and along with these, the absence of restlessness\nin the body. They are all signs of purification.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Only the yogi can know\nthe fine demarcation between body and mind, mind and soul, and become master of\nhimself.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">By samyama on the navel\nplexus, knowledge of the body's constitution is obtained.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Using the throat as a\npoint of inquiry for samyama provides an understanding of thirst and hunger.\nThis enables one to control their extreme symptoms.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">In yogic terminology\nthe navel chakra is called manipuraka. It is the third major&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">chakra when counting\nthese from the bottom of the spine. By completing the course of hatha&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">yoga, a yogi curbs this\nchakra.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br />\n<br />\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">3.31--- kanthakoope\nkshutpipasanivrittih</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">By sarhyama on the pit\nof the throat, the yogi overcomes hunger and thirst. </span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Advanced yogis can\ncontrol hunger and thirst\u2014this has been proved under modern scientific\nscrutiny.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kantha kitpa represents\nthe visuddhi chakra situated in the region of the pit of the throat. (Certain\nmudras, for instance kaka mudra and khecari mudra, helps to defeat hunger and\nthirst).&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Samyama on the chest\narea and inquiry into the sensations felt there in different physical and\nmental states gives one the means to remain stable and calm even in very\nstressful situations.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The practice of\nsuppressing hunger and thirst is part of Hatha yoga. The purpose of this is&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">to get the life force\nto cease its independent activities. A hatha yogi endeavors to bring the life&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">force under his control,\nnot to stop it from functioning but to cease its independent activities&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">which are counter\nproductive to the aims of yoga. Thus one, by one, a yogi surcharges and&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">subsequently purifies\nthe energy gyrating centers (chakras) one by one, beginning at the base&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">of the spine.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">A yogi does cause his\nhunger and thirst to be suppressed initially when he sets out to&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">control those urges,\nbut over a time of practice, his subtle body changes and the urges for solid&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">and liquid food go\naway. This is because the attitude of the throat chakras become changed&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">permanently.</span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When my wife took her\nexam in Reiki, the old Guru gave her his quartz tetrahydron dowser , and told\nher to douse his body and find out which chakra of his body needs speeding up.\nShe found a weak Manipura , and thus got her 4th degree ( one step above Grandmaster\n).&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chakra in Sanskrit\nmeans wheeling vortex .&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chakras are focal\npoints where psychic forces and bodily functions interact with each other. , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Though human cannot\nhibernate like bears , the advanced Yogi can do much more.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">By mastery over kurma\nnadi, the yogi not only keeps his physical body immobile like a tortoise, </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; Kurma nadi\ncorresponds to the epigastric region.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The functions of the\nbody are performed by five types of vital energy, prana vayus - prana, apana,\nsamana, udana and vyana. Prana moves in the thoracic region and controls\nbreathing. Apana moves in the lower abdomen and controls excretion of urine,\nsemen and faeces. Samana stirs up the gastric fire, assisting digestion and\nmaintaining the harmonious functioning of the abdominal organs. Udana, working\nin the throat, controls the vocal chords and the intake of air and food. Vyana\npenetrates the entire body, distributing energy from the breath and food\nthrough the arteries, veins and nerves.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are also five\nupavayus known as upa-pranas. They comprise - naga, krkara, devadatta,\ndhanamjaya and kurma. Naga alleviates pressure of the abdomen by burping;\nkrkara prevents substances from passing up the nasal passages and down the\nthroat by making one sneeze or cough. Devadatta causes yawning and induces\nsleep. Dhanamjaya produces phlegm, nutrifies the body, remains in it even after\ndeath and sometimes inflates a corpse. Kurma controls the movements of the\neyelids and regulates the intensity of light for seeing by controlling the size\nof the iris. The eyes are the index of the brain. Any movement in the brain is\nreflected in the eyes. By tranquillising the eyes, i.e., by the control of\nkurma vayu, one can still one's thoughts and make one's brain immobile .&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">In yoga texts one can\nread of the main nadis, such as ida, pihgala, susumna, citra, gandhari,\nhastijihva, pusa, yasasvini, alumbusa, kuhii, sarasvati, varuni, viiodhari,\npayasvim, sahkhim, subha, kausiki, sura, raka, vijnana, kurma and many others.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One's mental functions\nrevolve mainly around lust, anger, greed, infatuation, pride and envy,\nconsidered the enemies of the soul.&nbsp; &nbsp;By mastery over the kurma nadi, the yogi stops\nthe movements of these six spokes of the mind, which are influenced by the\nqualities of sattva, rajas and lamas. He brings these enemies of the soul to a\nstate of steadiness, and through the dominance of sattva guna, transforms them\ninto friends. He remains like a tortoise in his shell, his emotional centre\nundisturbed, under every circumstance. He has developed emotional stability,\nthe prerequisite of spiritual realisation.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">By samyama on the kurma\nnadi (a subtle tortoise-shaped tube located below the throat), motionlessness\nin the meditative posture is achieved.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">By samyama on the\ntortoise channel, below the throat, steadiness is attained.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Unless one can keep his\nbody&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">in a steady pose,\npreferably the padmasana lotus posture, and also have the bodily urges like&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">hunger quelled\ncompletely, he cannot enter into samadhi.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The kurmanadi is\nsupposed to be located below the gullet. In other words if one has not&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">stilled the gross and\nsubtle nerves in this area, having mastered Hatha Yoga, one will not be</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">able to enter samadhi.\nWhen those nerves are stilled, the life force gives up its effort to protect<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">and overly maintain the\nlower part of the body, the part which is lower than the neck. Unless<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">the life force can be\nrelieved from its creature survival duties, it does not allow the person to<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">enter samadhi.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A yogi can develop a\nbalanced head and a poised heart, and from his visions of siddhas, yogis and\nacharyas (great teachers) he may obtain guidance and inspiration to further his\nsadhana. By samyama on the coronal light of the head, visions of the siddhas,\nthe masters can come. Visions of the perfected ones comes by following the\ninner coronal light of the crown of the head, whether encountered at the crown\nor through the ajna chakra, the eyebrow center. By samyama on the light at the\ncrown of the head (sahasrara chakra), visions of masters and adepts are\nobtained. Murdhajyotish is known otherwise as jnanadipa. It is a light seen in\nthe front central head of the subtle body. This light is the energized buddhi\norgan. In its normal stage in a human being, it is dark and cloudy, like a\nfilament of a light bulb which gets insufficient current. The insufficient\ncurrent warms the filament but does not cause it to glow noticeable. When the\nyogi masters pranayama and perfects himself in the disciplines of kundalini and\ncelibacy yoga, his buddhi organ gets sufficiently charged. It glows with\nshining light (jyotisi), otherwise it remains dull but is felt as the centre of\nthe mind, as ones ability to understand, analyses, plan and draw conclusions. He\ncan take advices and get rare kriya yoga practices from those siddhas whom he\nis allowed to perceive. Such a yogin does not rely on physical contact with a\nyoga guru. Hence he does not have to have a guru who uses a physical form. He\ntakes initiation either physically or subtle from these teachers. The reddish\ngrey pineal gland is located in the geometric center of the brain. It is\nlocated directly behind the eyes. The pineal gland is a super conducting\nresonator which has mystical powers. Once the third eye is developed it is far\nmore powerful than any of your 5 human senses.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Though it is not part of the brain,\nthe pineal gland develops from the roof of the diencephalon, a section of the\nbrain, and functions as a light receptor. &nbsp;The pineal gland is the evolutionary\nforerunner of the modern eye.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\nnerves that serve the pineal gland don't originate in the brain but in the\nsympathetic nervous system. The pineal gland can be activated by activated by\nsunlight, and also by sound resonance. It controls the various biorhythms of\nthe body. It can discern negative energies, based on perception of vibrating\nenergies around you. It plays a major role in hibernation of animals,\nmetabolism, and seasonal breeding. In humans it affects circadian rhythms,\nsleep patterns ( melatonin levels increase at night), and is implicated in\nseasonal affective disorder.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\npineal gland is a photosensitive organ and thus an important timekeeper for the\nhuman body.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pineal\nactivation awakens normally latent neural pathways. Nerve fibers leave the\npineal and make synaptic connections with other brain sites through traditional\nnerve-to-nerve connections.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">3.34--- pratibhad va\nsarvam</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Through the faculty of\nspiritual perception, the yogi becomes the knower of all knowledge -- Vibhuti\nPada. </span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A yogi can intuitively\nperceive anything and everything. By samyama on the radiant light, he becomes\nthe knower of all knowledge. All knowledge is mirrored in a yogi. In short, as\nday succeeds dawn, impulsive nature is transformed into intuitive thought, by\nwhich the yogi possesses universal knowledge. It is the conquest of nature.When\na man has risen to a high state of Pratibha, he has that great light. All\nthings are apparent to him. Everything comes to him naturally without making\nSamyama.Through the faculty of spiritual perception the yogi becomes the knower\nof all knowledge.This pratibha is the brahmarandra development in the head of\nthe subtle body of a yogi. At first a yogi develops the top part of the subtle\nbody which is known as the brahmarandra. &nbsp;Patanjali used the terms, pratibha which\nliterally means relating to divination or genius. A yogi&nbsp; who has developed his brahmarandra is liberated\neven while using a gross body.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">3.35---</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">hridaye\nchittasanvit<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;
