font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">By samyama on the\nregion of the heart, the yogi acquires a thorough knowledge of the contents and\ntendencies of consciousness. </span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By samyama, a yogi can\nbecome aware of consciousness and of true, pure knowledge. He learns to unfold\nand tap the source of his being, and identify himself with the Supreme.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">By samyama on the\nheart, the knowledge of the mind-stuff is obtained.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">A person whose mind is\njumpy, whose emotions are reactive and who is still linked to the&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">cultural affairs of\nthis world, cannot develop Samadhi.&nbsp;</span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">3.36--- sattvapurushayoratyantasankeernnayoh\npratyayavishesho bhogah pararthatvat svarthasanyamat purushajnanam</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">By samyama, the yogi\neasily differentiates between the intelligence and the soul, which is real and\ntrue. </span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Since it serves the\npurposes of the Self and nature, pure intelligence and the seer appear to be\none, but they are quite dissimilar from each other. By samyama on that which\nexists for itself, comes knowledge of the soul.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The refined,\nilluminative intelligence (sattva buddhi) is free from egoism. It is quite\ndissimilar from the light of the soul. Samyama on one's own self brings to\nlight the difference between intelligence and self and coronates the yogi with\nthe knowledge of the soul. This sutra, by the use of the word svartha for the\nseer and parartha for the intelligence, clearly illustrates the difference\nbetween the two. Failure to differentiate between them leads to entanglement in\nworldly pleasures. Knowing the distinction enables one to enter the gates of\nthe soul. &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Though the refined\nilluminative intelligence is the summit of nature, it is subject to diverse\nexperiences. The soul being immutable, its light is constant, steady and\nunalterable. To the sadhaka, the intellect appears to be purusa. By samyama,\nthe yogi has to disentangle the knot that binds the intellect and the self, and\nisolate the refined intelligence. From this follows isolation of the senses,\nmind and ego, and ultimately the release of the light of the soul.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Samyama on the pure\nconsciousness, which is distinct from the subtlest aspect of mind, reveals\nknowledge of that pure consciousness.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The power of\nnon-attachment acquired through purity gives&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">the Yogi the\nenlightenment called Pratibha.</span></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">3.37--- tatah\npratibhashravannavedanadarshasvadavarta jayante</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Through that spiritual\nperception, the yogi acquires the divine faculties of hearing, touch, vision,\ntaste and smell. He can even generate these divine emanations by his own will. </span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Through the dawning of\nthe self-luminous light of intuitive understanding, divine perceptions in\nhearing, feeling, seeing, tasting and smelling, beyond the range of ordinary\nperceptions, arise of their own accord. Our 5 senses have a narrow bandwidth\nand are deliberately squelched to prevent overload and mental breakdown. &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">As the mind is the\ncentre of the functions of the senses of perception, it restricts their powers\nof hearing, feeling, seeing, tasting and smelling. When the limitations of the mind\nare removed, the yogi contacts the very core of his being, and has direct,\ndivine perceptions, independent of the sense organs. He is able to hear, feel,\nsee, taste and smell through unlimited space.</span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">3.38--- te\nsamadhavupasargaa vyutthane siddhayah</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">These attainments are\nimpediments to samadhi, although they are powers in active life. </span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Divine perceptions are\nhindrances to a yogi, whose wisdom is supreme and whose goal is spiritual\nabsorption. They are great accomplishments, but he should know that they fall\nwithin the range of the gunas of nature, and in acquiring them, he might forget\nhis main aim in life and luxuriate within them. If they are shunned, however,\nthey become aids to samadhi. The yogi may mistake these accomplishments and\nrewards for the end and aim of yogic practices. He might imagine that he has\nattained great spiritual heights, and that whatever is attainable through yoga\nhas been achieved. In this process, he can forget the goal of Self-Realisation.\nPatanjali warns yogis to treat these powers as impediments in their sadhana.\nOne should control them as whole-heartedly as one fought earlier to conquer the\nafflictions of the body and fluctuations of the mind. Then one can move forward\ntowards kaivalya, emancipation. These [superphysical senses] are obstacles to\n[nirbija] samadhi but are siddhis (powers or accomplishments) in the worldly\npursuits. By inquiring into the cause of this rigid situation binding the mind\nto the individual and examining the means of relaxing this rigidity there is\ngreat potential for an individual to reach beyond the confines of himself. The\nallurements of the external world pale by comparison to the allurements of the\nsubtle world, where these so-called attainments, powers, and psychic abilities\nabound. On the inner journey it is therefore imperative to increasingly,\ngently, systematically cultivate the levels of non-attachment or vairagya , all\nthe way up to supreme non-attachment or paravairagya. Experiences such as those\ndescribed in the Yoga Sutras exist, and naturally start to come along the way.\nSaying that they are renounced does not mean they go away. Rather, it means\nthey become a responsibly used part of the yogi's way of engaging with the\nouter and inner world. The abilities are there, and become as much a part of\nlife as are the grosser aspects of the senses (indriyas), including the jnanendriyas\nof smell, taste, sight, touch, and hearing, as well as the karmendriyas of\nelimination, procreation, motion, grasping, and speaking. Whether those gross\nsenses or the subtle attainments are used with or without attachment is the\nquestion. These powers, however, are obstructions to the attainment of the highest\ngoal, the knowledge of the pure Self, and freedom; these are, as it were, to be\nmet in the way, and if the Yogi rejects them, he attains the highest.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">3.39---</span> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">bandhakarannashaithilyat\npracharasanvedanach ch chittasya parashariraveshah</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Through relaxation of\nthe causes of bondage, and the free flow of consciousness, the yogi enters\nanother's body at will. </span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A perfect yogi can\nenter the body of another individual or, in order to free himself from the\nbondage of karmas, can leave his own body at will. The yogi's consciousness can\nenter the body of another when the cause of bondage (karmasaya) ceases and the\nknowledge of moving from one body into another is acquired. This is the\nconquest of the element of earth. Over all, a student yogi should not endeavor\nfor this parasariravesah siddhi since it is very dangerous and can be done only\nby the most advanced Yogis .&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">3.40--- udanajayajjalapangkakantakadishvasangg\nutkrantishch</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">By mastery of udana\nvayu, the yogi can walk over water, swamps and thorns without touching them. He\nalso has the power of levitation. </span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He can make prana\nascend through brahmarandhra and thus die at will. Prana is usually translated\nas 'breath', yet this is only one of its manifestations in the human body. If\nbreathing stops, so does life. Ancient Indian sages knew that all functions of\nthe body were performed by five types of vital energy (prana vayus) - prana,\napana, samana, udana and vyana. They are specific aspects of the one vital\ncosmic force, the primordial principle of existence in every being. In\npranayama, prana vayu is activated by the inbreath and apana vayu by the\noutbreath. Vyana is essential for the working of prana and apana, due to it\nbeing the medium for transferring energies from one to the other. Udana raises\nenergy from the lower spine to the brain. This sutra explains the powers gained\nby the yogi who masters udana vayu - he raises the energy, and is then able to\nwalk over water. By mastering samana one can experience sensations of excessive\nheat. Udana is the name of the nerve current that governs the lungs, and all\nthe upper parts of the body, and when he is master of it he becomes light in\nweight.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">3.41---</span> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">samanajayat\nprajvalanam</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">By samyama on samana vayu,\na yogi glows like fire and his aura radiates. </span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By the conquest of\nsamana vayu, the yogi gains control over the element of fire (tejastatwd). The\nmiddle of the torso is the region of samana, which stokes the gastric fire,\nassisting in digestion and maintaining harmonious functioning of the abdominal\norgans. It controls the working of the heart, and through it, the life force. By\nmastery over samana, the prana flowing in the navel area, there comes\neffulgence, radiance, or fire. Samana vayu is one of the five vayus. It\noperates from the navel area, deals with digestion, and allows the mental\ndiscrimination between useful and not useful thoughts. Conquest of the samana\ndigestive force comes by the practice of kundalini yoga When a yogi on the\nupward purification course,purifies his navel region, he experiences frontal\nkundalini. It is then that he achieves conquest over the samana digestive fire.\nHis subtle body then appears with an orangish fiery glow. By mastery over the\nsamana nerve current (the equalizing vital air) comes radiance to surround the\nbody. Active at the navel center\u2014midway between the realms of prana vayu in the\nchest and apana vayu in the pelvis\u2014samana vayu is a concentrating, absorbing,\nand consolidating force. Its main function is assimilation of prana in all its\nforms\u2014like a power station, samana collects energy absorbed through breath,\nfood, sensory perception, and mental experiences and processes it to empower\nall aspects of life. In the energetic body, samana is concentrated at the navel\ncenter (manipura chakra)\u2014the center for the transformative power of the fire\nelement. As the hub of pranic energy and vitality, the navel center is\nessential to hatha yoga, which aims to increase prana and transform the\npatterns of pranic flow in the body. Asana practice in particular is designed\nto draw downward-moving apana up to the navel center, and upward-moving prana\nvayu down to the navel center, uniting these two opposing energies to awaken\nsamana. This integrating action strengthens the body, balances the mind, and\nstabilizes instinctive urges like hunger and sex so we can more easily regulate\nthem. It gives us the clarity and courage to truly see ourselves, and the\nmotivation and power to transform our habits and karmic tendencies. Samana\nvayu, or \u201cbalancing air,\u201d is the prana vayu at the meeting point between prana,\nthe inward/upward-moving vayu, and apana, the outward/downward-moving vayu.\nSamana vayu unites these two energies together. Located at the navel, samana\nvayu governs agni, the digestive fire, or fire of purification. This fire burns\nadequately when prana and apana unite in samana. Samana vayu is related to\nManipura chakra located at the solar plexus. It is responsible for the\nprocessing and assimilation of all that is taken in\u2014food, emotions,\nperceptions, and breath. Samana is used to assimilate these energies so that\nthey can be used optimally. &nbsp;An imbalance\nof samana vayu presents as health conditions including digestive disturbances,\nslow metabolism, malnourishment, or obesity. In our daily lives, if we are\nfeeling out of balance, samana is likely to be affected. Pranayama practices\nthat balances inhalation with exhalation are helpful as a way to balance\nsamana. By matching the length and depth of each inhalation and exhalation,\nprana meets apana, thereby helping to balance samana. Samana vayu is a\ncentralizing force of energy (centripetal) that draws from the periphery to the\nnavel in a spiraling action. Its main function is to support digestion\nphysically (food, nutrients), energetically (prana), emotionally and mentally\n(thoughts and feelings) and spiritually (intuition, inner guidance, wisdom). It\nis Udana Vayu that separates the astral body from the physical body at the time\nof death. By control over this current he becomes very, very light. In\nconjunction with Prana Vayu, Udana plays an important part in governing the\nmotion of lungs. The body of the Yogi who has mastered the current Samana Vayu\nis effulgent. He can create fire out of his body. Sage Sarabhanga after having\nDarshan of Sri Rama, created fire out of his physical body, burnt his physical\nbody in this Yogic fire .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">3.42--- shrotrakashayoh\nsanbandhasanyamad divyan shrotram</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">By sarhyama on the\nrelation between space and sound, the yogi acquires the power of hearing\ndistant and divine sounds. The organ of hearing, the ear, grasps sound in\nspace. This is the conquest of akasha</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The entire Vedas (\nSRUTI ) were heard by seers while in their meditative trances. The inner ear\ngives the cycloid spiral space curve motion. Vedic seers used the inner ear\nmethod for bending space time.&nbsp; By\nsamyama over the relation between akasha (one of the five elements) and the\npower of hearing, the higher, divine power of hearing comes.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">3.43--- kayakashayoh\nsanbandhasanyamal aghutoolasamapatteshchakashagamanam</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">By knowing the\nrelationship between the body and ether, the yogi transforms his body and mind,\nso that they become as light as cotton fibre. He can then levitate in space.\nThis is the conquest of ether. </span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is one of the\nsupernatural powers called laghima, or becoming as light as cotton. While sutra\n3.40 described levitation, this sutra describes moving through space. The\nsamyama allows a releasing or a cessation of the process of heaviness or earth\nelement. Then, the natural lightness is experienced. It is not that a new\nquality of lightness is being attained or added on. Rather, it is a ceasing to\nbe connected with the quality of earth or heaviness of body. This does not &nbsp;mean levitation of the physical body. It means\nthe use of the subtle body.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">3.44--- bahirakalpita\nvrittirmahavideha tatah prakashavarannakshayah</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">By samyama on\nmahavideha (the disembodied state), where consciousness functions outside the\nbody, the veil covering the light of illumination is destroyed. </span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is a siddhi, called\nmahavideha siddhi. The yogi in this state possesses true and pure intelligence.\nIf consciousness moves outside the body, but stays in the body, it is called an\nconceivable state. When the same consciousness moves outside the body,\nindependent of and without abiding in it, it is an inconceivable state. In\nmahavideha, the yogi disengages his body from consciousness, so that sufferings\ndo not influence him. He is beyond the gunas. In this non-attached state, cilia\nturns divine and universal and can absorb anything in space without the use of\nthe body, senses, or ego. By samyama on thought waves unidentified by and\nexternal to the body [maha-videha, or the great bodilessness], the veil over\nthe light of the Self is destroyed. When the formless thought patterns of mind\nare projected outside of the body, it is called maha-videha, a great\ndisincarnate one. By samyama on that outward projection, the veil over the\nspiritual light is removed.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">3.45---</span> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">sthoolasvaroopasookshmanvayarthavattva\nsamyamadbhootajayah</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">By samyama on the\nelements - their mass, forms, subtlety, conjunction and purposes, the yogi\nbecomes Lord over them all. </span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By restraint, the yogi\ngains control over the gross and subtle elements of nature, their forms and\ngunas, as well as their purpose. The Universe is created from the constituents\nof the basic elements of nature - earth (prthvi), water (ap), fire (tejas), air\n(vayu) and ether (akasa). Each element possesses five attributes - mass\n(sthula), subtlety (suksma), form (svarupa), all-pervasiveness or\ninterpenetration (anvaya), and purpose or fruition (arthavatva). &nbsp;The characteristics of the gross forms of\nelements comprise solidity, fluidity, heat, mobility and volume. Their subtle\ncounterparts are smell, taste, sight, touch and sound. Their all-pervasiveness\nor interpenetration are the three gunas, and their purpose is either worldly\nenjoyment or freedom and beatitude. The earth element has five properties of\nsound, touch, sight, taste and smell. Water possesses four - sound, touch,\nsight and taste. Fire has three - sound, touch and sight. Air comprises sound\nand touch. Ether has only the one quality of sound . By samyama on the gross\nand subtle elements and on their essential nature, correlations and purpose,\nmastery over them is gained. When the elements are mastered one is no longer\ndisturbed by them. The body reaches perfection and extraordinary capabilities\nbecome possible. By making Samyama on the gross and fine forms of the elements,\ntheir essential traits, the inherence of the Gunas in them and on their\ncontributing to the experience of the soul, comes mastery of the elements.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">3.46---</span> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">tatoanimadipradurbhavah\nkayasanpat taddharmanabhighatashch</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">From that arises\nperfection of the body, the ability to resist the play of the elements, and\npowers such as minuteness. <o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">From samyama on the\nelements, their counterparts, forms, conjunctions and fruits, the yogi develops\nthe eight supernatural powers and gains perfect wealth of the body without\nfalling victim to the obstacles posed by the elements. This is believed to be\nthe best wealth of the body - perfection and freedom from all hindrances. This\nsutra points that by the conquest of the elements, a yogi gains mastery in\nthree fields. The first is the acquisition of the eight supernatural powers.\nThe second is perfection of the body, which means that earth does not grime\nhim, water dampen him, or fire burn him. Wind cannot move him and space can\nobscure his body anywhere, at any time. The third is immunity from the play of\nthe elements and their characteristics, and from the obstructions and\ndisturbances which they create. He can reach anything he likes, he can rule\neverything he wants, he can conquer everything he wants, and so on. A lion will\nsit at his feet like a lamb, and all his desires will be fulfilled at will. From\nminuteness and other related mystic skills come the perfection of the subtle\nbody and the non-obstructions of its functions. When the yogi develops the\nmystic skills, he finds that the subtle body is perfected to such a degree that\nthe nadis, subtle tubes within it carry a subtle fluid which is as crystal\nclear as pure water. From certain dimensions this appears to be liquid light\ntraveling through the subtle body of the yogi. Some of this purity filters into\nthe gross body and the yogi is said to perform miracles. Perfection in the body\nmeans good features, attractiveness to others, physical firmness, and unusual\nphysical strength.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">3.47---</span> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">roopalavanyabalavajrasanhananatvani\nkayasanpat</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Perfection of the body\nconsists of beauty, grace, strength, compactness and the hardness and\nbrilliance of a diamond.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In advanced yoga\npractice, kaya is the subtle body ( not the physical body ) , the temporary but\nlong lasting body which the yogin must perfect before he can attain liberation.\nWhen the subtle body is upgraded by the practice of kundalini yoga, it attains\nbeauty of form, mystic force and diamond-like definition. It attains clarity in\nit. Its colors become free from cloudiness and vague. It moves into the higher\npranic force. It is experienced as a sattva guna body, a form of the mode of\npure goodness. Beauty, grace, strength, and adamantine hardness constitute\nbodily perfection. This perfection of the body includes beauty, gracefulness,\nstrength, and adamantine hardness in taking the blows that come. The body\nbecomes indestructible. Nothing can injure it. Nothing can destroy it until the\nYogi wishes. \u201cBreaking the rod of time he lives in this universe with his\nbody.\u201d In the Vedas it is written that for that man there is no more disease,\ndeath or pain.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">3.48--- grahannasvaroopasmitanvayarthavattvasanyamad\nindriyajayah</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Through samyama upon\nthe purpose of the conjunction of the process of knowing, the ego, and nature,\nthere is mastery over the senses. </span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By samyama upon the\nnatural states of the senses of perception, their function and receptivity,\nwith or without their conjunction with nature and the perception of the\nindividual self (tumtta), the yogi recognises the purpose of the alignment of\nnature, senses and self and gains mastery over them all. Here Patanjali\ndescribes the five specific qualities, particularly in relation to the senses\nof perception and the ego. The properties of the senses of perception include -\nknowing their own natural state; cognition or recognition of external objects;\nthe reason for this contact; and the involvement of the individual self in\nthese states, which changes it from objective to subjective. Everything one\nexperiences in the universe is transmitted through the medium of the senses to\nthe 'I' consciousness. The senses by their essential nature are attracted to\nworldly objects conducive to pleasure, and their hunger for more and more\nentangles them. At some stage, when the senses are quelled, they and the organs\nof action become unreceptive, and a state of quietness is experienced. An\nordinary individual will go on following the senses when they are again stirred\nto their pursuit of pleasure, but the sophisticated intelligence will ponder,\nand consider that it is possible to turn inwards. This reflection on the\nreceptivity of the senses and mind can now be diverted and directed by the\nintelligence toward exploring the realm of the seer so that senses, mind and\nego are brought to rest permanently in the abode of the soul. By samyama on the\nprocess of perception and action, essence, I-ness, connectedness, and\npurposefulness of senses and acts, mastery over those senses and acts\n(indriyas) is attained. Samyama on the five cognitive senses or means of\nperception (jnanendriyas) brings mastery over those senses. Samyama on the five\nmeans of actions (karmendriyas) brings mastery over those means of action.\nHowever, these practices of samyama are purposively done in conjunction with\nones own individuality and essence. It is the samyama on the relationship,\nwhich is the key. Repeatedly, the nature of relationship is examined in the\nYoga Sutras, so that the false identities can be broken, allowing the true Self\nto be experienced , beyond the layers of ignorance or avidya. Sensual energy is\nsubtle and moves at a rapid rate to execute its functions. It is mostly\ninvoluntary, which means that it operates on its own. This makes it difficult\nto track. . One must study how the sensual energy appropriates or grasps subtle\nphenomena. This is indicated by the term anvaya. One must study how the energy\nconnects with and associates with various types of subtle and gross objects.\nOne must know the form of the sensual energy, its swarupa. This is its form when\nit does not assume the identity of other objects. One should understand its\nnature for identification as well as its worth to the self. When all this is\nachieved, then the yogi gains mastery over his relationship to that sensual\nforce.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">3.49---</span> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">tato\nmanojavitvan vikarannabhavah pradhanajayashch</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">By mastery over the\nsenses of perception, the yogi's speed of body, senses and mind matches that of\nthe soul, independent of the primary causes of nature. Unaided by\nconsciousness, he subdues the first principle of nature (mahat). <o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the properties of nature\nhave been conquered, and both body and consciousness purified, the self\nperceives directly and quickly, independent of nature. Body, senses, mind and\nconsciousness stand equal to the seer in their movements, and the soul drinks\nits own sweetness. The taste of honey is the same from whichever side of the\nhoneycomb it is collected. Likewise, the organs of action and senses of\nperception, body and mind are made as pure as the soul, when they are\ntransformed to the level of the soul. In this spiritual elation, they lose\ninterest in sensual gratification and pleasure. Each cell reflects the light of\npure Self and each cell drinks the nectar of the soul. This is madhu pranka. &nbsp;When there is clear understanding of the\ndifference between the Perceiver and the mind, all the various states of mind\nand what affects them become known. Then, the mind becomes a perfect instrument\nfor the flawless perception of everything that need be known. By that mastery\nover the senses and acts (indriyas), there comes quickness of mind, perception\nwith the physical instruments of perception, and mastery over the primal cause\nout of which manifestation arises.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">3.50--- sattvapurushanyatakhyatimatrasy\nsarvabhavadhishthatritvam sarvajnatritvan cha</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Only one who knows the\ndifference between the illuminative intelligence and the seer, attains supreme\nknowledge of all that exists and all that manifests. </span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The yogi distinguishes\nbetween intelligence, consciousness, ego and the soul. Through knowledge of the\nsoul, he earns mastery over every state of manifestation and becomes master of\nall knowledge. He is omnipresent, omnipotent and omniscient. &nbsp;He alone is the observer, perceiving\neverything directly, and he alone is the actor, independent of mind, senses of\nperception and organs of action. &nbsp;To one\nwell established in the knowledge of the distinction between the purest aspect\nof mind and consciousness itself, there comes supremacy over all forms or\nstates of existence, as well as over all forms of knowing. Reaching the finest\nlevel of mind: In the preceding sutras (3.17-3.37, 3.39-3.49), many types of\nexperience were described. As these are encountered, the yogi goes ever deeper\ninto the levels of his or her own being. Each is encountered, explored,\nexperienced, and set aside, so as to go still deeper. Finally comes the finest\nof the levels of individuality, the sattvic buddhi. Here, in this sutra, one\nnot only experiences the discrimination between the subtlest aspect of mind and\nconsciousness itself (purusha), this distinction becomes well established. Initially,\nbuddhi is utilized as the means that decides, judges, and discriminates\n(2.26-2.29). When this discrimination is clouded, we act out of our habit\npatterns, not from choice. Eventually, we come to see that it was buddhi who\ncarved up consciousness and the universe in the first place, experiencing the\nmany dualities. Here, when the sutra speaks of discriminating between buddhi\nand purusha, this is what is being addressed. It is not referring to buddhi at\nthe surface level, such as deciding what is useful and not useful in our life\nactivities. Rather, it is the subtlest aspect of buddhi that is being\ndiscriminated as different from purusha. This is the discrimination that leads\ntowards liberation .Only when there is distinct discrimination between the\nclarifying perception of material nature and the spiritual personality, does\nthe yogi attain complete disaffection and all applicative intuition. In\nadvanced yoga, or kriya yoga, one has to maintain the distinction between\noneself and the perceiving instruments of the subtle body, even through\ninitially one must take help from those truth yielding perceptions.\nAdhisthatrtvam means complete or full disaffection from the subtle influence of\nmaterial nature, even from the clarifying powers which are so helpful. When\nnature has been conquered, and the difference between the Purusha and nature\nrealised \u2014 that the Purusha is indestructible, pure and perfect \u2014 then come\nomnipotence and omniscience.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">3.51--- tadvairajnadapi\ndoshabijakshaye kaivalyam</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">By destruction of the\nseeds of bondage and the renunciation of even these powers, comes eternal\nemancipation. <o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By renouncing the\nsupernormal powers, the yogi reaches eternal emancipation. Indifference to all\nsupernatural experiences annihilates the seed of sorrows and leads the yogi to\nlive in his own self. If he does not reject them, he will be caught in the web\nof subtle miseries, and may find it extremely difficult to come out of them. &nbsp;In 11.16, Patanjali spoke of afflictions and\npains, which may affect the sadhaka at a later time through pride or want of\nunderstanding. Now that the sadhaka has acquired intellectual sensitivity, he\nis ready to hear that sufferings will instantly overwhelm one who succumbs to\nthe temptation of the siddhis. If he fails to see their hidden perils, he ends\nup in sorrow. If he cultivates non-attachment to, and detachment from them, the\nseeds of sorrow, weakness or bondage that spring from siddha vidya are\ndestroyed. From renunciation springs eternal emancipation, or unalloyed purity.\nThis is kaivalya. The self now has achieved complete independence and abides in\nits own nature. The temptation to accept the respectful status as a consequence\nof acquiring knowledge through samyama should be restrained. &nbsp;With non-attachment or desirelessness even for\nthat supremacy over forms and states of existence and the omniscience (3.50),\nthe seeds at the root of those bondages are destroyed, and absolute liberation\nis attained. He attains aloneness, independence, and becomes free. When one\ngives up even the ideas of omnipotence and omniscience, there comes entire\nrejection of enjoyment, of the temptations from celestial beings. When the Yogi\nhas seen all these wonderful powers, and rejected them, he reaches the goal. &nbsp;When the coloring (klishta) of this attachment\nto mastery over all forms and states of existence and omniscience is\nsurrendered, and non-attachment ensues, there comes liberation. At the lesser\nlevels of attainment, the non-attachment opens the door to the next subtler\nlayer, for which the process must be repeated. However, at this subtlest level,\nthere is no more level, so there is final liberation between consciousness and\nthe many fluctuations of the mind field . So long as there is a mind it can be understood,\nbut the goal is beyond even the mind.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">3.52--- sthanyupanimantrane\nsanggasmayakarannan punah anishtaprasanggat</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">When approached by\ncelestial beings, there should be neither attachment nor surprise, because\nundesirable connections can happen again. <o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The yogi must maintain\nhis hard-won freedom, and must not fall prey to temptations that can raze him\ndown from the height of spirituality. There are four types of yogis. They are\nknown as - prathama kalpika, madhubhumika, prajnajyoti and atikrantabhavamya.\nPrathama kalpika yogis have worked hard in their yogic practices, and the power\nof progress has just begun to dawn. Madhubhumika yogis have learned to\ndistinguish between citta and the seer and try to achieve further mastery.\n(They are also called rtambhara prajnas.) The prajnajyotis have succeeded in\nsubduing the elements of nature, the qualities of the senses of perception,\nmind and desires and have realised the seer, while the atikrantabhavamyas have\nattained the highest knowledge of the seer and have the power of olparavava-gya\n(highest dispassion). Patanjali warns all classes of yogis not to let\nthemselves be lured into angelic 'traps', but to detach themselves from these\ndivine temptations, so that their hearts have no room to hold unwelcome\nfeelings and urges. As discrimination becomes increasingly finer, the levels of\nthe subtle realm are experienced, including encounters with the disembodied or\ncelestial beings. They might invite the sadhaka (practitioner) with the\nexperiences of the subtle realm. These invitations, experiences, or powers are\ndistractions, which block the realization of the true Self, which is beyond all\nexperiences. Therefore, the invitations are declined in a spirit of\nnon-attachment , as are the other subtle experiences .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">3.53--- kshannatatkramayoh\nsanyamadavivekajam jnanam</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">By samyama on moment\nand on the continuous flow of moments, the yogi gains exhilarated knowledge,\nfree from the limitations of time and space. </span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By samyama on the\ncontinuous flow of moments which move in a succession known as time, the yogi\ngets direct understanding of time and relativity. A moment in time is timeless,\nand that this timelessness is real and eternal, whereas its movement is\nrestrained to the past and the future. Movement is timebound, transitory and\never-changing. The moment is everlasting, changeless, sacred - it is, in fact,\nthe secret of samadhi. The moment is unconditioned reality, while the sequence\nof moments is conditioned reality; it is relative to the absolute and illusory.\nThis realisation is termed 'exalted intelligence'. In moment, neither\npsychological nor chronological time is felt. Moment comes between rising\nimpressions and their restraints and vice-versa - it is a quiet intervening\nstate, auspicious and pure, and is to be stabilised, prolonged and expanded, so\nthat consciousness becomes absolute. This is vivekajajnana- the gateway to\nkaivalya. The yogi is always aware of the moment and thus conquers\npsychological and chronological time. He remains attentive to the moment, and\ndoes not allow his attention to slip into the movement of moments. He remains\nundisturbed, and with the loss of the time factor, his consciousness, too,\nloses its implication. Then, he catches sight of the soul. This is vivekaja\njnana, exalted intelligence - the secret and sacred knowledge. Bhagawad Gita\nteaches us to live in the present moment because it is all that one really has.\nThe 'elsewhere' or 'otherwise' mentality, to which one is bound by\npsychological time, compels one to emasculate the present reality with the\nillusory unreality. By samyama on single moments in sequence comes\ndiscriminative knowledge.By samyama on moment and on the continuous flow of\nmoments, the yogi gains exalted knowledge, free from the limitations of time\nand space. Experience usually comes like a movie. It only appears to be an\nunfolding process, whereas it is actually independent events. It is like the\nmovie film being many independent frames, all of which coexist on the same\nreel. However, when you look at those frames sequentially, there is the appearance\nof a uniform and unfolding event or process. When samyama is done on the\nmoments and the process of succession, the higher knowledge of what is really\ngoing on is revealed. One comes to see the nature of movie production of the\nmind and virtually the whole of the creation process. This opens the door to\nthe realization of the Truth&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">3.54--- jatilakshannadeshairanyataanavachchhedat\ntulyayostatah pratipattih</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">By this knowledge the\nyogi is able to distinguish unerringly the differences in similar objects,\nwhich cannot be distinguished by rank, qualitative signs or position in space. </span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">With this exalted\nintelligence the yogi is capable of distinguishing, faultlessly and\ninstantaneously, the minutest differences between two similar kinds of things\nor objects, regardless of rank, creed, quality, place or space. A yogi who has\naccomplished spiritual realisation, possesses clarity and sensitivity even in\nthe subtlest of things. He perceives all things distinctly and expresses himself\nfaultlessly. This quality of intelligence cannot be possessed even by evolved\nsouls unless they are anchored in the sacred divine spiritual knowledge -\nvivekaja jnanam. Such clarity is not exclusive of any object, any particular\nsituation, or any moment. It is not the result of sequential logic. It is\nimmediate, spontaneous, and total. The yogi has perception of two similar\nrealties which otherwise could not be sorted due to a lack of definition in\nterms of their general category, individual characteristic and location. A yogi\ndevelops mystic clarity. The misery that we suffer comes from ignorance, from\nnon-discrimination between the real and the unreal. We all take the bad for the\ngood, the dream for the reality.&nbsp; Non-discrimination\nis the cause of misery. It is caused by ignorance. When discrimination comes,\nit brings strength. The highest philosophy of the Yogi is based upon this fact,\nthat the Purusa is pure and perfect, and is the only \u201csimple\u201d that exists in\nthis universe. The body and mind are compounds, and yet we are ever identifying\nourselves with them. &nbsp;When this power of\ndiscrimination has been attained, man sees that everything in this world,\nmental and physical, is a compound, and, as such, cannot be the Purusa.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">3.55---</span> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">tarakan\nsarvavishayan sarvathavishayam akraman cheti vivekajan jnanam</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The essential\ncharacteristic of the yogi's exalted knowledge is that he grasps instantly,\nclearly and wholly, the aims of all objects without going into the sequence of\ntime or change. </span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Invigorated in\nunderstanding, clear in action, he dominates and transgresses nature and\nreaches, through yogic practices, the light of the soul. The discriminative\nknowledge that simultaneously comprehends all objects in all conditions is the\nintuitive knowledge which brings liberation. This discriminative knowledge\ndelivers a man from the bondage of ignorance. It comprehends all objects\nsimultaneously, at every moment of their existence and in all their\nmodifications. Freedom is when the mind has complete identity with the Perceiver.\nThat higher knowledge is intuitive and transcendent, and is born of\ndiscrimination; it includes all objects within its field, all conditions\nrelated to those objects, and is beyond any succession. The distinction caused\nby subtle discrimination is the crossing over or transcending of all subtle and\ngross mundane objects in all ways they are presented, without the yogi taking\nrecourse to any other sequential perceptions of mind reliance. The higher\nknowledge is intuitive, transcendent, or coming from within. It is revealed by\ndiscrimination between objects, which rests on the ability to discriminate\nbetween moments and succession. Saying that the higher knowledge is intuitive\nmeans that it is self-existent rather than being constructed knowledge. Much of\nour worldly sense of knowledge comes from combining different pieces of\ninformation, much like we might combine different cooking skills and\ningredients in a kitchen to construct a meal. However, the higher knowledge is\nnot constructed, but revealed by stepping beyond the mere appearance of the\nmoments and succession. Through the repeated process of discrimination, the\nhigher truth is born or revealed. As the meditator experiences this truth\nbeyond the objects, moments, and sequences, it becomes clear in direct\nexperience that the higher knowledge contains, or oversees all of the many\nobjects, their conditions, and sequences. It is seen that it is not a case\nwhere consciousness not only permeates the objects, conditions, and sequences,\nbut actually is the supporting reality of their existence. &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The whole of Prakriti\nin all its states, subtle and gross, is within the grasp of this knowledge.\nThere is no succession in perception by this knowledge; it takes in all things\nsimultaneously, at a glance.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">3.56--- sattvapurushayoh\nshuddhisamye kaivalyam iti</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">When the purity of\nintelligence equals the purity of the soul, the yogi has reached kaivalya -\nperfection in yoga. <o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the vestures of\nthe soul are equal in purity to that of the soul, harmony resides between them.\nThere comes freedom, kaivalya, of the seer, uncontaminated by the qualities of\nnature. By yogic discipline, the veil of ignorance is lifted from intelligence.\nThis is the real and true light - vivekaja jnanam, illuminative consciousness.\nIt becomes equal to that of the light of the soul, purusa.
