The differentiation\nbetween intelligence and consciousness comes to an end. Both dissolve in the\nbeacon light of the soul. They are isolated from contact with nature's objects.\nThe seeds of suffering are burnt up. The vestures either become isolated and\nfunctionless, or are lifted to the level of their wearer. This is freedom. Now\nthe Soul shines in its immaculate form, in its pure effulgence - it reigns\nsupreme. This is kaivalya, the indivisible state of existence .Discrimination\nis the finer tool for attaining enlightenment, and is applied to the ever\nsubtler levels of experience .Knowledge of the distinction between the purest\naspect of mind (sattvic buddhi) and consciousness itself (purusha) brings\nsupremacy over all forms or states of existence, as well as over all forms of\nknowing. Absolute liberation or kaivalya is the end, the final state of the\nSelf in itself. Thus, the word iti is the last word of the sutra and of this<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c2062343270619180569\" style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_22M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/12/comments-overflow-for-inoperative-load_14.html?showComment=1513299301098#c2062343270619180569\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888;\">December 15, 2017 at 6:25 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_22MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">SOMEONE ASKED ME TO EXPOUND ON QUANTUM ENTANGLEMENT IN VEDAS</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">WHY DOES WIKIPEDIA BAN CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL. BECAUSE I GO WITH VEDAS AGAINST STUPID PEOPLE LIKE ISAAC NEWTON AND ALBERT EINSTEIN ( WHO SAYS FASTER THAN SPEED OF LIGHT IS IMPOSSIBLE ) \u2013 BOTH THIEVES WHO STOLE FROM VEDAS WITHOUT UNDERSTANDING .</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">ANCIENT VEDIC ASTROLOGY FACTORED IN QUANTUM ENTANGLEMENT.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">One of the core objections to astrology is that there is no known scientific mechanism to account for how it all works. Well for this modern scientists have to work hard for another 500 years . The lack of a mechanism using 5 low bandwidth human senses is MAD justification for dismissing a Quantum entanglement phenomenon.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">Quantum entanglement says that two entangled particles affect each other irrespective of distance and time. We humans are NOT what you see in the mirror, we are balls of energy called SOULS.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">IN KERALA ASTROLOGY WE RUSTLE COWRIE SHELLS. MY WIFE MATCHED MORE THAN 500 HOROSCOPES FOR MY ELDER SONs BRIDE . AT EVERY INSTANCE THE ASTROLOGER RUSTLED COWRIE SHELLS TO PICK UP A RANDOM NUMBER OF SHELLS.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">The lodestone (compass) was used successfully for several millennia in India. Kerala navigators traded with crete . Yet, no white man understood the Earth's magnetic field until the 20th century.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">In Mahabharata Arjuna shot his arrow into the red ruby eye of a magnetic fish floating unsteadily overhead in a transparent rotating bowl filled with water, by looking at its reflection in a placid pool of water below. He won the hand of Princess Draupadi at the Swayamvar. This is the ultimate test of human consciousness .</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">Only a couple of mammals like elephant, dolphin and bonobos can pass the mirror and colour test.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">Quantum entanglement breaks the bedrock rules of standard physics: that nothing can travel FASTER THAN LIGHT , that objects are only influenced by their immediate surroundings\u2014that we need to verify by using our limited bandwith five sense for scientific approval.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">Through quantum entanglement, seemingly independent particles become intertwined. Entangled atoms can no longer be considered separate entities, but make sense only as part of a whole \u2014 even though the atoms may be far apart.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">Quantum entangled particles can be used for \u201cquantum communication\u201d \u2014 a means of sending super secure messages that doesn't rely on cables, wireless signals, or code.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">Through a trick of quantum mechanics, you can link two particles in a special way, separate them, and then observe the effects of one upon the other over large distances. This is known as quantum entanglement \u2014 placing two objects in the same entangled quantum state.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">Entanglement can be demonstrated in the lab with particles of light. When these two particles, or photons, are separated over large distances, they are still correlated with each other. If you measure one particle, the other particle's state will be determined immediately no matter how far it is away.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">Because any interference with an entangled particle, even the mere act of observing it, automatically affects its partner, these missives can't be hacked. To hear quantum physicists tell it, entangled particles could help build a \u201cquantum internet,\u201d give rise to new kinds of coding, and allow for faster-than-light communication \u2014 possibilities that have powerful appeal in an era where hospitals, credit card companies, government agencies, even election systems are falling victim to cyber attacks.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">Quantum entanglement is a quantum mechanical phenomenon in which the quantum states of two or more objects have to be described with reference to each other, even though the individual objects may be spatially separated. This leads to correlations between observable physical properties of the systems.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">CONTINUED TO 2-</span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_22BR\" style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span id=\"bc_0_22b+seedBpewD\" kind=\"d\"></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-thread inline-thread\" id=\"bc_0_18T\" kind=\"t\" style=\"margin: 8px 0px; padding: 0.5em 1em;\" t=\"0\" u=\"0\">\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span id=\"bc_0_22b+seedBpewD\" kind=\"d\"><span class=\"thread-toggle thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_18TT\" kind=\"g\" style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; cursor: pointer; display: inline-block;\"><span class=\"thread-count\" id=\"bc_0_18TN\"></span></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"thread-dropContainer thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_18TD\" style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span id=\"bc_0_22b+seedBpewD\" kind=\"d\" style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span class=\"thread-drop\"></span></span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_22b+seedBpewD\" kind=\"d\" style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span class=\"thread-toggle thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_18TT\" kind=\"g\" style=\"cursor: pointer; display: inline-block; font-size: 16px;\"><span class=\"thread-count\" id=\"bc_0_18TN\"></span></span></span><br />\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n</div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_22b+seedBpewD\" kind=\"d\" style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"></span><br />\n<ol class=\"thread-chrome thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_18TC\" style=\"list-style-type: none; padding: 0px;\"><span id=\"bc_0_22b+seedBpewD\" kind=\"d\" style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_18B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 16px 0px 8px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c5166903869757240958\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_18MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">CONTINUED FROM 1-</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">For example, it is possible to prepare two particles in a single quantum state such that when one is observed to be spin-up, the other one will always be observed to be spin-down and vice versa, this despite the fact that it is impossible to predict, according to quantum mechanics, which set of measurements will be observed.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">As a result, measurements performed on one system seem to be instantaneously influencing other systems entangled with it. Quantum entanglement has applications in the emerging technologies of quantum computing and quantum cryptography, and has been used to realize quantum teleportation experimentally.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">Imagine you are a photon, a packet of light. You are a tiny blip of energy, hurtling through the universe on your own. But you have a twin, another photon to whom you have been intimately connected since the day you were born. No matter what distance separates you, be it the width of a lab bench or the breadth of the universe, you mirror each other. Whatever happens to your twin instantaneously affects you, and vice versa.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">Entangled photons don't need wires or cables to link them, but on Earth it is necessary to use a fiber optic cable to transmit one of the particles to its desired location. But fibers absorb light as the photon travels through, so the quantum connection weakens with every mile the particle is transmitted. The previous distance record for what's known as quantum teleportation, or sending information via entangled particles, was about 141 kilometers</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">But no light gets absorbed in space, because there's nothing to do the absorbing. Space is empty. This means that entangled particles can be transmitted long distances across the vacuum and not lose information. Entangled particles sent through space could vastly extend the distance across which entangled particles communicate. The behavior of entangled particles in space and across vast distances offers insight into the nature of space-time.. Entangled photons know what their partner is doing</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">Modern physicists know that there are actually four fundamental forces: the two nuclear forces, the electromagnetic force and the gravitational force. All of these play a role in binding matter together, from the tiniest of atoms to the largest of planets.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">It is well known in physics experiments that the observer can become entangled with the object that they are measuring, changing the measurement.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">It is written in the Vedas that we are all entangled in some way, and there really is a connection between every living thing in the galaxy. The effects of quantum entanglement tend to be very small for everyday objects.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">Ancient Maharishis with 12 strand DNA and king sized pineal glands used their bodies for generating laser beams.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">Processes in large biomolecules could be influenced by quantum entanglement effects. In the world of condensed matter physics \u2014 the study of solids \u2014 entanglement is more commonplace.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">A superconductor floating over a magnet in the Meissner effect \u2014 are from macroscopic quantum entanglements of electrons, or a spooky \"force\" acting over large distances. Quantum entanglement plays a role in modern physics and it is a binding principle for matter and energy. However, quantum entanglement on a large scale is difficult to achieve, and even more difficult to observe in living creatures.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">Scientists are still struggling to develop a theory of Quantum Gravity and as a result a Grand Unified Field Theory\u2014which is represented by the divine 3D geometry of Sri Yantra\u2014the symbol of OM , whose digital number is 108.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">In Vedic Puranas the Great bear constellation stars ( 7 Sapt Rishis ) and entangled with their 7 wives in Pleiades constellation</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">CONTINUED TO 3-</span></div>\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_19B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 16px; Vedanta says that we live in a time obstructed world using 5 narrow band senses -- and also a timeless realm in the quantum dimension, where what you see is NOT what you get.</span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">It was written down in the Vedas said 7000 years ago that mind is over matter. Quantum physicists were shocked at the results of the double slit experiment, which proved that our ancient maharishi seers were right.</span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">The intuition of Indian mystics led them to understand the multidimensional reality and of space-time continuum which is the basis of the modern theory of relativity.</span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">While modern mathematics, science and technology centre around linear dimensional reality , but the Vedic systems avail multidimensional spiraling reality.</span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">The timeless principles of Vedanta is expressed in the technical language of Quantum Mechanics and the philosophy of science, even today with little or no attenuation of meaning.</span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">Vedas are NOT about Indra running around like a jack ass looking for lost cows and then doing a sacrifice so that he can get the strength to screw the asuras...as told by BR Ambedkar and EVR Periyar.</span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">Heisenberg's uncertainty principle, is an equation of maya.</span></div>\n<div style=\"text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: blue; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: blue; font-size: large;\">Ideas of quantum physics do not seem so crazy if we read Indian philosophy\u2014W Heisenberg ( German physicist )</span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">WHEN THEY LEARNT THAT MODERN SCIENCE IN ENTABGLED WITH VEDAS PASSED ON ORAL ROUTE FOR 330 CENTURIES AND PENNED DOWN 70 CENTURUES AGO, THEY ALL CONVERTED TO HINDUISM, THREW AWAY THEIR BIBLES, PICKED UP BHAGAWAD GITA AND WROTE IN THEIR WILLS THAT THEY WANT TO BE CREMATED ( NOT BURIED )</span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/11/rip-impossible-with-burial-world-is.html</span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: purple; font-size: large;\">VEDIC SRUTIS HAVE GOLDEN MEAN (1.618 ) , FIBONACCI SERIES , PASCALS TRIANGLE, LUCAS NUMBERS , SRI YANTRA ( GEOMETRY OF OM ), ULAM SPIRAL, PRIME NUMBER MAGIC EMBEDDED IN IT \u2013</span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">Capt ajit vadakayil</span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">..</span></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</span></ol>\n<span id=\"bc_0_22b+seedBpewD\" kind=\"d\" style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">\n</span></div>\n</div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">hanam esham\nkleshavaduktam<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">prasankhyanepyakusidasy\nsarvathavivekakhyaterdharmameghah samadhih<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">tatah\nkleshakarmanivrittih<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">tada\nsarvavarannamalapetasyjnanasyaanantyajgyeyam alpam<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">tatah kritarthanan\nparinamakramapari samaptirgunanam<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">kshannapratiyogi\nparinamaparantanigrarhyah kramah</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">purusharthashoonyanan\ngunanan pratiprasavahkaivalyan, svaroopapratishtha va chitishaktireti<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">3.04--&nbsp;&nbsp; trayam ekatra samyama</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">These three together -\ndharana, dhyana and samadhi - make up integration or samyama. &nbsp;&nbsp;In\nsamyama the three are a single thread, evolving from uninterrupted attention to\nsamadhi. <o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The word \u201csamyama\u201d is\ncomprised of two parts: sam, meaning \u201ctogether,\u201d and yama, meaning\n\u201cdiscipline.\u201d.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is the tool used to\nreach the subtler levels of non-attachment. A sharp tool of discrimination used\nfor deep introspection, it uncovers our true nature. The finest discrimination\neventually leads to liberation, which then allows us to move past our ignorance\nand ego.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The only prerequisit\nfor this practice is to have some inner silence when we sit for meditation.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The nervous system also\ngoes to silence with the mind, and our metabolism slows way down. &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The yogi\nloses does NOT get a hop even if Miss World does a naked lapdance . &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Semen\nretention is a piece of cake \u2013this is NOT the way Gandhi did it using naked\nteenage girls under the same blanket and mutual enemas.</span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">Kachrawaal is slipping\ninto Paranoid Schizophrenia boosted by faalthu EGO \u2014Samayama will do him a\nworld of good. &nbsp; &nbsp;I wish him well-- show some fuckin' LEVEL HEADED behavior after your 12 day Vipassana session.&nbsp;</span></b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></b></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">Surprise us, Khujliwaal &nbsp;!&nbsp;</span></b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></b></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">Remember \"CM of Delhi\" is a very small post !!</span></b><o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><span style=\"background-color: lime; color: blue;\"><br /></span></b></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"></span></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/02/vipassana-meditation-capt-ajit.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/02/vipassana-meditation-capt-ajit.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Samyama is the greatest\nsynthesis of human consciousness, the smooth seamless synthesis of three:\ndharana, dhyan, samadhi. Samyama, is a state of immobility, and a samyami is\none who represses his passions and stays motionless.&nbsp; The following analogy illustrates the organic\nrelationship between dharana, dhyana and samadhi. When one contemplates a\ndiamond, one at first sees with great clarity the gem itself. Gradually one\nbecomes aware of the light glowing from its centre. As awareness of the light\ngrows, awareness of the stone as an object diminishes. Then there is only\nbrightness, no source, no object. When the light is everywhere, that is\nsamadhi.&nbsp; Dharana brings stability in\nmind, dhyana develops maturity in intelligence and samadhi acts to disperse the\nconsciousness.&nbsp;&nbsp; Dharana, dhyana and\nsamadhi intermingle to become samyama, or integration. The intermingling of\nmind, intelligence and consciousness is samyama of the three. The vision of the\nseer is equivalent to nirbija samadhi. Advanced Yogis can reach this state by mere yoga nidra -- tip of forefinger meeting thumb. &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">A yogi who is can do\nsamyama defeats all 'cognitive obscurations' ( kleshas).</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Samyama means perfect control of the\nmind.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Here it is a technical name for\nthree inseparable processes of Dharana, Dhyana and Samadhi taken\ncollectively.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Samyama is the state of\nresting in deep inner silence</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">(samadhi),\nalong with the ability to pick up a thought (focus/dharana) and let it go\ninward (meditation/dhyana). If thoughts are coming, we just let them go without\nentertaining them. In samyama practice we do not entertain the mantra either.\nWe start by not favoring anything but being easy in our silence, however much\nsilence we have from our just completed meditation session, and naturally\npresent in us from our months or years of daily meditation. This is the\nstarting point for samyama \u2014 silence. The only prerequisite for doing samyama\npractice is having some inner silence.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Because releasing into\nsilence puts us in touch with our inner stillness, beyond the reflections and\nreactions of surface thinking. We suddenly have \u201cbroadband access\u201d to our\ndeepest levels of will and awareness, if only we will stay out of our own way\nby allowing our awareness to rest in silence, after we have released the\nthought or feeling, using the samyama technique. This can be difficult at first\nfor a raw yogi aspirant, but with practice and faith (trusting the process and\nthe answers that come up from this stillness) it gets easier and more natural.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Samyama is a practice\nby which the yogi can gain tremendous knowledge and power. It can be applied\nwith a focus on any one object at a time. When it is practiced on an object,\nthe yogi practicing samyama is able to dive deep and find the truest knowledge\nof the object. The yogi should begin by focusing on tangible objects, then\nrefining their practice as they shift to subtler objects. Regular practice of\nsamyama will firm a yogi\u2019s knowledge of samadhi, making it more natural and\nlucid.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Don\u2019t make the LUST\nemotion stronger by thinking about it, we just bring it up and before the mind\ncan grab it and make it a full-fledged story, we drop it into stillness.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">3.05 ---tajjayat\nprajnaalokah<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">From mastery of samyama\ncomes the light of awareness and insight. </span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When mastery of\nintegration (samyama) is achieved, the splendour of wisdom and insight shines\nbrilliantly, harmonising the known with the knowable and revealing the soul. Awareness\nand cognition become firmer and sharper by direct spiritual perception. Ordinarily,\nhuman intelligence flutters from object to object and from place to place,\nmaking it impossible to interpenetrate fully into any one thing. In samyama,\nthe knower comes closer and closer to the known and, unifying in it, loses his\nseparateness. When one has succeeded in making this Samyama, all powers come\nunder his control. Samyama should be first applied to gross things, when when\nyou begin to get knowledge of the gross, slowly, by stages, it should be\nbrought to finer things. Through the mastery of that three-part process of\nsamyama, the light of knowledge, transcendental insight, or higher\nconsciousness (prajna) dawns, illumines, flashes, or is visible. Praj\u00f1a is used\nto refer to the highest and purest form of wisdom, intelligence and\nunderstanding. Pragya is the state of wisdom which is higher than the knowledge\nobtained by reasoning and inference. The Sanskrit word Praja is the combination\nof \"</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092a\u094d\u0930</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"> (pra-)\" which prefix means \u2013\nbefore, forward, fulfiller, and used as the intensifier but rarely as a\nseparate word and \"</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u091c\u094d\u091e</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"> (jna)\" which\nmeans - knowing or familiar with. The third chapter of the Aitareya Upanishad\nteaches \u2013 </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0924\u0924\u094d\u092a\u094d\u0930\u091c\u094d\u091e\u093e\u0928\u0947\u0924\u094d\u0930\u092e\u094d</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092a\u094d\u0930\u091c\u094d\u091e\u093e\u0928\u0947</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092a\u094d\u0930\u0924\u093f\u0937\u094d\u0920\u093f\u0924\u0902</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092a\u094d\u0930\u091c\u094d\u091e\u093e\u0928\u0947\u0924\u094d\u0930\u094b</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0932\u094b\u0915\u0903</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092a\u094d\u0930\u091c\u094d\u091e\u093e\u0928\u0902</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092c\u094d\u0930\u0939\u094d\u092e</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n(III.i.3) that all that exist, all phenomena cosmic and psychical, are rooted\nin Prajna i.e. Consciousness, and Consciousness is Brahman.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The main theme of\nKaushitaki Upanishad is that without Praja\u0101 the senses do not work, which is\nknowledge, for by knowledge one sees clearly; Praj\u00f1\u0101 is Brahman and all things\nare rooted in Brahman. Prana is Prajna, self-consciousness. It is Prajna that\ntakes possession of Speech, and by speech one obtains words; takes possession\nof the nose, and one obtains odours; takes possession of the eye, and one\nobtains all forms; takes possession of the ear, and one obtains all sounds;\ntakes possession of the tongue, and one obtains all tastes of food; takes\npossession of the hands, and one obtains all actions; takes possession of the\nbody, and one obtains pleasure and pain; takes possession of the organ, one\nobtains happiness, joy and offspring; takes possession of the feet, one obtains\nall movements and takes possession of mind, and one obtains all thoughts,\nwithout Praj\u00f1\u0101, no thoughts succeed. The Vedantasara tells us that Brahman is\nto be thought of as being Nirguna, without attributes; Brahman is the sole\nreality, everything else is Anatman, non-existence and non-knowledge., Prajna (</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092a\u094d\u0930\u093e\u091c\u094d\u091e</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">)\n\u2013 </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0905\u0938\u094d\u092f</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u091c\u094d\u091e\u093e\u0924\u094d\u0935\u092e\u0938\u094d\u092a\u0937\u094d\u091f\u094b\u092a\u093e\u0927\u093f\u0924\u092f\u093e\u0928\u0924\u093f\u092a\u094d\u0930\u0915\u093e\u0936\u0915\u0924\u094d\u0935\u093e\u0924\u094d</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n||</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u096a\u096a</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">||\nIntelligence in its invisible form refers to Brahman \u2013 </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0906\u0928\u0928\u094d\u0926\u092d\u0941\u0915\u094d</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u091a\u0947\u0924\u094b\u092e\u0941\u0916\u0903</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092a\u094d\u0930\u093e\u091c\u094d\u091e\u0903</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n(\"Pr\u0101j\u00f1a, the enjoyer of bliss, with Consciousness for its aid\"\n(Mandukya Upanishad 5)), the all-knowing reality, in its visible form it is the\nparviscient Jiva which is able to differentiate itself from Ishvara \u2013 </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0938\u0924\u093e</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0938\u094b\u092e\u094d\u092f</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0924\u0926\u093e</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0938\u092e\u094d\u092a\u0928\u094d\u0928\u094b</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092d\u0935\u0924\u093f</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n(\"Then (in dreamless sleep), my dear, he (Jiva) becomes one with Existence\n(Ishvara) \" (Chandogya Upanishad VI.viii.1)).[14]</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">3.06 --- tasya\nbhoomishu viniyogah</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Samyama can be applied\nin various spheres to derive its usefulness. </span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Patanjali explains that\nthis insight and wisdom needs to be decently circularised in various spheres of\none's life.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">One who has not\nmastered the lower stages cannot attain the higher, nor can he jump the\nintermediate stages. If eash stage is followed in turn, one becomes\nfamiliarised with them by degrees, and full insight develops.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">This sutra affirms that\nno one can expect success or mastery without regular practice, and also warns\none not to jump to higher stages of practice without first establishing a firm\nfoundation through the primary steps of yoga.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Patanjali does not\nmention kundalini, but speaks of the energy of nature flowing abundantly in a\nyogi . Kundalini is a neologism. This energy of nature (prakrti shakti) was\noriginally known as agni or fire. Later yogis called this fire kundalini (the\ncoiled one) as its conduit in the body is coiled 3.5 times at the base of the\nspine. It is, however, clear that many who undergo an overpowering experience\nof fusion with the universal consciousness reap, through their unpreparedness,\nmore pain than benefit. To the lucky, healthy few, such an experience can serve\nas an incite to begin a true spiritual search, but to many others it can bring\nruthless physical and psychological disorders. The eightfold path, although it\nmay appear mystical to the uninitiated, is ultimately a path of spiritual\nevolution whose motto might well be 'safety first'. The foundation must be\nsecure, as Patanjali emphasises when he places yama and niyama first, and when\nhe marks an explicit step up between asana and pranayama.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yoga is the teacher of\nyoga. The power of yoga manifests through yoga alone. He who does not become\ncareless, negligent or inattentive, he alone rests in yoga and enjoys yoga.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">'Yogena yogojhatavya\nyogo yogatpravartate yo pramattastu yogena sa yogo ramate dram.'&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">That three-part process\nof samyama is gradually applied to the finer planes, states, or stages of\npractice.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The finer states\nnaturally come forward: When the practice of samyama is applied to the finer\nstates, the subtler aspects naturally reveal themselves during the deeper\npractices. It does not necessarily mean that you will know the details of those\nahead of time. Rather, the inner journey itself reveals the subtler aspects.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Stages are usually not\nskipped: Typically, the stages are experienced one after the other, as they\nreveal themselves, without skipping any of the stages of subtle experience\nalong the way.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">We need not experience\nall the stages: Even though the subtle states naturally come forward in a\nsystematic order, it is not essential that we seek out and experience each and\nevery one of the stages.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Samyama may not\nbe needed on all of the stages because proficiency might be attained through\nthe gift of grace.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Samyama may be applied\nin various spheres to derive its usefulness. It must be applied stage by stage.\nSamyama must be developed gradually.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">That\nthree-part process of samyama is gradually applied to the finer planes, states,\nor stages of practice.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is a note of</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">warning not to attempt to go too fast.</span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">3.07 --- trayam\nantaranggan poorvebhyah</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><i>These three aspects of\nyoga are internal, compared to the former five. <o:p></o:p></i></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Compared to the former\nfive aspects of yoga, it may he seen that dharana, dhyana and samadhi are more\nsubtle, internal, intimate and subjective practices. The first five, which deal\nwith the seen or cognisable sheaths, are called the external quest. Yama\npurifies the organs of action; niyama, the senses of perception; asana cleanses\nthe physical and organic aspects of the body; pranayama stops wastage of energy\nand increases stamina; pratyahara cleanses the mind. More intimately, dharana\ndevelops and sharpens intelligence, dhyana purifies consciousness and samadhi\nleads consciousness towards the soul. These three are directly involved in the\nsubtle sheaths of mind, intelligence and consciousness, and are very close to\nthe spiritual heart. They directly affect the spiritual path, and are therefore\ncalled the inner quest, or sabtja samadhi, because the sadhaka now has\none-pointed consciousness. In samadhi pada, Patanjali explained that\ntruth-bearing wisdom (rtambhara prajna) is the threshold between sabtja and\nnirbija samadhis. Here he describes samyama as the penultimate step towards\nnirbija samadhi. In the next sutra Patanjali explains that samyama is external\nto nirbija samadhi, and then proceeds, in 111.9-16, to interpenetrate the transformations\nin the very substance of the consciousness, leading one to experience its\nfinest state, which appears to be subtler than samyama. Outer awareness falls\naway: When asana (postures), pranayama (breath/prana), senses (pratyahara) are\nseen to be external, they have been left behind, and fall away from awareness.\nThis is much like the way the external world seems to vanish for us when we are\nintimately involved with our body and breath awareness practices. It is as if\nthe body, breath, and senses no longer exist for us; we have gone beyond them,\nnow truly entering into the mind field. The mind field is now perceived in a\nvery different way, compared to the noisy, monkey mind when earlier trying to\njust sit still. &nbsp;Concentration,\nmeditation, and samadhi are intimate: When asana, pranayama, and pratyahara\n(body, breath, senses) fall away, or are left behind, then concentration\n(dharana), meditation (dhyana), and samadhi are seen as quite intimate or\ninternal. The boundary line between out there and in here has significantly\nshifted; we are now ready to explore the subtler realities, and to begin the\nprocess of setting those aside as well (vairagya, non-attachment, 1.15-1.16),\nstill seeking the eternal Self at the core of our being (1.3). &nbsp;These three [dharana, dhyana and samadhi] are\nmore internal than the preceding five limbs. These three are more direct aids\nto experience than the five limbs previously described. These three are nearer\nthan those that precede. Before these we had the Pranayama, the Asana, the Yama\nand Niyama; these are external parts of these three\u2014 Dharana, Dhyana, and\nSamadhi. Yet these latter even are external to the seedless Samadhi. When a man\nhas attained to them he may attain to omniscience and omnipresence, but that would\nnot be salvation. These three would not make the mind Nirvikalpa, changeless,\nbut would leave the seeds for getting bodies again; only when the seeds are, as\nthe Yogi says, \u201cfried,\u201d do they lose the possibility of producing further plants.\nThese powers cannot fry the seed Antarangam has nothing to do with sexology as\nsome Tamil Agama TV channels are propagating<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c4146091017548123181\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_27M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/08/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_5.html?showComment=1470540299525#c4146091017548123181\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">August 7, 2016 at 8:54 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_27MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nTulsidas wrote in Awadhi language about the twin sons of Rama, ( Luv/ Kush ) who were born in the forest after Rama kicked his pregnant wife Sita out. We Indians never heard this bullshit story till the white invader came to India.<br />\n<br />\nLuv/ Kush captures the white ashwamedha horse of Rama. This bullshit episode also never happened.<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/09/ashwamedha-yagam-bloodless-sacrifice.html<br />\n<br />\nJew Rothschild created Awadhi language ( from a dialect of Nepal ) to inject poison into Hinduism.<br />\n<br />\nSame way Jew Rothschild created the Urdu language to divide and rule.<br />\n<br />\nJew Rothschild used the FAKE and backdated Bhakti movement, using the FAKE and backdated DASAs to shatter the bed rock Sanatana Dharma ( Laws of Karma/ Moksha ).<br />\n<br />\nHe was unsuccessful though.<br />\n<br />\nIt does NOT matter if you sing bhajans in praise of the lord throughout the day, take a dip hundreD times in Kashi\u2014you cannot escape the laws of Karma. Nobody can raise the kundalini unless the Karmic baggage is worked out and is approaching zero.<br />\n<br />\nThe Guru Granth Sahib is packed with DASA verses.<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/07/unknown-history-of-sikhs-and-sikhism.html</div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">3.08 --- tad api\nbahiranggan nirbijasy</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Similarly, samyama is\nexternal when compared to seedless (nirbija) samadhi. </span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Even this perfection of\ndharana, dhyana and samadhi appears external to one who has experienced the\nseedless samadhi, the direct vision of the soul. Citta is divided into five\nstates: 1. ksipta, a mental force, which is scattered, in a state of disarray\nand neglect 2. mudha, a foolish and dull state 3. viksipta, agitated and\ndistracted, neither marshalled nor controlled 4. ekagra, a state of one-pointed\nattention 5. niruddha, where everything is restrained, for the sadhaka to reach\nthe threshold of kaivalya. As samyama is dependent on a support or a form, it\nis called 'external' compared to nirbija samadhi. Once the vehicles of nature\n(body, organs of action, senses of perception, mind, intelligence, reason and\nconsciousness) cease to function, the soul (atman) shines forth, and the\nsadhaka dwells in kaivalya and not on its threshold. Sleep comes naturally when\nmental activities cease without effort. In the same manner, perfection in\nsabtja samadhi takes one towards the seedless state of samadhi or kaivalya, as\nsmoothly as falling asleep. The soul surfaces of its own accord.All eight rungs\nof the Yoga Sutras come to be seen as external practices, when considered in\nrelation to nirbija samadhi. The state where the mind has no impressions of any\nsort and nothing is beyond its reach [nirbijah samadhi] is more intricate than\nthe state of directing the mind towards an object [samadhi]. However, these\nthree practices are external, and not intimate compared to nirbija samadhi,\nwhich is samadhi that has no object, nor even a seed object on which there is\nconcentration.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">3.09 ---\nvyutthananirodhasanskarayorabhibhavapradurbhavau nirodhakshannachittanvayo<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Nirodhaparinamah</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Study of the silent\nmoments between rising and restraining subliminal impressions is the\ntransformation of consciousness towards restraint (nirodha parinamah).</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Transformation by\nrestraint of consciousness is achieved by study of the silent moments that\noccur between the rising of impressions and one's impulse to hold them back,\nand between the restraining impulse and the resurgence of thought.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sensory involvement\nleads to attachment, desire, frustration and anger. These usher in\ndisorientation, and the eventual decay of one's true intelligence. Through the\ncombined techniques and resources of yama, niyama, asana, pranayama and\npratyahara one learns control. These are all external means of restraining\nconsciousness, whether one focuses on God, or the breath, or in an asana by\nlearning to direct and disseminate consciousness. All this learning develops in\nthe relationship between subject and object. It is relatively simple because it\nis a relative, dual process.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cutting one's ties to\nsense objects within one's own consciousness carries immensely more weight than\nany severance from outside objects; if this was not so, a prisoner in solitary\nconfinement would be halfway to being a yogi. Through the inner quest, the\ninner aspects of desire, attraction and aversion are brought to an end.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nirodha parinama is\nassociated with the method used in meditation, when dharana loses its sharpness\nof attention on the object, and intelligence itself is brought into focus. In\ndharana and nirodha parinama, observation is a dynamic initiative.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Through nirodha\nparinama, transformation by restraint or suppression, the consciousness learns\nto calm its own fluctuations and distractions, deliberate and non-deliberate.\nThe method consists of noticing, then conquering and finally enlarging those\nsubliminal pauses of silence that occur between rising and restraining thoughts\nand vice versa.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">As long as one\nimpression is replaced by a counter-impression, consciousness rises up against\nit. This state is called vyutthana citta, or vyutthana samskara (rising\nimpressions). Restraining the rising waves of consciousness and overcoming\nthese impressions is nirodha citta or nirodha samskara. The precious\npsychological moments of intermission (nirodhaksana) where there is stillness\nand silence needs to be prolonged into extra-chronological moments of\nconsciousness, without beginning or end.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The key to understanding\nthis wheel of mutations in consciousness is to be found in the breath. Between\neach inbreath and outbreath, one experiences the cessation of breath for a\nsplit second. Without this gap, one cannot inhale or exhale. This interval\nbetween each breath has another advantage - it allows the heart and lungs to\nrest. This rest period is called 'savasana' of the heart and lungs.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The yogis who had\ndiscovered pranayama called this natural space kumbhaka, and advised humans to\nprolong its duration. So, there are four movements in each breath - inhalation,\npause, exhalation and pause. Consciousness, too, has four movements - rising\nconsciousness, a quiet state of consciousness, restraining consciousness and a\nquiet state of consciousness.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Inhalation actually\ngenerates thought-waves, while exhalation helps to restrain them . The pauses\nbetween breaths, which take place after inhalation and exhalation are akin to\nthe intervals between each rising and restraining thought. The mutation of\nbreath and mutation of consciousness are thus identical, because both are\nsilent periods for the physiological and intellectual body. They are moments of\nvoid in which a sense of emptiness is felt. Sadhakas are advised by Patanjali\nto transform this sense of emptiness into a dynamic whole, as single-pointed\nattention to no-pointed attentiveness This will become the second mode -\nsamadhi pannama.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">In this process one\noften loses awareness on account of suppression and distraction. Having\nunderstood these silent intervals, one has to prolong them, as one prolongs\nbreath retention, so that there is no room for generation or restraint of\nthoughts (Lord Krishna says in the Gita that 'What is night for other beings,\nis day for an awakened yogi and what is night for a yogi is day for others'\n(11.69) This sutra conveys the same idea. When generating thoughts and their\nrestraint keep the seeker awake, it is day for him, but night for the seer.\nWhen the seer is awake in the prolonged spaces between rising and restraining\nthought, it is day for him, but night for the seeker. To understand this more\nclearly, one can imagine the body as a lake. The mind floats on its surface,\nbut the seer is hidden at the bottom. This is darkness for the seer. Yoga\npractice causes the mind to sink and the seer to float. This is day for the\nseer.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Just as one feels\nrefreshed after a sound sleep, the seer's consciousness is refreshed as he\nutilises this prolonged pause for rejuvenation and recuperation. But at first,\nit is difficult to educate the consciousness to restrain each rising thought.\nIt is against the thought current (pratipaksa) and hence induces restlessness,\nwhile the movement from restraint towards rising thought is with the current\n(paksa), and brings restfulness. To transform the consciousness into a pure\nsattvic state of dynamic silence, one must learn by repeated effort to prolong\nthe intermissions . If no impressions are allowed to intrude, the consciousness\nwill remain fresh, and rest in its own abode. This is ekagrata pannama.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Consciousness has three\ndharmic characteristics - to wander, to be restrained and to remain silent. The\nsilent state must be transformed into a dynamic but single state of awareness.\nPatanjali warns that in restraint old impressions may re-emerge - the sadhaka\nmust train to react instantly to such appearances and cut them off in their\nsource. Each act of restraint re-establishes a state of restfulness. This is\ndharma pannama. When a serene flow of tranquillity is maintained without\ninterruption, then samadhi pari-qatna and laksana pannama begin. During this\nphase the sadhaka may become trammeled in a spiritual desert. At this point he\nmust persevere to reach oneness with the soul and abide in that state (avastha\npannama) eternally. This final goal is reached through ekagrata pannama.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Letting go of the\naudience: Imagine that you are in a lecture hall several minutes before the\nspeaker has come to give his </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">talk. All\nof the people are standing around the lecture hall, and the room is filled with\na loud rumble of the collective voices of many conversations. You are watching\nthis, taking it all in, with your mind pulling your senses here and there.\nThen, the speaker enters the hall, walks to the podium, and begins to speak.\nTwo things happen simultaneously: your attention moves away from all of the\nother people, while at the same time, your attention becomes directed towards\nthe speaker.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mastery over\ntransitions: The transition away from the people in the audience is somewhat\nlike nirodhah parinima (the transition of suspension), and the companion\ntransition of attention moving towards the speaker is somewhat like samadhi\nparinima (the transition to absorption. When the attention repeatedly remains\nwith the speaker, this is somewhat like ekagra parinima (the transition where\nthe same absorption repeatedly arises and subsides.. It is the mastery over\nthat process of transition itself that the Yogi is seeking. If you have mastery\nover these processes of transition, then you have mastery over all of the\nthought patterns, which might otherwise control your mind, thoughts, actions,\nand speech.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is a convergence\nwith the transitions: The samskaras or deep impressions naturally arise through\na transition phase between inactive and active. Those samskaras also naturally\nreturn from the active phase to the inactive. When there is a convergence\n(anyaya) of the attention with the rising and falling transitions, a high\ndegree of mastery comes. This is an extremely subtle process of samyama .</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The impressions which\nnormally arise are made to disappear by the appearance of suppressive efforts,\nwhich in turn create new mental modifications. The moment of conjunction of\nmind and new modifications is nirodha parinama.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Study of the silent\nmoments between rising and restraining subliminal impressions is the\ntransformation of consciousness towards restraint (nirodhaparinamah).</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the vision of the\nlower samadhi is suppressed by an act of conscious control, so that there are\nno longer any thoughts or visions in the mind, that is the achievement of\ncontrol of the thought-waves of the mind.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The mind is capable of\nhaving two states based on two distinct tendencies. These are distraction and\nattention. At any one moment, however, only one state prevails, and this state\ninfluences the individual's behavior, attitudes, and expressions.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">That high level of\nmastery called nirodhah-parinamah occurs in the moment when there is a\nconvergence of the rising tendency of deep impressions, the subsiding tendency,\nand the attention of the mind field itself.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vritti' means literally\na 'whirlpool'. It is a thought-wave in the lake of Chitta. Modification of the\nmind is known as 'Parinama.'&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Why do Vrittis arise\nfrom the Chitta? Because of the Samskaras or Vasanas. If you annihilate all\nVasanas or desires, all Vrittis will subside by themselves. If all the Vrittis\nsubside, the mind becomes calm, serene and silent. Then alone you will enjoy\npeace and bliss. Therefore all happiness lies within. You will have to get it\nthrough control of mind and not by CHOPPING OFF YOUR OWN BALLS for semen retention.\n</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Manas is\nSankalpa-vikalpatmaka (willing and doubting). &nbsp;It thinks: whether to go to a place or not;\nwhether to do this or not; whether this is good or bad. The mind is of doubting\nnature. It is the Buddhi or the light that determines one way or other. Buddhi\nis Nischayatmaka. It is the determining faculty. The mind, intellect and egoism\nare various process in the mind-stuff. Ahamkara is the self-asserting\nprinciple. It does the function of Abhimana. It creates Mamata or mineness. &nbsp;EGO is the root cause for all human\nsufferings. All Vrittis hang on this one Vritti, Aham Vritti. &nbsp;It is the root cause for human ignorance.</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nirodha.\nIt means restraint or suppression. By suppressing the modifications of the\nmind-stuff or restraining of the thought-waves, a man obtains Yoga.</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chitta\nVritti Nirodha is the path of Raja Yoga. Suppression of thought waves is easily\nsaid. But it is very difficult indeed to practice</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">3.10 --- tasya\nprashantavahita sanskarat</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The restraint of rising\nimpressions brings about an undisturbed flow of tranquillity. </span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By maintaining perfect\nawareness in the intervals between rising and restraining impressions,\nsteadiness becomes effortless and natural. Then the stream of tranquillity\nflows without any ripples in consciousness.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">By adept, repeated\nefforts, consciousness is transformed, cultured, refined and polished. It\nproduces freedom from all forms of fluctuations, so that undisturbed peace can\nflow. As each drop of water aids to form a lake, so one must continue to\nprolong each tranquil pause between rising and restraining impressions. An\nexpert of abhyasa and vairagya keeps himself steady, so that calmness can flow\nuninterruptedly.
