It breaks the pain cycle by reducing muscle tension and tension headaches. Yogic deep diaphragmatic breathing has higher ideals than an expensive massage. &nbsp; Massage causes movement of blood and lymph, oxygenating our tissues, reducing muscle tension, and helping detoxify our body by ridding it of waste. &nbsp; Yoga does NOT allow you to eat like a glutton. Having an overfull stomach causes you to do chest breathing.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">MORBIDLY OBESE PEOPLE\nCAN REDUCE WEIGHT BY YOGIC BREATHING--FAT GOES OUT AS SHIT</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">!&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Deep diaphragmatic\nbreathing stimulates the cleansing work of the lymph system by creating a\nnegative pressure pulling the lymph through the lymph system. This increases\nthe rate of elimination of toxins from visceral organs by more than 16 TIMES.. &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lymph nodes connected\nto the stomach, kidneys, liver, pancreas, spleen, large and small colons, and\nother vital organs are located just under the diaphragm - over 62% of all lymph\nnodes in total!&nbsp;</span><br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-LQZRtmEH6yg/V57sAY9okcI/AAAAAAABLMw/MbL-J8CQweQ8nDk34J3nL4_DPZfoeuApwCLcB/s1600/downlobbad.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-LQZRtmEH6yg/V57sAY9okcI/AAAAAAABLMw/MbL-J8CQweQ8nDk34J3nL4_DPZfoeuApwCLcB/s1600/downlobbad.png\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">When we breathe more\nair, by hyperventilation, we get less oxygen in body cells. In fact, the slower your automatic\nbreathing pattern at rest (down to only 3 breaths/min), the larger the amount\nof oxygen delivered to cells.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /><o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>I SENT MY WIFE TO\nEXPERIENCE THE SUDARSHAN KRIYA , HYPERVENTILATION OF SRI SRI RAVISHANKAR, WITH\nPROPER INTRUCTIONS .&nbsp; SHE DID IT EXACTLY\nTHE WAY IT WAS TOLD .&nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span><br />\n<b><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">HER BODY EXTREMES\nSTARTED TINGLING / VIBRATING/ CARPOPEDAL SPASMS, &nbsp;LIKE WHEN YOU SIT IN FRONT OF A POWERFUL FAN&nbsp;</span></span></b><br />\n<b><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</span></b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">SHE WAS CONSTRAINED TO TUCK HER LEGS AND HANDS WITHIN HER BODY AND THEN TELL THE TEACHER THAT SHE WONT DO THIS NONSENSE ANYMORE.</span></b><o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hyperventilation occurs\nwhen the rate and quantity of alveolar ventilation of carbon dioxide exceeds\nthe body's production of carbon dioxide. Hyperventilation can be voluntary or\ninvoluntary.&nbsp; When alveolar ventilation\nis excessive, more carbon dioxide will be removed from the blood stream than\nthe body can produce. This causes the concentration of carbon dioxide in the\nblood stream to fall and produces a state known as hypocapnia. The body\nnormally attempts to compensate for this metabolically. If excess ventilation\ncannot be compensated metabolically, it will lead to a rise in blood pH. This\nrise in blood pH is known as respiratory alkalosis. When hyperventilation leads\nto respiratory alkalosis, it may cause a number of physical symptoms:\ndizziness, tingling in the lips, hands or feet, headache, weakness, fainting\nand seizures. In extreme cases it can cause carpopedal spasms (flapping and\ncontraction of the hands and feet).<o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">In normal breathing,\nboth the depth and frequency of breaths are varied by the neural (or nervous) system,\nprimarily in order to maintain normal amounts of carbon dioxide but also to\nsupply appropriate levels of oxygen to the body's tissues. This is mainly\nachieved by measuring the carbon dioxide content of the blood; normally, a high\ncarbon dioxide concentration signals a low oxygen concentration, as we breathe\nin oxygen and breathe out carbon dioxide at the same time, and the body's cells\nuse oxygen to burn fuel molecules, making carbon dioxide as a by-product.\nNormal minute ventilation is generally 5\u20138 liters of air per minute at rest for\na 70 kg man. If carbon dioxide levels are high, the body assumes that oxygen\nlevels are low, and accordingly, the brain's blood vessels dilate to assure\nsufficient blood flow and supply of oxygen. Conversely, low carbon dioxide\nlevels cause the brain's blood vessels to constrict, resulting in reduced blood\nflow to the brain and lightheadedness. The gases in the alveoli of the lungs\nare nearly in equilibrium with the gases in the blood. Normally, less than 10%\nof the gas in the alveoli is replaced with each breath taken. Deeper or quicker\nbreaths as in hyperventilation exchange more of the alveolar gas with ambient\nair and have the net effect of expelling more carbon dioxide from the body,\nsince the carbon dioxide concentration in normal air is very low. The resulting\nlow concentration of carbon dioxide in the blood is known as hypocapnia. Since\ncarbon dioxide is carried as bicarbonate in the blood, the loss of carbon\ndioxide will drive bicarbonate to combine with hydrogen ions (protons) to form\nmore carbon dioxide. The loss of hydrogen ions results in the blood becoming\nalkaline, i.e. the blood pH value rises. This is known as a respiratory\nalkalosis. This alkalization of the blood causes vessels to constrict\n(vasoconstriction). The high pH value resulting from hyperventilation also\nreduces the level of available calcium (hypocalcemia), which affects the nerves\nand muscles, causing constriction of blood vessels and tingling. This occurs\nbecause alkalization of the plasma proteins (mainly albumin) increases their\ncalcium binding affinity, thereby reducing free ionized calcium levels in the\nblood. Therefore, low levels of carbon dioxide can cause tetany by altering the\nalbumin binding of calcium such that the ionised (physiologically influencing)\nfraction of calcium is reduced.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Therefore, there are\ntwo main mechanisms that contribute to the cerebral vasoconstriction that is\nresponsible for the lightheadedness, paresthesia, and fainting often seen with\nhyperventilation. Stupid people think that this most damaging thing is a good\nthingy.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">One mechanism is that low carbon dioxide\n(hypocapnia) causes increased blood pH level (respiratory alkalosis), causing\nblood vessels to constrict. The other mechanism is that the alkalosis causes\ndecreased freely ionized blood calcium, thereby causing cell membrane\ninstability and subsequent vasoconstriction and paresthesia.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: x-large; line-height: 150%;\"><b>WARNING--WARNING--WARNING&nbsp;</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/ZPEmChqqlZI/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/ZPEmChqqlZI?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 115%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/04/ph-for-chemical-tankerman-capt-ajit.html\" style=\"background-color: yellow;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/04/ph-for-chemical-tankerman-capt-ajit.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I once joined a BRAND\nNEW Chemical tanker . They had destroyed the Zinc Silicate coating of cargo\ntanks . All were at a loss\u2014till I brought the white skinnedd European CHOOTS from darkness to light.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE:&nbsp; Once i joined a chemical tankers with zinc\nsilicate coating, with zinc shedding-- and coating permanently destroyed. Zinc\nSilicate coating cannot take pH l outside the range 6 to 9. When you produce DI\n/ Demi water with 2 bed systems -- you have to be careful. Taste the water to\nsee if it is NOT sour ( acidic ) . Filtered water is first passed through\ncation exchange cylinder which removes CA2+/ MG2+ ( water hardness ions )\ncations from it and an equivalent amount of H+ ions are released into the\nwater. The water is now softened.&nbsp; (THIS\nACIDIC WATER CAN DESTROY YOUR ZINC SILICATE COATING WHICH CANNOT TAKE pH LESS\nTHAN 6.) Then this water is passed through an anion exchange cylinder which\nremoves SO42- CL- ( chlorides ) anions from it and an equivalent amount of OH-\nions are released into the water. The chlorides are now removed. The water is\nnow called de ionized water or de mineralized water: UNQUOTE&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/07/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_31.html?showComment=1470035458363#c2007267290033885990\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">August 1, 2016 at 12:40 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_23MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nSANATANA DHARMA AND VEDANTA IS QUANTUM PHYSICS.<br />\n<br />\nYOU DONT UNDERSTAND \"CLOSED FEEDBACK LOOP\"-- SO I WONT WASTE TIME ON THIS. AS A SHIP CAPTAIN I KNOW AUTOMATION .<br />\n<br />\nWE DONT MAKE A SAINT OUT OF MOTHER TERESA ( LIKE THE POPE ) BY BULLSHIT MIRACLES.<br />\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\">THE ULTIMATE GURU TEACHES BY PERSONAL EXPERIENCE , AS EXPERIENCE IS THE ONLY SOURCE OF KNOWLEDGE . NOTHING IS REAL UNLESS EXPERIENCED .</span></b><br />\n<br />\nANYWAY I DONT WANT TO LAUNCH INTO \"EVOLUTION \" - IT IS BEYOND THE SCOPE OF YOUR QUESTION .<br />\n<br />\nWHEN MY WIFE DELIVERED BY FIRST SON, I ASKED HER TO WITNESS HER OWN BODY--EVERY PAIN AND ACHE-- SHE TOLD ME<br />\n<br />\nI DONT GET IMPRESSED BY STUPID WOMEN WHO BOAST ON TV ABOUT THE HAJAAAAR &nbsp;PAINS OF LABOR TO CUT A MAN DOWN TO SIZE.</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</span></ol>\n<span id=\"bc_0_24b+seedbAAdD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_24b+seedbAAdD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Carbon dioxide is a\nbyproduct of the energy-generating chemical reactions occurring within the\ncells of the body. Carbon dioxide produced by these chemical reactions within\nthe cells of the body diffuses into blood which transports it into the lungs\nwhere it is eliminated from the body in exhaled air.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;But carbon dioxide is not\njust an inert waste product.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is also a vital component in the maintenance of\nthe chemical environment of the body, because it also regulates the acidity of\nblood, as well as other fluids outside and inside each cell of the body.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Regulation of acidity\nand alkalinity within the tissues of the body is extremely important. The\nmachinery of the body is driven by myriad complex chemical reactions, and the\nsum total of these chemical reactions result in optimally healthy body function\nat a certain levels of acidity and alkalinity inside and outside the cells of\nthe body.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Acidity and alkalinity of fluids is expressed in terms of the \u201cpH\u201d, a\nscale varying from 0 to 14. A pH = 0 is maximally acid, a pH = 7 designates\nneutrality, being neither acid nor alkaline, while a pH =14 is maximally\nalkaline. A fluid is acid if the pH is less than 7, and is alkaline if the pH\nis greater than 7. Blood is slightly alkaline with a pH = 7.4, while the\ninsides of cells are slightly acid with a pH = 6.9.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Carbon dioxide (CO2)\nreacts reversibly with water (H2O) to form carbonic acid (H2CO3). But carbonic\nacid is unstable at body temperature and is usually in the ionized state,\nforming hydrogen ion (H+), and bicarbonate ion (HCO3-) as in the chemical equation\nbelow.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">CO2 + H2CO3 </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria math&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u21d4</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"> H+ + HCO3-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">At any given partial\npressure of carbon dioxide within the tissues of the body, a balance exists\nbetween carbon dioxide and the bicarbonate concentration. This balance between\ncarbon dioxide and bicarbonate ion determines the pH in blood and other tissues\nof the body. The Henderson-Hasselbach equation used to calculate the pH in\nblood shows this relationship in mathematical form.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">pH = 6.1 + log[HCO3-] \u00f7\n(0.03 \u00d7 PCO2)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The normal partial\npressure of carbon dioxide in arterial blood is about 40 mmHg, and the normal\nbicarbonate concentration is about 24 millimoles per liter. Put these figures\ninto the Henderson-Hasselbach equation above, and you get the pH of arterial\nblood which is 7.4.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As mentioned above, the\nconcentration of bicarbonate in blood is 24 millimoles per liter. This is also\ntrue for all the fluids in between the cells of the body. Inside the cells of\nmost tissues, the bicarbonate concentration is about 8 millimoles per liter.\nThis means there is a lot of bicarbonate in the body. It takes time before such\na large mass of bicarbonate ion decreases, or increases in size as a result of\nchanges in blood carbon dioxide concentration. And it is this large mass of\nbicarbonate that lies at the origin of the effects of hyperventilation.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So what\nis hyperventilation?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In practical terms, all\ncarbon dioxide is eliminated from the body as a gas in exhaled air. When the\nvolumes of air breathed into and out of the lungs increases above what is\nnormal, more carbon dioxide than normal is eliminated from the body. This\nlowers the pressure of carbon dioxide within the body, whereby carbonic acid\nchanges back to into water and carbon dioxide, eventually resulting in a new\nequilibrium between bicarbonate ion and carbon dioxide.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">CO2 + H2O \u2190 H2CO3 \u2190 H+\n+ HCO3-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But this spontaneous\nchemical reaction whereby carbonic acid returns to water and carbon dioxide, is\nnot as rapid as the speed with which carbon dioxide is removed from the body by\nhyperventilation. So when body carbon dioxide pressure is suddenly lowered\nrelative to the bicarbonate concentration, the pH increases above normal because\nthe bicarbonate concentration does not decrease as rapidly. The condition where\npH of the body is increased above normal is called \u201calkalosis\u201d, and all the\nbody fluids and cells become more alkaline than normal. This effect lies at the\nbasis of the mental effects of hyperventilation.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So what are the mental effects\nof hyperventilation?<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><b>PEOPLE WHO DO CHEST BREATHING AND HYPERVENTILATION BECOME <span style=\"color: red;\">FAT OBESE CHOOTS </span>!</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/07/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_31.html\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/07/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_31.html</span></a><o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/XdI7OvFJBM0/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/XdI7OvFJBM0?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WW2 fighter pilots\nfound out clouding of consciousness and unconsciousness became increasingly\nlikely when the carbon dioxide pressure fell below 30 mmHg &nbsp;-- that all people developed neurological\nsymptoms due to hyperventilation at a carbon dioxide pressure of 20 mmHg .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">People with\nhyperventilation commonly describe symptoms such as disturbed mentation,\nimpaired concentration, poor memory, and hallucinations. Feelings of\ndepersonalization are also common, where hyperventilating persons describe\nsensations of unreality, or feeling everything is confused and dream-like. Hallucinating\neffects have been used by FAKE gurus to make an ass out of devotees..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Visual experiences such as blurred vision,\ntunnel vision, flashing lights, and seeing double also occur). &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hyperventilation can cause\nbrain death.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Patients with severe\nCOPD, who were admitted to an intensive care, underwent mechanical ventilation,\nand shortly afterwards developed unmanageable epileptic convulsions, severe\nbrain damage, and even brain death .Changes in body function caused by\nhyperventilation explain these deaths, as well as explaining the mental and\nvisual manifestations of hyperventilation. The acidity and alkalinity of bodily\nfluids is determined by the relative difference between the concentration of\nbicarbonate and the pressure of carbon dioxide as expressed by the\nHenderson-Hasselbach equation . For the situation in arterial blood, the normal\nPCO2 = 40 mmHg, and the [HCO3-] = 24 millimoles, this means that the\n\u201cbicarbonate / carbon dioxide ratio\u201d is about 0.6. If the ratio is larger than\n0.6, a fluid or tissue will be alkaline because this means there is less carbon\ndioxide due to hyperventilation. And when the ratio is less than 0.6, this\nmeans the fluid or tissue is acid.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Now people with severe\nchronic obstructive airways disease often have a higher than normal carbon\ndioxide concentration in their blood, simply because they cannot breathe deeply\nand rapidly enough to remove all the waste carbon dioxide from their bodies.\nAnd because the carbon dioxide concentration is higher than normal, this drives\nthe chemical equilibrium to the right such that more carbonic acid is made.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">CO2 + H2O \u2192 H2CO3 \u2192 H+\n+ HCO3-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The carbonic acid\ndissociates into hydrogen ion and bicarbonate ion. Eventually the relative\nconcentrations of bicarbonate ion and the pressure of carbon dioxide are such\nthat the ratio of 0.6 is achieved, and the pH once again equals 7.4. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Now just imagine this\nman was admitted to the intensive care with respiratory failure, where he was\ntreated with mechanical ventilation of his lungs. Imagine that overenthusiastic\nphysicians adjusted the mechanical ventilator such that his arterial carbon\ndioxide pressure was rapidly lowered to the normal level of 40 mmHg. Because\ncarbon dioxide is more rapidly eliminated from the body than the bicarbonate\nconcentration changes, the resulting bicarbonate / carbon dioxide ratio would\nbe = 55 / 40 = 1.38, which indicates his blood would suddenly become very\nalkaline. If we calculate the exact pH, the resulting pH in his arterial blood\nwould = 7.76. This means his blood would very rapidly become very alkaline\nindeed. This effect is true hyperventilation, because the change of carbon\ndioxide pressure is relative to the original carbon dioxide pressure in an\nabnormal equilibrium state. Such changes can profoundly affect the functioning\nof the body. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The flow of blood\nthrough the brain is called the \u201ccerebral blood flow\u201d. The normal flow of blood\nthrough the adult human brain is about 50 milliliters blood per 100 gm brain\ntissue per minute (50 ml/100 gm/min)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Unethical Hypoxia flows\n( deficiency in the amount of oxygen reaching the tissues) &nbsp;and hyperventilation experiments were conducted by the sadist Jap doctor Dr Shiro\nIshii and shared with USA\u2014at the expense of Chinese.&nbsp;</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">This is why Chinese hate\nJapan and USA.&nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">These wounds on China will\nNEVER heal.</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/10/doctor-death-shiro-ishii-emperor.html\"><span style=\"background-color: lime; color: windowtext;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/10/doctor-death-shiro-ishii-emperor.html</span></a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/ygGhy0OjYH0/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/ygGhy0OjYH0?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\"><b>THIS BLOGSITE ASKS THE INDIAN GOVT TO PROFILE ALL TRAITORS AND DESH DROHIS. &nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\"><b>ENOUGH IS ENOUGH !&nbsp;</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>Below: A Pakistani terrorist praising Barkha Dutt&nbsp;</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\"><b><iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/c3tx5j4Vwx0/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/c3tx5j4Vwx0?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></b></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\"><b>WARN THEM FIRST AND THEN PUNISH THEM AS PER LAWS OF THE LAND .</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/hNwPD0I5Tms/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/hNwPD0I5Tms?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hyperventilation\nreduces the cerebral blood flow by causing constriction [narrowing] of the\narteries supplying the brain with blood <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cerebral blood flow is\ndirectly related to the carbon dioxide pressure in the blood, and inversely\nrelated to the pH of the blood flowing through the arteries going to the brain .\nIn other words, the lower the carbon dioxide pressure in the blood, the lower\nthe cerebral blood flow&nbsp; All people\ndevelop neurological manifestations due to hyperventilation below an arterial\ncarbon dioxide pressure of 20 mmHg. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Extreme levels of\nhyperventilation, where the carbon dioxide pressure drops below 25-30 mmHg\ncause the cerebral blood flow to drop below 40 ml/100 gm/min, a level below\nwhich increasingly more people develop manifestations of cerebral hypoxia <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Binding of oxygen with\nhemoglobin provides further evidence that hyperventilation may well cause brain\ntissue hypoxia.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Blood is a transport\nfluid. It transports oxygen, electrolytes, proteins, hormones, fats and sugars\nto tissues, and removes waste products of metabolism, hormones, products of\nmetabolisms, etc away from tissues. Oxygen is transported by blood from the\nlungs where it enters the body.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">However oxygen is very poorly soluble in blood,\nand blood contains negligible amounts of dissolved oxygen. Practically all\noxygen in blood is chemically bound to hemoglobin inside red blood cells. But\nthe chemical binding of oxygen with hemoglobin is directly affected by the\nacidity and alkalinity of blood (i.e. the pH of blood).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span><br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c4385507591302682391\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_27M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/07/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_31.html?showComment=1470040366739#c4385507591302682391\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">August 1, 2016 at 2:02 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_27MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nAGAIN I REPEAT<br />\n<br />\nTHE WHITE MAN DID NOT HAVE A SINGLE INVENTION OR DISCOVERY IN HIS NAME TILL HE INVADED INDIA<br />\n<br />\nBEFORE HE INVADED INDIA EVERY VESTIGE OF WESTERN KNOWLEDGE WAS STOLEN AND PATENTED.<br />\n<br />\nWHEN KODUNGALLUR UNIVERSITY CAME TO KNOW THAT PYTHAGORAS/ PLATO/ ARISTOTLE / SOCRATES ETC WERE PATENTING INDIAN KNOWLEDGE IN THEIR OWN NAMES , THEY STOPPED TAKING GREEKS AS STUDENTS .<br />\n<br />\nTHIS IS WHY GREEK KNOWLEDGE FROM A GIANT WATERFALL CAME TO DRY ( NOT EVEN A TRICKLE ) SUDDENLY<br />\n<br />\nTHEN THE WHITE MAN STARTED STEALING FROM ARABS.<br />\n<br />\nEVERY VESTIGE OF ARAB KNOWLEDGE WAS SOLD FOR GOLD --- TRANSLATED INTO ARABIC FROM KODUNGALLUR UNIVERSITY<br />\n<br />\nNEVER MIND ZAKIR NAIKS CRIES--<br />\n<br />\nAL HULL BULL INVENTED -PHYSICS<br />\nAL KULL BRRR INVENTED - MATH<br />\nAL BULL PRRR INVENTED - CHEMISTRY<br />\nAND SO ON<br />\n<br />\nTHIS IS A MAN WHO GIVES AWAY HIS OWN WATANs KNOWLEDGE TO ARABS SO THAT HE CAN GET MONEY FROM ARAB KINGS ..<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hyperventilation causes\nloss of carbon dioxide from the body, causing the pH of blood to increase and\nbecome more alkaline. When blood is more alkaline, hemoglobin binds more\ntightly with oxygen.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Oxygen bound to hemoglobin within red blood cells does\nnothing, because binding of oxygen to hemoglobin within red blood cells is no\nmore than the body's method of transporting oxygen to the capillaries within\nthe tissues of the body. Within the capillaries of the tissues of the body, the\nchemical bond between oxygen and hemoglobin is weak enough to allow oxygen to\nleave the blood and diffuse into the cells surrounding the capillaries, so\nproviding oxygen for the vital, energy-generating chemical processes within the\ncells forming the tissues of the body.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But when hyperventilation causes oxygen\nto bind more tightly to hemoglobin, less oxygen is released to diffuse into the\ntissues surrounding the capillaries. &nbsp;Hyperventilation\ncan cause less oxygen to enter the tissues of the body from the capillaries, so\nresulting in hypoxia of the cells outside the blood vessels, even though the\nblood contains more than sufficient oxygen.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hyperventilation has\nprofound effects on the transport and delivery of oxygen to the tissues of the\nbody. Hyperventilation reduces the cerebral blood flow, and to make matters\nworse, hyperventilation also causes oxygen to bind more tightly with\nhemoglobin. Both factors combine to reduce the availability of oxygen to the\ntissues of the brain, and can even cause cerebral hypoxia. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The tragic fatal\neffects of relative hyperventilation in humans with severe chronic obstructive\nairway disease, also reveals that hyperventilation in humans can result in\ncerebral hypoxia severe enough to cause actual brain damage and brain death . Hyperventilation\nhas &nbsp;been implicated as one of the\npotential causes of postoperative cognitive dysfunction.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hypocapnia is a state\nof reduced carbon dioxide in the blood due to hyperventilation.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hyperventilation\ndescribes excessive ventilation of the lungs, beyond what is required to\nachieve normal arterial blood gases. Hyperventilation, or over-breathing, does\nnot add oxygen to arterial blood. This is because under normal physiological\nstates arterial blood is close to saturation with respect to oxygen and is\nsimply not able to absorb more.&nbsp; Hyperventilation\nhas little effect on arterial pO2 and almost no effect on oxygen saturation\nwhich is nearly 100% under normal circumstances. Its main effect is to lower\npCO2 and produce a respiratory alkalosis.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If we breathe within normal\nparameters this mechanism works very well to deliver oxygen to brain and body\ntissues. By contrast, over-breathing (i.e breathing more than the physiological\nnorm) can upset this delicate balance thereby reducing oxygen delivery to cells.&nbsp; Hyperventilation does not only reduce the\ntotal cerebral blood flow, but also changes the distribution of blood flow\nwithin the brain. Modern studies reveal that blood flow to the frontal, occipital,\nand parieto-occipital cortex , as well as the hippocampus is reduced relative\nto other areas of the brain within seconds to minutes of commencing\nhyperventilation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">USELESS patented Sudarshan\nKriya is the Yoga equivalent of FAKE Shakti oil of TRIPLE ENZYME SRI<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">TRIPLE SRI fellow has\nPATENTED this Sudharshan Kriya by trying to rehash Yogic pranayama exercises\nlike Bhastrika and Kapalabhati.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">TRIPLE SRI RAVISHANKAR\nIS A BOARD MEMBER IN ISRAEL\u2019S ELIJAH INTERFAITH INSTITUTE FOUNDED BY RABBI\nGOSHEN-GOTTSTEIN .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is against the\ndharma of a Hindu guru to patent anything.&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The ancient maharishis\nhad depersonalized themselves in the search for truth-- unlike modern Western\nphilosophers who lift ideas and patent it in their names.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The sages who gave them\nto us did not care to leave their names; the truths they set down in the Vedas\nand Upanishads were eternal, and the identity of those who arranged the words\nirrelevant.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-ALtAEckFjgU/V58WycHmARI/AAAAAAABLNE/WIF6G8WN3VsqF7GT-p6VZ1HX9uLOboP7gCLcB/s1600/BefHTDore-3ff00x253.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"539\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-ALtAEckFjgU/V58WycHmARI/AAAAAAABLNE/WIF6G8WN3VsqF7GT-p6VZ1HX9uLOboP7gCLcB/s640/BefHTDore-3ff00x253.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Four years ago Triple\nSri Ravishankar fooled the students of IIT&nbsp;\nKanpur with some bullshit oil drops.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Triple Sri called for a\nvolunteer to come up on stage for a \u201cpatented\u201d magic oil surprise\ndemonstration. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One of the students\nfrom the back rows of the auditorium was chosen to share the dais. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The chosen volunteer, a\nmale student wearing a black t-shirt with horizontal white stripes, was asked\nto extend his arm parallel to the floor, clinch his fist and resist the pulling\ndown of his arm.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Triple Sri &nbsp;gripping the volunteer\u2019s arm near the wrist,\nwas able to pull down his arm easily over and over again, much to the\namusement&nbsp; of the na\u00efve audience.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He then produced from\nhis pocket a small vial containing some oil.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The volunteer was then\nasked to rub and spread this oil over his arm. After the volunteer took a step\nback and a deep breath to relax, the whole exercise was repeated again \u2013 except\nthis time Triple Sri with his gargantuan paunch struggled quite hard to pull\ndown the volunteer\u2019s arm, amazing the vast audience.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The volunteer, visibly\nimpressed and believing that he had in fact become stronger in a matter of\nseconds after the application of the oil, went onto fall at the feet (cultural\npractice of surrender) of the extraordinary messiah Triple Sri.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large;\"><b>BELOW: HOLOTROPIC BREATHWORK -- &nbsp;CONMANs HYPERVENTILATION YOGA--BASTARDS !</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/E5v_D3WNg70/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/E5v_D3WNg70?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<b style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, serif; font-size: x-large; line-height: 24px;\"></b><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These relative changes\nin blood flow and electroencephalogram reflect reduced activity in these\nregions of the brain. The frontal lobes of the brain are required for cognitive\nfunctions such as memory, experience of time, directed attention, reflective\nconsciousness, and the idea of self.. So hyperventilation induced cognitive\nchanges such as disturbed mentation, impaired concentration, and poor memory,\nare readily explained by reduced frontal cortical function - nicely termed\n\u201ctransient hypofrontality\u201d.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The occipital cortex performs primary and secondary\nvisual processing, while the parieto-occipital cortex integrates body sensory\ninformation into the body image.. Reduced function in these regions of the\nbrain certainly explains other experiences occurring during hyperventilation,\nsuch as visual hallucinations, feelings of depersonalization, or feeling that\neverything is confused and dream-like.&nbsp; All\nthese things mean hyperventilation can temporarily induce profound changes in\nbrain function and the resulting conscious mental function.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">These effects even\nform the basis for a particular form of FAKE psychotherapy ( <span style=\"color: red;\">con-man grabbing\npower</span> ) during which patients perform prolonged hyperventilation - a brain damaging therapy\ncalled \u201cHolotropic Breathwork\u201d</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<b style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, serif; font-size: x-large; line-height: 24px;\"><br /></b>\n<b style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, serif; font-size: x-large; line-height: 24px;\">BELOW: HOLOTROPIC BREATHWORK FOUNDERS -- &nbsp;CONMANs HYPERVENTILATION YOGA--BASTARDS !</b><br />\n<b style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, serif; font-size: x-large; line-height: 24px;\"><br /></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/YVILRQ4gHBk/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/YVILRQ4gHBk?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ZIONIST&nbsp; EVANGELIST CON-MEN ARE CREATING MORE AND MORE\nBULLSHIT ABOUT RED SEA PARTING , IN AS MUCH AS\nTHEY NOW CONSIDER IT AS SWARA PRANAYAMA OF SHIVA OF IDA / PINGALA BREATHING\n\u2014TEE HEEEEEE !<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BLAH&nbsp; BLAH--&nbsp;\nThis is spoken of symbolically in the Bible as the times when the waters\nof the Red Sea and the Jordan River parted, standing on the right and left\nhands, while the Hebrews passed dry shod through their midst and reached their\ngoal. Since these two \u201cPass-overs\u201d are really motionless, they are \u201cdry\u201d\npassages, motionless movement.- BLAH&nbsp;\nBLAH&nbsp; FUCKIN\u2019 BLAH <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: x-large;\"><b>AIYYYOOOOOOOOO !</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>BRAAAYYYYYYYYYYYYYY !!</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I HAVE LISTENED TO THOUSANDS\nOF HOURS OF EVANGELIST TV CHANNELS \u2013</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">NOT TO PICK UP ANYTHING USEFUL&nbsp; - BUT TO GET Me KICKS &nbsp;. . AND LAUGH MY GUTS OUT --<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Most swimmers know that\na short period of hyperventilation prior to diving allows them to extend the\nperiod they can spend underwater. But this not a safe technique, because\nsometimes people who hyperventilate prior to diving lose consciousness and\ndrown while underwater..&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Part of the reason why this technique works is the\nfact that breathing is mainly regulated by the pressure of carbon dioxide in\nthe blood.&nbsp; &nbsp;Increased carbon dioxide pressures in arterial\nblood stimulates breathing, and generates a desire to breathe. Decreased carbon\ndioxide pressure in blood causes breathing to slow, reducing the urge to\nbreathe, sometimes entirely removing the urge to breathe.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Arterial blood oxygen\npressures measured in divers forced to surface due to the necessity to take a\nbreath after prolonged dives preceded by hyperventilation, are sometimes low\nenough to cause loss of motor control , and sometimes even low enough to cause\nloss of consciousness in some people .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Loss of consciousness\ndue to hypoxia is insidious, and is preceded by changes in mental state whereby\naffected people experience loss of insight, together with feelings of wellbeing..\nThis explains why many people do not even realize they are about to lose\nconsciousness due to hypoxia.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is the reason why some people who\nhyperventilate prior to an underwater dive, sometimes lose consciousness due to\ncerebral hypoxia before feeling the necessity to surface and breathe. And once\nthey lose consciousness while underwater, they subsequently drown if not\nrescued.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Anesthesiologists often\nexploit the various properties of hyperventilation during general anesthesia.\nFor example:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During neurosurgical\noperations on the brain, anesthesiologists often apply hyperventilation to\ncause constriction of the blood vessels of the brain. This reduces the volume\nof blood inside blood vessels within the substance of the brain, so reducing\nthe volume of the brain. Constriction of blood vessels also reduces bleeding.\nThe combination of both effects results in better operating conditions for the\nneurosurgeon.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hyperventilation below\nan arterial carbon dioxide pressure of 30 mmHg reduces the level of\nconsciousness, and sometimes even induces loss of consciousness. One\nconsequence of this is a reduction of drug dosages required for general\nanesthesia.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hyperventilation is\nsometimes used at the end of operations to reduce the level of consciousness,\nas well as to prolong and intensify the actions of residual concentrations of\nanesthetic drugs.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">How can hyperventilation\nintensify and prolong the actions of anesthetic drugs? The answer lies in the\nchemical nature of anesthetic drugs. Most drugs and most organic compounds are\neither weak acids or weak bases.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Anesthetic drugs are no different. In fact,\nexcept for thiopental, all anesthetic drugs are bases. Now a base interacts\nwith water molecules to form an equilibrium between an ionized form and a\nnon-ionized form. Just look at this chemical equilibrium where \u201cH2O\u201d is water,\nand \u201cB\u201d is the base molecule or drug.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When such a weak base dissolves in water,\nit interacts with water to acquire a hydrogen ion (H+), resulting in a free\nnegatively charged hydroxyl ion (OH) in the following manner.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">B + H2O </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria math&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u21d4</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"> BH+ + OH-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For example, morphine\nis just such a weak base, so the interaction with water is just the same, and\nforms an equilibrium as below where the proportions ionized and unionized\nmorphine are constant at each pH level.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Morphine + H2O </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria math&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u21d4</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"> MorphineH+ + OH-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Morphine is a weak\nbase. So when blood becomes more acid, (i.e. the pH decreases), a greater\nproportion of morphine exists in the ionized form. On the other hand, when\nblood becomes more alkaline and the pH increases, a smaller proportion of\nmorphine exists in the ionized form. The same is true for all other anesthetic\ndrugs ( except for rapid-onset short-acting barbiturate thiopental ). This may\nsound like a chemical subtlety of little practical consequence, but the concept\nof ionization of drugs used in anesthesia has important practical consequences.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">\u201cThe being who is the\nbreath within\u2013 him I meditate upon as Brahman.\u2026That which breathes in is thy\nSelf, which is within all.\u2026That which breathes out is thy Self, which is within\nall.\u2026Breath is the abode of Brahman\u201d-- &nbsp; (Brihadaranyaka Upanishad 2.1.6). 5000 BC<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>THIS POST IS NOW CONTINUED TO PART 60, BELOW-</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/08/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/08/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and.html</a><o:p></o:p></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-WhXhdAcjmsk/V54A-uK_ZDI/AAAAAAABLKk/hTfthJ4c8VgEZ-LyXJwh2l9Z6AOI2ZgugCLcB/s1600/ajit11%2B1.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-WhXhdAcjmsk/V54A-uK_ZDI/AAAAAAABLKk/hTfthJ4c8VgEZ-LyXJwh2l9Z6AOI2ZgugCLcB/s640/ajit11%2B1.jpg\" width=\"374\" /></a></div>\n<br />\nCAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL<br />\n..<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br /></div>\n", "author": {"id": "14410812789424637654", "displayName": "Capt. Ajit Vadakayil", "url": "https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654", "image": {"url": "//4.bp.blogspot.com/-QSnd-Z8F7Kc/XFtPudWdwlI/AAAAAAABfq4/vxrkFOO7Iu8Mf6-OaPgw6FPpRDSmMgLdgCK4BGAYYCw/s35/capt%25252BajitC%25252Bvadakayil.JPG"}}, "replies": {"totalItems": "64", "selfLink": "https://www.googleapis.com/blogger/v3/blogs/3564735312144269387/posts/147358303910670673/comments"}}, {"kind": "blogger#post", "id": "8268225526786927399", "blog": {"id": "3564735312144269387"}, "published": "2016-07-30T23:19:00+05:30", "updated": "2019-04-21T08:29:52+05:30", "etag": "\"iHf3yWDE_geBgZ8U7rgZ_xuTeAQ/dGltZXN0YW1wOiAxNTU1ODE1NTkyNjg4Cm9mZnNldDogMTk4MDAwMDAK\"", "url": "http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/07/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_30.html", "selfLink": "https://www.googleapis.com/blogger/v3/blogs/3564735312144269387/posts/8268225526786927399", "title": "SANATANA DHARMA , HINDUISM EXHUMED AND RESURRECTED, PART 58 - CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL", "content": "<div dir=\"ltr\" style=\"text-align: left;\" trbidi=\"on\">\n<b style=\"color: red;
