text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/XsSRrsrbLc8/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/XsSRrsrbLc8?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">CHECK OUT THE SOUND\nOF&nbsp; PATANJALIs YOGA SUTRAS PENNED DOWN\n7000 YEARS AGO, WHEN THE REST OF THE WORLD WERE RUNNING AROUND NAKED DOING\nGRUNT GRUNT<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/01/yoga-only-complete-exercise.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/01/yoga-only-complete-exercise.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/01/yoga-only-complete-exercise-part-2-capt.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/01/yoga-only-complete-exercise-part-2-capt.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">CHAPTER I-&nbsp; SAMADHI PADA-&nbsp;&nbsp; CONTEMPLATION<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">atha yoganushasanam<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">yogashchittavrittinirodhah<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">tada drashtuh svaroope\navasthanam<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">vrittisaroopyam\nitaratra<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">vrittayah pangchatayyah\nklishta aklishtah<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">pramannaviparyayavikalpanidrasmritayah<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">pratyakshanumanagamah\npramanani<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">viparyayo mithyajnanam\natadroopapratishtham<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">shabdajnaananupati\nvastushoonyo vikalpah<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">abhavapratyayalambana\nvrittirnidra<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">anubhootavishayasanpramoshah\nsmritih<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">abhyasavairagyabhyan\ntannirodhah<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">tatra sthitau yatno\nabhyasah<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">sa tu\ndirghakalanairantaryasatkarasevito dridha-bhoomih<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">drishtanushravikavishayavitrishnnasy\nvashikarasamjna vairagyam<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">tatparan\npurushakhyatergunnavaitrishnyam<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">vitarkavicharanandasmitaroopanugamatsanprajnatah<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">viramapratyayabhyasapoorvah\nsanskarashesho anyah<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">bhavapratyayo\nvidehaprakritilayanam<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">taduparagapekshatvat\nchittasya vastu jnatajnatam<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">sada jnatashchittavrittayastatprabhohpurushasyaparinamitvat<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">na tat\nsvabhasandrishyatvat<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ekasamaye\nchobhayanavadharannam<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">chittantaradrishye\nbuddhibuddheratiprasanggah smritisankarashcha<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">chiterapratisankramayastadakarapattausvabuddhisanvedanam<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">drashtridrishyoparaktan\nchittan sarvartham<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">tadasankhyeyavasanachitram\napi pararthan sanhatyakaritvat<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">visheshadarshin\naatmabhavabhavanavinivrittih<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">tada vivekanimnan\nkaivalyapragbharan chittam<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">tachchhidreshu\npratyayantarani sanskarebhyah<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">hanam esham\nkleshavaduktam<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">prasankhyanepyakusidasy\nsarvathavivekakhyaterdharmameghah samadhih<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">tatah\nkleshakarmanivrittih<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">tada\nsarvavarannamalapetasyjnanasyaanantyajgyeyam alpam<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">tatah kritarthanan\nparinamakramapari samaptirgunanam<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">kshannapratiyogi\nparinamaparantanigrarhyah kramah<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">purusharthashoonyanan\ngunanan pratiprasavahkaivalyan, svaroopapratishtha va chitishaktireti<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">2.46- -&nbsp; sthirasukham aasanam</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Asana is perfect firmness\nof body, steadiness of intelligence and benevolence of spirit.</span></i>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The definition of asana\nis stated as follows - whatever asana is performed, it should be done with a\nfeeling of firmness, steadiness and endurance in the body; goodwill in the\nintelligence of the head, and awareness and delight in the intelligence of the\nheart. This is how each asana should be understood, practised and experienced.\nPerformance of the asana should be nutrifying and illuminative.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">One of the major aims\nof yoga is to drive the lymph fluid. Main stream science and medicine has NOT\ncaught up yet with the Lymphatic system. A good Lymph doctor can have one look\nat you, and tell you what is wrong with you. This science is so exact. The\nlymphatic system in your body is a series of connected nodes, ducts and organs\nthat play a vital part in your immune system. The human arteries are like a\ntwo-lane highway bringing nutrients, oxygen and fluid to the body part. The\nvein is a one-lane highway taking away the used blood, and the lymphatic\nchannels are the other one-lane highway draining away the lymph fluid.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Two lanes in together,\nbut two out lanes separate out. Blood is responsible for collecting and\ndistributing oxygen, nutrients and hormones to the entire body where lymph is\nresponsible for collecting and removing waste products left behind in the\ntissues. Plasma leaks out of the capillaries to surround and bathe the body\ntissues. This then drains into the lymph vessels. The circulatory system\nprocesses an average of 20 liters of blood per day.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Roughly 17 liters per day of that gets\nreabsorbed directly into the blood vessels. The primary function of the lymph\nsystem is to provide an accessory route for these excess 3 liters per day to\nget returned to the blood.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">So colourless lymph is\nessentially recycled blood plasma. The biggest lymph vessel is the thoracic\nduct, which empties back into the blood circulation.&nbsp; At the cellular level, the lymphatic system\nis a pathway through which fluid flows from the intercellular spaces into the\nblood. The lymphatic system has vessels just like our circulatory system, but\ndoes not have a pump like the heart for the circulatory system . In order to\nclear the \u201clymph\u201d (the clear extracellular fluid that is collected by the\nlymphatic vessels and filtered by the lymph nodes), the lymphatic system must\nbe pumped manually.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lymph is a clear fluid\nthat travels through your body's arteries, circulates through your tissues to\ncleanse them and keep them firm, and then drains away through the separate\nlymphatic system.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lymph nodes are the\nfilters along the lymphatic system.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Their job is to filter out and trap bacteria, viruses, cancer cells, and\nother unwanted substances, and to make sure they are safely eliminated from the\nbody. Each cell is nourished by the nutrients, oxygen and proteins that flow\nacross the walls of capillaries into the interstitial fluid. There is a dynamic\nbalance between the forces that help those nutrients to first exit the\ncapillaries, and then get reabsorbed back into the blood stream. Since there is\nno pump, the lymph movement relies on contraction of smooth muscle tissue\nlining the walls of lymph vessels. Movement of skeletal muscles is also\nimportant for driving lymph along the systems network of vessels to lymph nodes\nand from these to lymph ducts where the lymph tissue joins cardiovascular\ncirculation. This is what the scientifically formulated Yoga positions do. 6000\nyears ago, Ayurveda and Yoga</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">realized\nthat many lymph nodes are situated near the region around the joints. Humans\nhave approximately 500-700 lymph nodes distributed throughout the body, with\nclusters found in the underarms, groin, neck, chest, and abdomen.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">All lymph vessels lead\nto lymph nodes. Lymph nodes can be as small as the head of a pin, or as big as\nan olive . Half of the lymph nodes in the body, are</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">located in the abdomen, and many are in the\nneck. The movements of the limbs help to act as a pump to move the lymph\nthrough the system. They are located in clusters around the knee, groin,\nelbows, shoulders and neck. Lymph nodes are also found in the central abdominal\nand chest area to assist with lymph drainage around the vital organs.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Every Yoga movement\ntake this into account. This is why Yoga must not be self inflicted.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Because the lymph doesn't have a heart to\npump it so good circulation of the lymphatic system depends on getting proper\nstretching exercise and yogic inverted postures which use gravity. Approximately\n70% are superficial lymphatic capillaries located</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">just under, the skin. The remaining 30%,\nwhich are known as deep lymphatic capillaries, surround most of the body\u2019s\norgans. The deep ones can be stimulated only by Yoga. Like veins, the lymphatic\nvessels, which are known as lymphangions, have one-way valves to prevent any\nbackward flow. Yogic asanas to aid lymph flow includes neck rotation, shoulder\nshrugs, ankle pumps, leg slides, shoulder blade squeezes etc. Yoga\ndiaphragmatic breathing and many yoga positions open up the chest cavity, while\nposes like shoulder stands, enlist gravity to help lymph fluid get where it is\nsupposed to go. Suryanamaskar for deep Lymph node drainage.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Surya namaskar can increase lymph flow 20\nfold.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Two-thirds of the lymph is\nproduces in the liver and intestines. Because the lymphatic system is a closed\npressure system and has one-way valves that keep lymph moving towards the\nheart, when one turns upside down like in Shirshasan , the entire lymphatic\nsystem is stimulated, thus strengthening your immune system. Lymph fluid is relieved\nfrom the legs and ankles and with regular practice prevents the buildup of\nfluid in the legs and feet.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Usually\ngravity is pulling us down and compressing our bodies, yet when we do\ninversions this process is completely reversed. So instead of working against\nus, gravity is working for us by decompressing our bodies and reversing the\nflow of the lymphatic system, which does NOT have a pump.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yoga asanasas help to\nshift Lymph fluids around your body in ways that you would not ordinarily be\nable to achieve in daily life . Kalari marma knock out points can permanently\ndamage certain NON-RETURN valves of the lymphatic system, when means the enemy\ngoes home bloats up and dies.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/zVrj2bDnddw/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/zVrj2bDnddw?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Some have taken this\nsutra to understand that any comfortable posture is suitable. If that were so,\nthese would be asanas of pleasure (bhogasanas) not yogasanas. This sutra\ndefines the perfected asana. From the very first sutra Patanjali calls for the\nhighest quality of attention to perfection. This discipline and attention must\nbe applied for the practice of every asana, to permeate to its very depths in\nthe remotest parts of the body. Even the meditational asana has to be\ncultivated by the fibres, cells, joints and muscles in cooperation with the\nmind. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Some divide asanas\ninto those, which cultivate the body and those, which are used in meditation.\nBut in any asana the body has to be toned and the mind tuned so that one can\nstay longer with a firm body and a serene mind. Asanas should be performed\nwithout creating antagonism in the muscle spindles or the skin cells. Space\nmust be created between muscle and skin so that the skin receives the actions\nof the muscles, joints and ligaments. The skin then sends messages to the\nbrain, mind and intelligence, which judge the appropriateness of those actions.\nIn this way, the principles of yama and niyama are involved and action and\nreflection harmonise. In addition the practice of a variety of asanas clear the\nnervous system, causes the energy to flow in the system without impediment and\nguarantees an even distribution of that energy during pranayama. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Usually the mind is closer to the body and to\nthe organs of action and perception compared to the soul. As asanas are\nrefined, they automatically become meditative as the intelligence is made to\ninterpenetrate towards the core of being. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Each asana has five functions to perform.\nThese include - conative, cognitive, mental, intellectual and spiritual.\nConative action is the exertion of the organs of action. Cognitive action is\nthe perception of the results of that action. When the two are melded together,\nthe discriminative faculty of the mind acts to guide the organs of action and\nperception to perform the asanas more perfectly; the rhythmic flow of energy\nand awareness is experienced evenly and without interruption, both\ncentripetally and centrifugally throughout the channels of the body. A pure\nstate of joy is experienced in the cells and the mind. The body, mind and soul\nare one. This is the manifestation of dharana and dhyana in the practice of an\nasana. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Patanjali's explanation of\ndharana and dhyana in sutras in 1-2 brilliantly describes the exact performance\nof an asana. He says, 'the focusing of attention on a chosen point or area\nwithin the body as well as outside is concentration (dharana). Maintaining this\nintensity of awareness leads from one-pointed attention to non-specific\nattentiveness'. When the attentive awareness between the consciousness of the\npractician and his practice is unbroken, it becomes dhyana. In 2.48, when\nPatanjali says that the pairs of opposites do not exist in the correct\nperformance of an asana, he clearly implies the involvement of dharana and\ndhyana.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The science and the\npractice of Hatha Yoga evolved to allow us to develop the requisite strength,\nflexibility, endurance and balance so we could stay in the meditative posture\nfor a long time. The stiffness and tension in the body is caused by physical\n(chemical) and mental toxins that get deposited in the body. Improper diet and\nlack of proper exercise is the main cause for the deposit of toxins in the\nbody. Hatha Yoga practices include a variety of asanas (physical postures),\npranayama (breathing practices), cleansing routines, and meditation to make the\nsystem strong, flexible and free of toxins. Hatha Yoga also provides guidelines\nfor the proper diet that should be followed by the yoga practitioner. A regular\npractice of these yoga techniques will help develop the steady and comfortable\nposture that is given as the very definition of asana in this sutra.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The physical aspect of\nwhat is called yoga in recent years, the asanas, has been much popularized in\nthe West due to the vast amount of benefits. Physically, the practice of asanas\nis considered to:-improve flexibility, improve strength,improve balance, reduce\nstress and anxiety, reduce symptoms of lower back pain, be beneficial for\nasthma and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease , increase energy and decrease\nfatigue, shorten labor and improve birth outcomes, improve physical health and\nquality of life measures in the elderly, improve diabetes management, reduce\nsleep disturbances, reduce hypertension, improve blood/ lymph</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">circulation, reduce weight etc.. The emphasis\non the physical benefits of yoga, attributed to practice of the asanas, has\nde-emphasized the other traditional purposes of yoga which are to facilitate\nthe flow of prana (vital energy) and to aid in balancing the koshas (sheaths)\nof the physical and metaphysical body.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">In 2007, a CHOOT bong\nnamed Bikram Choudhury, tried to patent yoga at the US patent office </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The govt of India </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">shot his mann ke tammanna down along with his\nmisti dohi , rosogolla and machcher jhol. In 2008, to clearly show that all asanas are\npublic knowledge and therefore not patentable, the government of India formed a\nteam of yoga gurus, government officials, and 200 scientists from the Council\nof Scientific and Industrial Research (CSIR) to register all known asanas in a\npublic database. The team collected asanas from 35 ancient texts including the\nHindu epics, the Mahabharata, the Bhagwad Gita, and Patanjali's Yoga Sutras and\nas of 2010, has identified 900 asanas for the database which was named the\nTraditional Knowledge Digital Library and made available to patent examiners. Yoga is a fried to those who embrace it in sincerity and totality. The lazy body becomes active , vibrant and healthy. Patanjali's 196 sutras cover all aspects of life, beginning with a prescribes code of conduct, and ending with man's vision of his true self. The process of yoga guides the yogi towards observation of his inner self. If dharma is the seed of yoga, kaivalya ( liberation ) is its fruit.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The different postures\nor asanas include:- Lying postures, Sitting postures, Standing postures, Inverted,\nor upside down postures. Yoga uses gravity to its potential to involve every\nmuscle, ligament and sinew of the human body. A yogi\u2019s body is firm , strong\nand supple.</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yoga improves your endurance, especially the more\nathletic forms of yoga such as ashtanga yoga.</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yoga is an\nexcellent weight-bearing exercise that can improve your bone density. This is\nparticularly beneficial for women approaching menopause, since yoga can help\nward off osteoporosis, or thinning of the bone. Yoga has been used to help\ntreat a wide variety of emotional and mental disorders, including acute anxiety,\ndepression, mood swings, criminal behavior and homosexuality.</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Even\nchildren can benefit from yoga. Those with attention deficit disorder and\nhyperactivity can learn to relax and get control by using yoga breathing and\nyoga asanas. Because yoga is a form of meditation, it results in a sense of\ninner peace and purpose, which has far-reaching health benefits. Yoga has been\nused to help heal victims of torture or other trauma.</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yoga\ncan help fight fatigue and maintain your energy throughout the day.Yoga is an\neffective treatment for a variety of autoimmune diseases. Yoga has NO barriers.\nIt does NOT matter how old or young you are. It does NOT matter of you are a\nsupreme endurance athlete or a fat couch potato.&nbsp;&nbsp; The body uses its own weight.&nbsp; The idea is to explore your limits,&nbsp; not strive for some pretzel-like perfection.&nbsp; Yoga does ISOMETRIC exercise - without need\nof any equipment- by using body weight alone .</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Isometric\nexercise gives brute strength -- Yoga was the first to introduce isometric\nexercise to this planet&nbsp; .</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yoga\nalso includes ISOTONIC exercise also so that contractile proteins are addressed.\nIsometric and isotonic exercises both build muscle.&nbsp; The difference is that isotonic exercises\ninvolve contracting muscles while moving the joints around.&nbsp; Isometric exercises involve contracting the\nmuscles while keeping the joints still.&nbsp;\nYou can find examples of both in yoga. </span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Each of the yoga poses is built to\nreinforce the muscles around the spine,&nbsp;\nwhich is the core from which everything else operates. When the core is\nworking properly, posture is improved, thus alleviating back, shoulder and neck\npain.</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yoga\nasanas stretch and hold-&nbsp; it causes&nbsp; muscles to lengthen,&nbsp; which gives the body a longer, leaner\nlook.&nbsp; Muscles are challenged as the mind\nand body have to work together simultaneously to hold a position or continue a\nsuccession without giving up.&nbsp; Breathing,\nposing, moving and increasing flexibility happen all together at one time,\nwhich solicits a new level of discipline in your mind and body.</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">sometric\nexercises are one of the best ways to build core strength.&nbsp; Isometric, stemming from the words \u201csame\u201d and\n\u201clength,\u201d simply translates to holding one position without moving.&nbsp; Power yoga uses isometric exercises along\nwith other postures that are designed to make the core and back stronger.\nFlexibility and balance stem from your core, so it is very important to train\nthis area of the body.</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">An isometric exercise involves static\ncontraction of a muscle without any visible movement in the angle of the\njoint.&nbsp; The length of the muscle and the\nangle of the joint do not change, though contraction strength may be\nvaried.&nbsp; Isometric exercise or isometrics\nare a type of strength training in which the joint angle and muscle length do\nnot change during contraction .&nbsp;&nbsp;\nIsometrics are done in static positions, rather than being dynamic\nthrough a range of motion.&nbsp; In an\novercoming isometric, the joint and muscle work against an immovable object. In\ncontrast, in a yielding isometric, the joint and muscle are held in a static\nposition while opposed by resistance.</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is in contrast to\nisotonic contractions, in which the contraction strength does not change,\nthough the muscle length and joint angle do. An isotonic contraction is one in\nwhich the muscle maintains the same tension as it shortens. Suryanamaskar is\nisotonic .</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Isotonic contractions come in two varieties:\nconcentric and eccentric. In a concentric contraction, the muscle shortens when\nits tension is greater than the force opposing it, such as your biceps does\nwhen performing an arm curl.&nbsp; In an\neccentric contraction, the force is greater than the muscle tension, causing the\nmuscle to elongate; this happens when going down stairs or sitting down in a\nchair, as the effects of gravity add to the opposing force.</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Isometric\nexercise can be done anywhere using your own body weight.&nbsp; NASA has researched the use of Yoga (\nSTATIONARY isometrics plus MOVING isotonics ) in preventing muscle atrophy\nexperienced by astronauts as a result of living in a zero gravity environment.\nContractile proteins are what cause muscles to contract and give them their\nphysical strength .</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Two types of protein in your muscles,\nactin and myosin, contribute to the basic mechanisms of isotonic\ncontraction.&nbsp;&nbsp; During this type of\ncontraction, thick strands of myosin and thin strands of actin slide over each\nother, producing shortening in each individual muscle cell and the muscle as a\nwhole. During isometric contraction, your muscles keep their normal length\nrather than shortening or lengthening.&nbsp;&nbsp;\nAn example of this kind of contraction occurs when you hold a weight in\nfront of your body in a fixed position. Without your resistance, the weight\nwould drive your arms and hands downward.</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Each posture, or asana,\nis held for a period of time and synchronised with the breath. Generally, a\nyoga session begins with gentle asanas and works up to the more vigorous or challenging\npostures. A full yoga session should exercise every part of the body and should\ninclude pranayama (breath control practices), relaxation and meditation. By\npractising just 10 minutes of yoga daily, participants with osteopenia (the\nprecursor to osteoporosis) built their bone density back up into the normal\nrange, while several participants with osteoporosis improved enough to be\nre-classified as having the milder osteopenia.</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yoga helps every\nwhich way. When all is lost yoga is the answer</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">2.47---&nbsp; prayatnashaithilyanantasamapattibhyam</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Perfection in an asana\nis achieved when the effort to perform it becomes effortless and the infinite\nbeing within is reached. </span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Perfection in asana is\nreached only when effort ceases, inculcating infinite poise and allowing the\nfinite vehicle, the body, to merge in the seer. The sadhaka can be considered\nfirm in his postures when diligent effort is no longer needed. In this\nstability, he grasps the physiology of each asana and imbues within, reaching\nthe minutest parts of the body. Then he gains the art of relaxation,\nmaintaining the firmness and extension of the body and consciousness. In this\nway he acquires a sensitive mind. With this sensitivity, he grooms his thinking\nfaculty to read, study and penetrate the infinite. He is engulfed in the boundless\nstate of oneness, which is indivisible and universal. In yoga one is always on\na razor's edge and in asana perfection must be attained through perseverance,\nalertness and insight. Without these one remains dull and makes no progress.\nSurrendering to God alone does not make one perfect, although it helps one to\nforget the tensions of life and of the efforts put in, and guides one towards\nhumbleness even when perfection in asana has been attained. When the sadhaka\nhas reached that state of balance, attention, extension, dissemination and\nrelaxation take place simultaneously in body and intelligence, and they unite\nin the seat of the soul. This is a sign of release from the dualities of\npleasure and pain, contraction and extension, heat and cold, honour and\ndishonour, etc. Perfection in asana brings unalloyed happiness, blessedness and\nbeatitude.&nbsp; Light and darkness, pleasure\nand pain, will not then disturb you.<o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The effect of asana is\nto put an end to the dichotomies or differentiation between the body and mind,\nmind and soul. None of the pairs of opposites can exist for the sadhaka who is\none with body, mind and soul. When body, mind and soul fuse in a perfect\nposture, the sadhaka is in a state of beatitude. In such a sublime position,\nthe mind, which is at the root of dualistic perception, loses its identity and\nceases to disturb him. Unity is achieved between body and mind and mind and\nsoul. Joy or sorrow, heat or cold, honour or dishonour, pain or pleasure cease\nto exist. This is perfection in action and freedom in consciousness.</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Thereafter,\none is undisturbed by the dualities.</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">After the awakening of\nkundalini, the individual will never be the same again. Here there is an ascent\nof force accompanied by a psychic awakening which is permanently accessible.</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"As\none opens the door with a key, so the yogi should open the gate to liberation\nwith the kundalini. The great goddess sleeps, closing with her mouth,, the\nopening through which one can ascend to the brahrnarandhra... to that place\nwhere there is neither pain nor suffering. The kundalini sleeps above the\nkanda... she gives liberation to the yogi and bondage to the fool. He who knows\nkundalini, knows yoga. The kundalini, it is said, is coiled like a serpent- He\nwho can induce her to move is liberated.\"&nbsp;\nHatha Yoga Pradipika v. 105-111..</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Raising the\nKundalini&nbsp; can be equated with the awakening\nof the silent areas of the brain .Our present consciousness is not independent,\nas the mind depends on the information supplied by the senses. If you have no\neyes, you can never see. However, when the super consciousness emerges,\nexperience becomes completely independent and knowledge also becomes completely\nindependent, as you can access aakashik records. Your mind attains supreme\nawareness, enlightenment and thus self realization. Unlike the rest around you,\nyou have broken free from the confines of a mental prison in which the human\nrace has been incarcerated for millennia. In&nbsp;&nbsp;\nsociety&nbsp;&nbsp; our brains&nbsp;&nbsp; are&nbsp;&nbsp;\nstructured&nbsp;&nbsp; in&nbsp;&nbsp; a&nbsp;&nbsp;\ncertain&nbsp;&nbsp; way;&nbsp;&nbsp; there&nbsp;&nbsp;\nis&nbsp;&nbsp; discipline&nbsp;&nbsp; and&nbsp;&nbsp;\ncontrol&nbsp;&nbsp; which&nbsp; inhibit&nbsp;&nbsp;\nus from expressing ourselves freely. When the awakening of kundalini\ntakes place, this conditioning is withdrawn and the lid is completely lifted\nfrom the mind.</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">With awakened consciousness you can make\naccurate decisions and judgments because awakening of kundalini is a process of\njumping out of the mind. Shiva and Shakti are in total union and only adwaita\nexists You experience the bliss of non-dual experience . There is a great\nexplosion which transports you into another plane of being .You now have the\nultimate experience of Life. You experience yourself as the greatest height and\ndepth of God's being surrounded by an infinite eternal river of bliss. Space\nand time lose their rigidity, and there is a mingling of the past, the present,\nand the future. In our dimension of consciousness, the world is not illusory.\nIt is real. But in the next higher state of consciousness it loses its\nsolidity. Chakras can then send out information carrying Soliton waves, which\ndo not attenuate.&nbsp; The Indian sage has\nexploded into a space of consciousness in which inner awareness is\nspontaneous.&nbsp; Cosmic consciousness is an\nintellectual enlightenment or illumination, an undescribable state of moral and\nintellectual elevation, a feeling of amazing bliss. Divine wisdom enables your\nconsciousness to pick up and become aware of superphysical forces and\nphenomena.</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Internal amrit or ambrosia floods your body. You now\nhave good all round health with body cells charged with energy, better\nmetabolism, clarity of vision, high perception, high quality of thinking ,\nsharpened and wider human senses psychic abilities , better attitudes,\nclairvoyance and grace under pressure. You have ignited an amazing dormant\npower inside you and now can do telepathy, mind reading, spiritual healing,\nhypnotism, hear clairaudiently , have ability to become invisible and levitate\n( with 12 strand NIL junk DNA ) , stop your heart beat and breathing, learn new\nthings quickly, do psychotelekinesis etc. You have awakened your\nmulti-dimensional consciousness, which is basically a DNA upgrade, with changes\nin the sympathetic and parasympathetic nervous systems.. Shiva represents\npurusha or consciousness and Shakti represents prakriti or energy . Yogis can\nlive on ambrosial fluid. If its secretion is awakened and controlled in the\nbody, then one needs nothing more for survival. The maintenance of the body's\nvitality becomes independent of food. You are able to enter into states of\nhibernation or suspended animation underneath the earth. Pranayama is a yoga of\nbreath , just one of the several methods , used to awaken the Kundalini \u2013 or\nrather disturb&nbsp; Shakti serpent from its\ndeep slumber at the Mooladhara chakra at the bottom of your spine using\nheat.&nbsp; Originating in Muladhara chakra ,\nthe Ida nadi ends up in the left nostril and the Pingala nadi ends up in the\nright nostril.&nbsp; Once awakened feminine\nShakti is eager to mate with her male consort Shiva at the Sahasrara chakra on\ntop of your head .&nbsp; Most human beings on\nthis planet have never awakened the divine serpent of three and a half coils ,\nand have led base , crude lives and passed on. What a waste.</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">It\nis the goal of all yogic techniques to balance and harmonize ida and pingala,\nlife force and conscious awareness, so that they join at ajna chakra to create\nthe inner light of knowledge and bliss and reveal the truth. Nadis are flows of\nenergy which move through each and every part of our body, the subtle\ncounterpart of the physical flows such as nervous energy and blood. All of the\n72000 nadis in the body are based on ida and pingala which spiral around the\nspinal cord.</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">These are the basic two modes of function on which\nall of our bodily and mental processes work. Sushumna is the royal road which\ntakes us to higher awareness and transforms the function of ida and pingala .Each\nand every cell of our body, every organ, the brain and mind, everything is\npolarized and interconnected at both the physical and subtle levels, and this\nallows us to think, speak and act in a concerted, balanced, synchronous manner,\nevery part working to help every other part. There are two basic systems in the\nbody that control this, ida and pingala, and if we stimulate any component of\none system we turn on the whole system. This&nbsp;&nbsp;\nis&nbsp;&nbsp; how&nbsp;&nbsp; asana,&nbsp;&nbsp;\npranayama,&nbsp;&nbsp; meditation,&nbsp;&nbsp; and&nbsp;&nbsp;\nthe&nbsp;&nbsp; whole&nbsp; &nbsp;armamentum&nbsp;&nbsp;\nof&nbsp;&nbsp; yogic techniques work. This\nis how yoga affects the nadis.&nbsp; Nadis are\npsychic channels for distribution of prana in the astral body. &nbsp;The brain has an almost infinite capacity, and\nall of it within the two kilograms or so of amorphous, &nbsp;&nbsp;pinkish&nbsp;&nbsp;\ngrey&nbsp;&nbsp; brain&nbsp;&nbsp; matter&nbsp;&nbsp;\nwith&nbsp;&nbsp; the&nbsp;&nbsp; consistency&nbsp;&nbsp;\nof&nbsp;&nbsp; jelly&nbsp; . How this&nbsp;\njelly-like substance remembers, thinks, analyzes, feels, discriminates,\nintuits, decides, creates and directs all the countless functions of the body,\nintegrating the whole so that we synchronize action, speech and thought, is\nsomething that each of us should ponder about.. &nbsp;The brain, houses the master control systems\nfor the body within its unlimited circuitry, and it contains the circuits for\nthe nadis and chakras. The brain is also the interface between the body and the\nmind.&nbsp; All sensory information travels to\nthe brain via the gyanendriyas ( the sense organs of knowledge ), and is then\nfed into the mind, and all decisions in the mind are then translated into the body\nvia the karmendriyas,( the organs of action ) , in a continuous, seamless ,\nsynchronous, dynamic process. Sensory-motor nervous system (SMS)&nbsp; : all electrical activity in the body moves\nin one of two directions, into the brain (afferent), ida, and out of the brain\n(efferent), pingala. Yogis called the sensory nerves which are governed by ida,\nas gyanendriyas, The motor nerves, governed by pingala,&nbsp; as karmendriyas. These nerves are concerned\nwith perception of and activity in the world. Autonomic nervous system (ANS) is\ndivided into the outward directed, stress handling, energy utilizing, pingala\ndominant, sympathetic nervous system, or the inwardly directed, rest handling,\nenergy conserving, ida dominant, parasympathetic nervous system. These two systems\ncontrol and regulate all the automatic body processes: heart, blood pressure,\nrespiration, digestion, liver and kidney and so on. Central nervous system&nbsp; (CNS)&nbsp;\nconsists&nbsp;&nbsp; of&nbsp;&nbsp; the&nbsp;&nbsp;\nbrain&nbsp;&nbsp; and&nbsp;&nbsp; spinal&nbsp;&nbsp;\ncord&nbsp;&nbsp; and contains the controls\nfor the SMS and ANS.&nbsp; The brain contains\nmuch more than this though, for it is a huge, ultimately complex computer,\nwhich stores and integrates information and puts our decisions into action in a\nsuperbly synchronized and orchestrated performance. &nbsp;Its functioning is definitely much more than\nits parts. Within the&nbsp;&nbsp; infinite&nbsp;&nbsp; circuitry&nbsp;&nbsp;\nof&nbsp;&nbsp; the&nbsp;&nbsp; brain&nbsp;&nbsp;\nresides&nbsp;&nbsp; more&nbsp;&nbsp; potential&nbsp;&nbsp;\nthan&nbsp;&nbsp; we&nbsp;&nbsp; can&nbsp;&nbsp;\nrealize&nbsp;&nbsp; in&nbsp;&nbsp; one lifetime, however, the techniques of\nyoga systematically clear and strengthen these circuits with regular practice.\nThis is what yogis have been telling us, that the circuitry for nadis and\nchakras exist within the CNS, along the spine and in the brain.</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">If\nwe can tap, purify, strengthen and reconnect these circuits via the various\nyogic techniques, we can totally transform our mind/&nbsp; body complex .</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">When one nostril\nhas dominant air flow,&nbsp; the opposite\nhemisphere of the brain is dominant.&nbsp;\nForceful breathing through the more congested nostril awakens the less\ndominant hemisphere The nasal cycle is also linked to the basic rest/activity\ncycle, which includes within the sleep cycle, the rapid eye movement (REM)\nphase and the non REM phase, because right nostril/left hemisphere dominance\ncorresponds to phases of increased activity (pingala), and left nostril/right\nhemisphere dominance corresponds to rest phases (ida).&nbsp; Buried within the brain are undreamed of\ncapabilities and potentials which can transform our lives if we can tap them. .\nChakras act as transducers, converting psychic energy into physical energy and\nvice versa. They distribute this energy to the body via the nadis. The breath\nin the right nostril is related to pingala function (left brain), and in the\nleft nostril is related to ida function (right&nbsp;&nbsp;\nbrain).&nbsp; By&nbsp;&nbsp; controlling&nbsp;&nbsp;\nthe&nbsp;&nbsp; speed,&nbsp; &nbsp;rate,&nbsp;&nbsp;\nrhythm,&nbsp;&nbsp; length&nbsp;&nbsp; and&nbsp;&nbsp;\nduration&nbsp;&nbsp; of&nbsp;&nbsp; the breath, by altering the ratio of\ninhalation to exhalation in the nostrils and by stopping the breath, we can\nactivate or tone down neurological and mental processes so as to achieve\nheightened awareness and altered states of consciousness.</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Each\nlevel in the chakra system is the sum total of various physical, emotional,\nmental, psychic and spiritual elements. Each chakra has its own neurological\nplexus and endocrine gland and these link up to various organs and systems in\nthe body. They in turn are connected to the controlling mechanisms of the\nbrain, each of which has emotional, mental and psychic components. The chakra\nis like a transducer, a linking point between the various levels of our being\nand it converts and channels energy either up or down to the various levels.</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ajna\nchakra has as its symbol the two-petalled lotus, and we can think of this as\nrepresenting the two hemispheres of the brain with the pineal gland as its main\nfocusing central point . Cosmic consciousness takes place in sahasrara.&nbsp; The human brain is still in an organic state\nof evolution toward higher levels of consciousness.</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\ndriving force of that evolution, is the Kundalini energy. Kundalini Awakening is\nonly triggered when you are ready to go through it, because your higher self is\nactually the source that triggers it.&nbsp;\nYour higher-self which is vastly intelligent is not going to give you\nsomething which is threatening to your survival.&nbsp; Resistance to change has always been the\nhuman problem, and this resistance comes from our fixed ego aspect. &nbsp;Our true self wants to evolve and change.&nbsp; Kundalini awakening is a growing phenomenon\nand when it happens we cannot turn it off . Kundalini transformation has the\npurpose to dissolve the last elements of your ego and enlighten you in the\nbody.</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">To\nbecome enlightened you have to let go of attachment to all material aspects,\nwhich include body, mind and emotions . You are entering into unknown fields,\nyet there is a rock of stability and that is your ability to be aware . The\nmore you let go of attachment to physical aspects, the more you are guided and\nthe more self-sovereign you become. The more you let go, the more aware you\nbecome. This is truly a journey that everyone must take alone, once you are\nprepared for the journey,&nbsp; under a guru. Nadis\nexist in the etheric body, unseen to the naked eye and is based on energy\ncurrents, vibration and psychic energy . Kundalini rises only when the state of\npurification of the nadis and chakras has progressed far enough.&nbsp; The goal of many of the yoga practices is to\npurify the nadis, and then to cause the prana and apana to meet and rise up\nthrough the sushumna.</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Balancing Ida and Pingala&nbsp; balances the sympathetic and parasympathetic\nbranches of the autonomic nervous system, reducing the elevated flight or fight\nresponse.&nbsp; In other words, the single act\nof balancing the breath is a tremendous aid in physical stress reduction, in\naddition to being a spiritual practice setting the stage for Kundalini\nAwakening.&nbsp; &nbsp;Like I said before out of these 72,000 subtle\nnadis only 3 nadis are very important.&nbsp;\nThey are Ida, Pingala and Sushumna.&nbsp;\nThe 10 main nadis which carry prana out of the 72000 are Ida, Pingala,\nSushumna, Gandhari, Hastijihva, Pusa, Yusasvini, Alambusa, Kuhuh and Sankhini .\nThe Ida is feminine ( irrespective of gender ) , left sympathetic nervous\nsystem, on LH side of spinal cord,&nbsp;\ntamas- yin negative charge polarity energy, represented by cooling moon,\nconnecting to left nostril, controls mental processes, connects to RH brain\nlobe, pale colour. &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Pingala is\nmasculine ( irrespective ofgender ) , on RH side of spinal cord,&nbsp; rajas-yang positive charge polarity energy ,\nrepresented by heating sun, connecting to right nostril, controls vital\nprocesses, connects to RH brain lobe, red colour, &nbsp;Both ida and pingala ends between the eye\nbrows\u2014at Shiva\u2019s third eye.</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Medullar Sushumna, which\ninterpenetrates the cerebrospinal axis from the perineum to the juncture of the\nlamboid and sagittal suture of the cranium, and is associated with both\nnostrils being open and free to the passage of air.&nbsp; &nbsp;Sushumna-Sattwa\nis at the back of the anus, in the middle of the Spinal chord and is the most\nimportant of all nadis, neutral charge energy . It is attached to the spinal\ncolumn and extends to the Brahmarandhra of the head and is invisible and\nsubtle. &nbsp;If the coiled-up energy,\nKundalini, passes up along the Sushumna Nadi and is taken up from Chakra to\nChakra the Yogi gets different sorts of experiences, powers and Ananda ( bliss\n). When ida and pingala get balanced and unite in the activated sushumna, pure\nconsiousness arises.&nbsp; It is only when\nprana moves into the sushumna that the latent spiritual power of&nbsp; kundalini can be awakened. Kundalaini is the\npower of pure consciousness, the dynamic potential of the soul. It is the\nDivine Mother Herself, visualized as a serpent coiled three and a half times,\nwith its tail in its mouth.</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">One of the objects of activating\nthe spiral fire and its progress up the spine to the head is to awaken the\npineal gland, which results in the opening of the third eye and the consequent\nrevelation of the subtler planes of life When it reaches the brain, the yogi is\nperfectly detached from the body and mind; the soul finds itself free. Again,\nthe goal of the sadhaka ( the man who does meditation) in his sadhana\n(meditating practice) is to bring the hood of the kundalini to Sahasrara chakra\nthrough Sushumna situated in between Ida and Pingala.&nbsp; That is when the hood reaches head or\nSahasrara chakra, the tail of the 3.5 coiled serpent will reach\nMooladharachakra. While doing meditation the awakened kundalini should raise\nneither through left side Ida nor through right Pingala but through centre\nSushumna nadi only. If not the sadhaka will get traumatic results.</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ida\nand pingala function alternately and directly influence the temperature of the\nbody, digestive and hormonal secretions, the brainwaves and all the bodily\nsystems. Ida and pingala function according to a natural cycle, but on account\nof poor eating habits, pollution&nbsp; and\ninharmonious lifestyles, the natural cycle is often disturbed. &nbsp;Sometimes one nadi predominates and the other\nis suppressed. This leads to mental and physical imbalances and generally\nresults in disease. Therefore, ida and pingala must be disciplined or made to\nfunction according to the laws of nature. Only when there is harmony between\nthese two nadis can sushumna be awakened. &nbsp;When sushumna awakens, kundalini ascends\nstraight to sahasrara and one becomes a jivanmukta, a liberated soul . \"A\nhundred and one are the arteries of the heart, one of them leads up to the\ncrown of the head. Going upward through that, one becomes immortal.\" (CU\n8.6.6) Chandogya Upanishad 5000 BC.<o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">From then on, the\nsadhaka is undisturbed by dualities.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sahasrara is the\nculmination of yoga, the perfect union between shiva and Shakti and the\nunfolding of enlightenment.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">When this\nunion takes place, the moment of self-realization or samadhi begins. At this\npoint the individual man dies.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">I don't\nmean that physical death occurs, it is death of the mundane awareness or\nindividual awareness.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is death of the\nexperience of name and form. At this time you don't</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">remember</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">the</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">or</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">the experiencer are one and the same. The seer, seeing and and seen are\nmerged as a unified whole. In other words, there is no multiple or dual\nawareness. There is only single awareness. When Shiva and Shakti unite, nothing\nremains, there is absolute silence. Shakti does not remain Shakti and Shiva is\nno more Shiva, both are mingled into one and they can no longer be identified\nas two different forces.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">In due course the\nKundalini energy comes down, ideally taking residence in the heart anahata\nchakra,&nbsp; balancing upper and lower\nchakras.&nbsp; You live a normal life,\nassociating with everybody and discharging your worldly obligations like other\npeople do.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Now you are in the\nmidst of games of victory and defeat,&nbsp;\nattachments and infatuations,&nbsp; but\nyou just play a game.&nbsp; You know it; you\ndo everything as an actor.&nbsp; You are not\ninvolved in it life and soul .&nbsp; People\nrecognize you as a divine incarnation reality.&nbsp;\nWhen Shiva and Shakti descend to the gross level of awareness there is\nagain duality. That is why the self-realized man is able to understand pain and\nall the mundane affairs of life.&nbsp; He\nunderstands the whole drama of duality, multiplicity and diversity.&nbsp; Sometimes we ordinary mortals are at a fix to\nunderstand how this man with the highest attainment is able to cope with the\nhopeless dualities of life.&nbsp; Shakti rules\nthe matter and Shiva rules the consciousness, and when they descend to the\ngross plane, Shakti continues to rule the matter and Shiva, being\nconsciousness, gives an understanding to the whole world.</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">As\nthe liberated energy (Kundalini) courses through the system, it actually sweeps\naway samskaras \u2013 karmic traces from the past that are still imprinted in the\nbody and mind \u2013 like floodwaters clearing clogged debris from a river bed.</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">When\nShiva and Shakti unite in sahasrara, one experiences samadhi, illumination\noccurs in the brain and the silent areas begin to function . Shiva and Shakti\nremain merged together for some time, and during this period there is a total\nloss of consciousness pertaining to each other.&nbsp;\nAt that time a bindu evolves. Bindu means a point, a drop, and that\nbindu is the substratum of the whole cosmos.&nbsp;\nWithin that bindu is the seat of human intelligence and the seat of the\ntotal creation. Then the bindu splits into two , Shiva and Shakti manifest\nagain in duality. When ascension took place it was only the ascent of Shakti,\nbut now, when descension takes place, Shiva and Shakti both descend to the\ngross plane and there is again knowledge of duality.</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kundalini\nin Sanskrit literally means \u201ccoil.\u201d Kundalini is the cosmic energy that lays\ndormant at the base of the spine in the perineum, and is symbolically depicted\nas a serpent.</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Keep your mind open about all this. font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">In the Tantric cosmology, the whole\nuniverse is perceived as being created, penetrated and sustained by two\nfundamental forces, which are permanently in a perfect, indestructible UNION.&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">These forces or universal aspects are called Shiva and Shakti. <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">In Hinduism we have\nplaced the female on a pedestal . No man can do a yagam if he is a bachelor or\na widower.&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">Purusha is the embodiment of pure consciousness, and Pragati as the\nembodiment of pure energy. <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">Both Shiva and Shakti\nare Consciousness---- Shiva is the changeless static aspect of Consciousness,\nand Shakti is the kinetic, active aspect of the same Consciousness.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">Through uniting with\nPurusha , Pragati gave form to his spirit and created the universe.(we are\ntalking about <b><span style=\"color: blue;\">CREATION OF THE COSMOS </span></b>here- not street side sex&nbsp; as figured out by small minds)<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">When the insentient\nPrakriti comes in contact with the sentient Purusha , the universe evolves. <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">Purusha ( Shiva ) symbolizes\nconsciousness, the masculine principle. Prakriti ( Shakti/ Parvati ) symbolizes\nthe feminine principle, the activating energy.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">The cosmos in all its\nmanifestations, as an act of love.&nbsp; The\nrelationship between say- Shakti and Shiva is the dance of consciousness and\nenergy experienced within each of us, regardless of gender.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">Shiva resides in the\nhighest Sahasr\u0101ra Chakra and Shakti ( Parvati ) in the lowest M\u016bl\u0101dh\u0101ra Chakra.\n&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple;\">Above: Ganesha controls the perineal\nknot of Brahma Granthi .&nbsp;&nbsp; Granthis are\nthe energy knots or blocks in our personality where the energy and consciousness\ninteract, to manifest in a particular way. &nbsp;The three Granthis are of &nbsp;the TRINITY who always work in harmony ( Brahma/ Vishnu / Shiva )</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;
