, &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092e\u0928\u0940\u0937\u093e\u092e\u0943\u0924\u0938\u094d\u092f</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092a\u0926\u0947</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0915\u0935\u092f\u094b</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0928\u093f</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092a\u093e\u0928\u094d\u0924\u093f</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0965\u0968\u0965</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0905\u092a\u0936\u094d\u092f\u0902</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0917\u094b\u092a\u093e\u092e\u0928\u093f\u092a\u0926\u094d\u092f\u092e\u093e\u0928\u092e\u093e</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u091a</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092a\u0930\u093e</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u091a</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092a\u0925\u093f\u092d\u093f\u0936\u094d\u091a\u0930\u0928\u094d\u0924\u092e\u094d</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0964</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0938</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0938\u0927\u094d\u0930\u0940\u091a\u0940\u0903</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0938</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0935\u093f\u0937\u0942\u091a\u0940\u0930\u094d\u0935\u0938\u093e\u0928</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0906</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0935\u0930\u0940\u0935\u0930\u094d\u0924\u093f</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092d\u0941\u0935\u0928\u0947\u0937\u094d\u0935\u0928\u094d\u0924\u0903</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0965\u0969\u0965</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><br /></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>The wise behold with\ntheir mind in their heart the Sun, made manifest by the illusion of the Asura;<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>The sages look into the\nsolar orb, the ordainers desire the region of his rays.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>The Sun bears the word\nin his mind; the Gandharva has spoken it within the wombs;<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>sages cherish it in the\nplace of sacrifice, brilliant, heavenly, ruling the mind.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>I beheld the protector,\nnever descending, going by his paths to the east and the west;<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>clothing the quarters\nof the heaven and the intermediate spaces. He constantly revolves in the midst\nof the worlds.</i> \u2014\u2009Rig veda X.177.1-3, 5000 BC<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The above Maya-bheda\nhymn discerns, using symbolic allegory, a contrast between mind influenced by\nlight (sun) and magic (illusion of Asura). The hymn is a call to discern one's\nenemies, perceive artifice, and distinguish, using one's mind, between that\nwhich is perceived and that which is unperceived.&nbsp; You can hardly expect Kancha Ilaiah SQUEAK\nnay Shepherd to understand such pregnant wisdom.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Verses 4.9 to 4.10 of\nSvetasvatara Upanishad, expound that Brahman ( the field) is the hidden\nreality, nature is magic, Brahman is the magician, human beings are infatuated\nwith the magic and thus they create bondage to illusions and delusions, and for\nfreedom and liberation one must seek true insights and correct knowledge of the\nprinciples behind the hidden magic.</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to Bhagawad\nGeeta, a human being needs to be free from the delusion of the duality. Only\nafter delusion of the duality is removed then only one can realize One\nParamaatma<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>iccha-dvesa-samutthena<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>dvandva-mohena bharata<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>sarva-bhutani sammoham<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>sarge yanti\nparantapa</i>-&nbsp; Bhagawad Gita 4000 BC<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">O scion of Bharata\n[Arjuna], O conquerer of all foes, all living entities are born into delusion,\novercome by dualities .&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Those who are so\ndeluded by dualities are completely foolish and therefore cannot understand the\nSupreme Personality of Godhead.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The reason for the\nseverity of such ignorance is spoken by Lord Krishna with the words sarva\nbhutani sammoham meaning all forms of life are completely deluded. At one's\nvery birth when the physical body comes into existence the delusion begins due\nto the influence of dualities.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A human being need to\nlift the veil of delusion. The delusion is about duality. The soul is a part of\nbrahmAn.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>YeShaam Tu Antagatam\nPaapam <o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Janaanaam\nPuNya-KarmaNaam&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Te Dvandva Moha\nNirmuktaaH <o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Bhajante Maam\nDruDha-VrataaH</i>&nbsp; --&nbsp; Bhagawad Gita 4000 BC<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But those men of\nvirtuous deeds, whose sins have come to an end, who are freed from the delusion\nof the pairs of opposites; worship Me by remaining steadfast in their resolve.&nbsp; But they who worship me in every way are\nselflessly engaged in good deeds, free from sin and delusion, arising from the\nconflicts of attachment and repulsion, and of firm intent.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The very beginning of\ncreation gave rise to the law of duality\u2014the law of relativity necessary to\ndivide the One into the many. By the storm of vibration, God's thoughts of\nmultiplicity brought forth the waves of manifestation: His lila, or divine\nplay. Objects in the phenomenal world are called relative because they exist\nonly in relation to each other. Man's ordinary consciousness is relativity\nconsciousness \u2014i.e., he apprehends one thing only by interpreting it relative\nto something else. He cannot perceive the One, the Absolute, through that\nrelative consciousness; it was given to him in order to appreciate the nature\nof the many.&nbsp; Ordinary waking consciousness,\nsubconsciousness, super-subconsciousness\u2014all forms of ego consciousness\u2014share\nthis characteristic: they are relative. The pure superconsciousness of the soul\ncan apprehend Spirit, the Life and Substance underlying and pervading\neverything in the universe. This Unmanifested Absolute cannot be described\nexcept that It was \u2013 ( Delusion arises from the duality of attraction and\naversion, Arjuna; every creature is deluded by these from birth.Bhagawad Gita )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>yadrccha-labha-santusto<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>dvandvatito vimatsarah<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>samah siddhav asiddhau\nca<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>krtvapi na nibadhyate-</i>\nBhagawad Gita , 4000 BC<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He who is satisfied\nwith gain which comes of its own accord, who is free from duality and does not\nenvy, who is steady both in success and failure, is never entangled, although\nperforming actions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The liberated Yogi can\nparticipate in any kind of action without being disturbed by the duality of the\nmaterial world..&nbsp; He is&nbsp; above duality because he does not hesitate to\nact in any way.&nbsp; Therefore he is steady\nboth in success and in failure. These signs are visible when one is fully in\ntranscendental knowledge.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In this world of\nrelativity, nothing is exactly the same as it was a moment ago. It is said that\none cannot bathe twice in the same stream. Everything in the universe is a\nstream of relativity that is in perpetual flux. In even inert objects, the\nconstituent atoms are in constant motion, and some decay or change is taking\nplace.&nbsp; We are here today, tomorrow we\nare gone, mere shadows in a cosmic dream. But behind the unreality of these\nfleeting pictures is the immortality of Spirit. This world is a world of maya,\ndelusion, and man is kept hypnotized with that delusion. This is the leela of\nGod.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Duality is set equal to\nopposites, however there is no opposites, but only less or more of!<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The TRINITY ( Brahma/\nVishnu/ Shiva ) causes and controls Maya. If Maharishis Dayanand shunned the cosmic\nforces of trinity he knows SHIT about Maya. &nbsp;If he knows SHIT about Maya , he knows SHIT\nabout Sanatana Dharma.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The ancient Vedic\nscriptures declare that the physical world operates under one fundamental law\nof maya, the principle of relativity and duality. God, the Sole Life, is an\nAbsolute Unity; He cannot appear as the separate and diverse manifestations of\na creation except under a false or unreal veil. That cosmic illusion is maya.\nEvery great scientific discovery of modern times has served as a confirmation\nof this simple pronouncement of the ancient Maharishis.\u2014Brahman satyam jagat\nmithya: \"Brahman is real. His manifestation is unreal\". A shadow\ncannot be produced without an object; therefore the shadow is not nothing! The\nshadow appears to be like the object from which it is produced, yet it is not\nthe object. To rise above the duality of creation and perceive the unity of the\nCreator was conceived of as man's highest goal. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Those who cling to the\ncosmic illusion must accept its essential law of polarity: &nbsp;flow/ ebb, &nbsp;rise/ fall, &nbsp;day/ night, &nbsp;evaporation/ condensation, &nbsp;pleasure / pain, &nbsp;good / evil, &nbsp;birth/ decay, &nbsp;freezing/ melting, &nbsp;potential energy/ kinetic energy, &nbsp;attraction/ repulsion,&nbsp; north pole / south pole, &nbsp;acid/ base, positive pole/ negative pole,&nbsp; clockwise vortex/ anticlockwise vortex,&nbsp; sleep/ wake,&nbsp;\nenergy / matter,&nbsp; static/\ndynamic,&nbsp; proton/ electron,&nbsp; cathode / anode,&nbsp; open/ shut etc.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 250%;\"></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 250%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 250%;\"></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 250%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 250%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 250%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The only constant on\nthe planet is change, everything is in a state of flux, nothing is static--\neverything is vibratory.&nbsp; This is what\nguarantees growth and evolution. It is a cosmic spiraling dance of&nbsp; separate opposing forces, which sustains this\nuniverse. A yogi understands the story of the six blind men and the elephant. No\nlife is possible on earth without this subtle tension . Yang elements are clear\nand obvious while Yin elements are subtle or hidden behind the quantum screen..\nWhat has a front has a back-- what has a beginning has an end. It is a perfect\ntango of dynamic balance where one polar opposite changes into another smoothly\nand constantly . If the restraining balance or equilibrium is lost , the\nuniverse will spiral out of control and end. This principle of Dvaita Hinduism\n-- Tamas Rajas , which are rooted together , is present in every phenomenon on\nearth., where energy transforms from one to another\u2014it can neither be created\nor destroyed. These two opposing forces are natural and transform each other ,\nin perfect harmony.&nbsp; Harmony can never be\nstagnant .&nbsp; Lessening of Tamas always\nresults in increase of Rajas and vice versa.. One cannot exist without the\nother and they are dependant .&nbsp; No\nphenomenon in this universe is completely devoid of its opposite.&nbsp; They consume each other yet support each\nother.Whatever is in excess gets reduces, whatever is deficient gets\nreplenished. Balance can never be permanent\u2014 Tamas and Rajas continiously\ndevour each other \u2013 and life flows on.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Delusion divides,\nmeasures out, the Undefined Infinite into finite forms and forces. The working\nof cosmic delusion on these individualizations is called avidya, individual\nillusion or ignorance, which imparts a specious reality to their existence as\nseparate from Spirit.&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Spirit alone is\nperfect. Everything in creation, being delimited, is imperfect.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The soul was born with\nthe stars , it can never die. Birth and death have meaning only in the world of\nrelativity. Life and death are relativities of thought only. Vedanta points out\nthat God is the only Reality; all creation or separate existence is maya or\nillusion. The consciousness of the unenlightened person is blinded by four\nsuccessive veils of maya, delusion, which prevent him from perceiving Truth or\nGod.&nbsp; From their very birth children are\nexposed to cosmic delusion and grow up helplessly under it. God gives them\ndelusion first, and not Himself, in order to carry on His dramatic scheme of\ncreation. \u2013his leela . If He did not cover Himself with the veils of maya,\nthere could be no Cosmic Game of creation, in which men play hide-and-seek with\nHim and try to find Him as the Grand Prize. There would&nbsp; no soul evolution. There would be no feed\nback loop where soul merges with the mother field of brahmAn after moksha and\ndownloads its individual experience, gleaned over &nbsp;thousands of re-births &nbsp;, which causes brahmAn to know everything.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Time is often referred\nto as the fourth dimension, along with the three spatial dimensions , the\nconcept of time depends on the spatial reference frame of the observer. Time\ndilation which made THIEF Einstein famous is stolen from the Vedas. We all know\nthat pleasure and action make the hours seem short. Have you not hidden and\ntried to have a glimpse of your sweetheart , or spent long time over a creative\nfavourite hobby ?&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is because heart\nknows neither duality nor the limitations of space and time.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Time is in essence a\ngrand illusion that has taken a hold of our consciousness and conditioned our\nreality to believe in it, thus we then become enslaved by the illusion and\nsuffer the karmas associated with it. In the Singularity of Source, there is no\ntime - only an Infinitely Conscious Presence of Being that exists in all forms\nand all spaces at once. As one comes to recognize Source, one is freed from the\nbonds of time and all karmic causality is destroyed. In the Immortal Timeless\nPresence of Source - the past (or the future!) have no power and one becomes a\nKarma Immune Being. This is an extremely powerful vibratory state to exist in\nand by residing here one is free from ALL conditionings, delusions, illusions\nand cycles of time.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Karma no longer has\npower over one because the Law of Cause and Effect needs a temporal (time)\nbubble to exist within.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Outside of time,\nnothing can precede anything or condition any future moment, for there is no\nfuture to affect. In the same vein, the energy of the past peels away from\none's being and becomes nothing.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The causal links\nbetween the past and the present are severed, thus no karma can possibly ripen\nor even exist in the Timeless State. As for the redemption and forgiveness of\nkarma, the embodiment of Source Presence is the most powerful - and ultimately\nthe only real mechanism behind karmic cleansing.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The mind in the 3rd\ndimension cannot perceive directly the Timeless Singularity of Source, for the\nmind exists within duality, and within duality all things appear distinctly\nseparate.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">In order to perceive all of\nthese distinctively separate phenomena, the mind projects a 'holding space' for\nthese phenomena called space-time. The space aspect creates a medium for\ndistinguishing everything and providing a contrast between one phenomenon\n(object, sound, smell or any other kind of sensation) and another.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">3-dimensional space has no inherent reality\nof its own and cannot be perceived to exist as a 'stand-alone' phenomenon. It\nalways requires some kind of phenomena so as to be distinguishable. The\nconstruct of space allows the mind to see where one form ends and another\nbegins. Man should realize the ethereal nature of his being\u2014made of light and\nconsciousness, divine and indestructible, projected on the screen of time and\nspace by the creative Cosmic Beam of God. In Spirit there is no past or future,\nonly the everlasting Present. It is in the relativistic consciousness of\npersons under the influence of maya that Eternity appears separated into past,\npresent, and future. God always is, and His immortal omniscience is not\ncompartmentalized by the dimensional delusions of time and space; He beholds\neverything as happening in the infinitude of His Being now. Human consciousness\nis limited by the threefold relativity of time\u2014 past, present, and future. Man\nusually forgets past happenings, has consciousness of the present incidents in\nhis life, and is unaware of the future. But God's consciousness is ever aware\nthroughout eternity. Divine consciousness has no past, no future, because it is\nnever interrupted, like man's, by death or limitation. Bhagawad Gita tells us\nthat eternal consciousness has one time\u2014the ever present. God looks through the\nwindow of infinite consciousness on the films of finite happenings of the past,\npresent, and future shown on the screen of time and space, continuously moving\nbackward and forward in an eternal now.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Maya or avidya can\nnever be destroyed through intellectual conviction or analysis, but solely\nthrough attaining the interior state of nirbikalpa samadhi. ...</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nirvikalpa (\"without difference\")\nsamadhi is the highest yoga or union manifested by fully liberated masters or\nthose on the threshold of soul freedom. There are two manifestations of the\ndarkness of delusion: one is maya, cosmic delusion, \"that which measures\nthe Infinite\"; and the other is avidya, which means ignorance or\nindividual illusion.. Maya is the mass hypnosis of God by which He makes every\nhuman being believe in the same illusory \"reality\" of creation as\nperceived by the senses; avidya gives individuality of form, experience, and\nexpression (it supports the ego or I-consciousness). Man's essential nature is\nformless omnipresent Spirit. Compulsory or karmic embodiment is the result of\navidya, ignorance. The Hindu scriptures teach that birth and death are\nmanifestations of maya, cosmic delusion.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Again duality is the\nstate of separation from Oneself (Reality, Supreme conscious, God). The face\nyou see in the mirror is not you\u2014it is like the shirt your wear. YOU are the\nsoul within you, a part of brahmAn sent to earth to evolve and gain experience.\nWhen one is separated from oneself, he goes into deep sorrow, depression,\ndespondency and dilemma and his mind is filled with doubts, emotional conflicts,\nanger and fear. Due to these negative emotions, he becomes both physically and\nemotionally weak and loses his capability to cope with challenges in day to day\nlife and feels lost. In the path of duality, one thinks that God is separate\nfrom him (duality) and tries to attain God-Realization through complex and\nmeaningless external means , most of them add to the karmic baggage , instead\nof reducing it &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">One develops attachment\nto sense objects by thinking about them. From attachment arises desire for them.\nFrom unfulfilled desires comes anger. From anger comes delusion; from delusion\nconfusion of memory; from disappearance of memory and a bewildered mind;\nreasoning (discrimination) is destroyed. When reasoning is destroyed, one falls\nfrom right path. (Bhagawad Gita. 2.62-63)</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Those who are free from\negoism (Arrogance, I-ness) and delusion, who have conquered the evil of\nattachment, who are totally free from selfish desires and dualities like\npleasure and pain and dwelling constantly in the Supreme-Self, such\ndelusion\u2013free ones attain the Supreme state, Oneness with God, Sat Chit Ananda\n(Eternal Goal). ( Bhagawad Gita. 15.05)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Bhagavad Gita,\ngives a step by step method to develop non-duality/Oneness though\nself-discipline, self-awareness, self-purification and self-transformation. Practice\nof non-duality helps to develop good health, mental peace and freedom from\nmiseries in the material world and beyond. Not only does one develop eternal\nhappiness and peace, one also enjoys his life to the fullest and attains the\npurpose of his existence, and contribute to society and bring happiness and\npeace to others.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Maya stands for\nanything that has real, material form, human or non-human, but that does not\nreveal the hidden principles and implicit knowledge that creates it. The\nUpanishads describe the universe, and the human experience, as an interplay of\nPurusha (the eternal, unchanging principles, consciousness) and Prak\u1e5biti (the\ntemporary, changing material world, nature). The former manifests itself as\natman (Soul, Self), and the latter as Maya. The Upanishads refer to the\nknowledge of Atman as \"true knowledge\" (Vidya), and the knowledge of\nMaya as \"not true knowledge\" (Avidya, Nescience, lack of awareness,\nlack of true knowledge).&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Maya pre-exists and\nco-exists with Brahman \u2013 the Ultimate Principle, Consciousness. Maya is\nperceived reality, one that does not reveal the hidden principles, the true\nreality. Maya is unconscious, Atman is conscious. Maya is the literal, Brahman\nis the figurative Upadana \u2013 the principle, the cause. Maya is born, changes,\nevolves, dies with time, from circumstances, due to invisible principles of\nnature, state the Upanishads. Atman-Brahman is eternal, unchanging, invisible\nprinciple, unaffected absolute and resplendent consciousness. Maya concept in\nthe Upanishads, is \"the indifferent aggregate of all the possibilities of\nemanatory or derived existences, pre-existing with Brahman\", just like the\npossibility of a future tree pre-exists in the seed of the tree.</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Soul is imagined\nfirst, then the particularity of objects,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">External and internal,\nas one knows so one remembers.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As a rope, not\nperceived distinctly in dark, is erroneously imagined,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As snake, as a streak\nof water, so is the Soul (Atman) erroneously imagined.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As when the rope is\ndistinctly perceived, and the erroneous imagination withdrawn,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Only the rope remains,\nwithout a second, so when distinctly perceived, the Atman.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When he as Pranas\n(living beings), as all the diverse objects appears to us,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Then it is all mere Maya,\nwith which the Brahman (Supreme Soul) deceives himself.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2014\u2009Gaudapada, M\u0101\u1e47\u1e0dukya Karik\u0101\n2.16-19<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Maya, Sarvasara\nUpanishad defines Maya as all what is not Atman. Maya has no beginning, but has\nan end. Maya, is anything that can be studied and subjected to proof and\ndisproof, anything with Gu\u1e47as. In the human search for Self-knowledge, Maya is\nthat which obscures, confuses and distracts an individual.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Just as when the dirt\nis removed, the real substance is made manifest; just as when the darkness of\nthe night is dispelled, the objects that were shrouded by the darkness are\nclearly seen, when ignorance [Maya] is dispelled, truth is realized.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2014\u2009Vashistha, Yoga Vasi\u1e63\u1e6dha<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A primary cause of\nsuffering is delusion: our inability, because of a subtly willful blindness, to\nsee things the way they truly are but instead in a distorted way. The world a\nseamless and dynamic unity: a single living organism that is constantly\nundergoing change. Our minds, however, chop it up into separate, static bits\nand pieces, which we then try mentally and physically to manipulate, powered by\nEGO. One of the mind's most dear creations is the idea of the person and,\nclosest to home, of a very special person which each one of us calls\n\"I\": a separate, enduring ego or self. In a moment, then, the\nseamless universe is cut in two. There is \"I\" -- and there is all the\nrest. That means conflict -- and pain, for \"I\" cannot control that\nfathomless vastness against which it is set. The very beginning of creation\ngave rise to the law of duality\u2014light and darkness. By the storm of vibration,\nGod's thoughts of multiplicity brought forth the waves of manifestation: His\nlila, or divine play. Objects in the phenomenal world are called relative\nbecause they exist only in relation to each other. Man's ordinary consciousness\nis relativity consciousness \u2014i.e., he apprehends one thing only by interpreting\nit relative to something else. He cannot perceive the One, the Absolute,\nthrough that relative consciousness; it was given to him in order to appreciate\nthe nature of the many. Ordinary waking consciousness, subconsciousness,\nsuper-subconsciousness\u2014all forms of ego consciousness\u2014share this\ncharacteristic: they are relative. The pure superconsciousness of the soul can\napprehend Spirit, the Life and Substance underlying and pervading everything in\nthe universe. This Unmanifested Absolute cannot be described except that It was\nthe Knower, the Knowing, and the Known existing as One. In It the being, Its\ncosmic consciousness, and Its omnipotence, all were without differentiation:\never-existing, ever-conscious, ever newly joyous Spirit. In this Ever-New\nBliss, there was no space or time, no dual conception or law of relativity;\neverything that was, is, or is to be existed as One Undifferentiated Spirit..\nThus, Spirit first gave rise to a Magic Delusion, Maya, the cosmic Magical\nMeasurer, which produces the illusion of dividing a portion of the Indivisible\nInfinite into separate finite objects.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Through the power of\nmaya, cosmic illusion, the Creator has caused the manifestations of matter to\nappear so distinct and specific that to the human mind they seem unrelated in\nany way to Spirit. The phenomenal world operates under maya, the law of duality\nor oppositional states; it is thus an unreal world that veils the truth of the Divine\nOneness and Unchangeableness. When a yogi awakens in soul consciousness all\ndualities disappear and he knows himself as the eternal and blissful Spirit.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">When one realizes\noneself, one realizes the essential nature of the universe. That the existence of\nduality is only an illusion and when the illusion is undone, the primordial\nunity of one\u2019s own nature and the nature of the universe is realized, or made\nreal.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Non-duality (Advaita) is the\nphilosophical, spiritual, and scientific understanding of the non-separation\nand inherent Oneness with the Supreme. It refers to the identity of the Self\n(Atman) and the Whole (Brahman).&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">What is matter? Nothing\nbut a particular rate of vibration of God's cosmic energy. No form in the\nuniverse is really solid. That which appears so is merely a compact or gross\nvibration of His energy.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\nscientifically indisputable truth that matter is in reality a concentrate of\nenergy.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Man thinks of his mortal form as\nsolid flesh and bone. That is a concrete delusion. The body is an amalgam of\ncountless infinitesimal subatomic particles; these particles are made up of\nfiner-than-atomic lifetronic energy and ultimately of thoughtrons, sparks of\nconsciousness whose source is Cosmic Consciousness. Everything existing in\nnature is energy in a more or less compact stage of vibration, exhibiting\nweight according to its mass or distinguishing gravitation. The seemingly solid\nbody is itself a nonmaterial electromagnetic wave made up ultimately of\nunderlying astral lifetrons, which in turn are made of Cosmic Consciousness.\nGod has ingeniously condensed His consciousness into lifetrons, lifetrons into\nelectrons and protons, these subatomic particles into atoms, and atoms into\nmolecules and cells\u2014all of which live by radiations from the Cosmic Source.\nDelusion divides, measures out, the Undefined Infinite into finite forms and\nforces. The working of cosmic delusion on these individualizations is called\navidya, individual illusion or ignorance, which imparts a specious reality to\ntheir existence as separate from Spirit. Spirit alone is perfect. Everything in\ncreation, being delimited, is imperfect--even as a calm ocean becomes distorted\ninto individual waves on its surface by the action of a storm.</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201c O Arjuna, transcends these Gunas, free\nyourself from duality (pairs of opposites), be unconcerned with acquisition and\npreservation and be established in purity (Supreme-Self) with your mind under\nfull control.\u201d (Bhagawad Gita. 2.45)</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The self disciplined\nperson, who has control over the lower self (mind, senses and body) and remains\nfirmly established in the Supreme-Self, has attained tranquility and\neverlasting peace. Such a person is always balanced in heat and cold, in\npleasure and pain, and also in honor and dishonor (duality). (Bhagawad\nGita.6.07)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span><br />\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c7377505291244920845\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_24M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">CHAPTER I-&nbsp; SAMADHI PADA-&nbsp;&nbsp; CONTEMPLATION<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">atha yoganushasanam<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">yogashchittavrittinirodhah<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">tada drashtuh svaroope\navasthanam<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;
